Even though it was pretty busy she seemed to still know that we existed and didn't forget about us which is something i've run into at couple other restaurants.   I'd come back here again, the food here is good and the service was an A in book.

Reviews.Author: Brandie B.
Reviews.Content: This place was worth waiting in line in the bitter cold for.  (My first time in Boston, i'm a CA native, I thought I was GOING TO DIE!)Do not wait in the doorway, you will be barked at.  The restaurant is very small and cramped, so if you choose to come here anyway, don't complain, it's just the way it is!I had the frutti de mare and it was delicious.  The fried calamari is amazing.  My boyfriend and I each had wine, and I believe our bill was still under $60.  I will be back when I return to Boston.

Reviews.Author: Brad M.
Reviews.Content: I'm going to give Giacomo's its deserved 5 stars, but I'm also going to say that it's overrated. If you're looking for a nice quiet restaurant to go with super high quality pasta, I'm going to say that Giacomo's is not what you're looking for. Giacomo's pasta is definitely good, don't get me wrong, but it's not the same caliber as you might get at other high-end Italian restaurants. And the place is so small that it's super noisy. This is particularly true if you sit next to a group like we sat next to. You know the type, where it seems that each member of the group is competing with each other to see how loud each one of them can laugh, as if laughing loud is somehow a substitute for having something interesting to say. But Giacomo's is good. What does it have going for it? The atmosphere is very warm and casual. I'm not Italian, but I imagine it's like going to a busy Italian family reunion. The food is, for its quality, pretty cheap. This is a place you could consider eating at every night (if you could stand waiting in line for an hour to eat). So while I would say that purely in terms of quality, Giacomo's would not be able to compete with other high-end Italian restaurants I've been to, it is definitely probably #1 in my mind, or close to it,  for value (i.e. Italian deliciousness per dollar).

Reviews.Author: Natalie E.
Reviews.Content: Giacomo's was recommended to my boyfriend by numerous colleagues and friends as a great place to take someone special, me.  We went on a Sunday night and took our time walking along the Freedom Trail into the North End. The Italian soccer team was playing an important game so all the bars were packed with enthusiastic fans.  There were about ten people in line when we arrived at Giacomo's creating a wait of less than a half hour.  The people in line behind us smartly drank wine out of brown paper bags while they waited.  The inside was tinier than I could have ever imagined with less than 15 tables nearly on top of one another.  The handsy server was attentive but obviously rushed as fast table turnover must be their main goal.  Giacomo's is known for its inexpensive yet huge servings of high quality Italian food.  We were immediately brought water, bread and olive oil.  The menu is posted on a large board rather than distributed to each table but the waiter took the time to explain everything to us.  We started with the fried mozzarella and then ordered the lobster ravioli and linguini with Giacomo sauce (their house specialty) with the intention of sharing both equally.  The lobster ravioli was incredible especially because of the cream sauce.  We finished the lobster ravioli which alone was plenty for two people and ended up bringing most the linguini home which heated up even better the next day.     The small size of the restaurant contributed greatly to the experience.  Everything that happened at the restaurant was on display from the kitchen, to the servers, to all of the to other diners.  You really got to see the inner workings of a successful restaurant.  We left so stuffed we waddled down to the water and sat uncomfortably full on a park bench until we could walk back to the T.

Reviews.Author: Hsiao-Ting C.
Reviews.Content: My friend kept buggy me to eat at this place but I've been putting it off since I'm not a big Italian food fan.  I'm lactose intolerant so Italian food isn't one of my favorite type of food.  I finally told my friend we can eat here.  Well, I'm glad I came here to eat.  It has to be one of the best Italian restaurant I've been to here in Boston.  My friend got the home made noodles with lobster meat with the spicy sauce was absolutely delicious!  The noodles was yummy and the sauce was delicious - I've never had something like this at an Italian restaurant.  I ordered the sea bass which was cooked to perfection - it was tender and moist - not dry at all.  It sat on top of some greens that was cooked perfectly too and the mussels on the side was taken out of the shell which was really nice so you didn't get messy eating mussels.  This place does get pack really quickly.  We were able to get seated right away since we came right after work.  The place is really small and crowded but it's worth it.  People were waiting outside in the cold!  That shows you how good the food is.

Reviews.Author: Stephen L.
Reviews.Content: I first started going here over fifteen years ago as a kid and this place has just become such a standard for me throughout the years. Every time I head back home to Boston I have to stop in and have a meal.As you walk up hanover st you will see a long line of people standing outside no matter what the weather is, this place is that good! Don't worry to much about the line the place is small but they turn tables pretty quick but you never feel rushed while you are inside.I have had most of the dishes on the menu and, no joke would recommend them all. Not only that but the price is so cheap compared to some other places in the north end.Make sure you bring cash because they don't take cards and plan on having your dessert at Mikes Pastries up the street cause they don't do dessert either.My mouth is watering just thinking about this place, damn I wish I was in Boston right now!

Reviews.Author: Brad S.
Reviews.Content: Way overrated!!  The food was very good, and that's why I am giving it 2 stars.  After waiting in line for an hour, we were in and out in 27 minutes.  We sat down and the server went over the menu.  She gave us about 2 mins and wanted to know what we wanted.  The place is very small and we had to constantly move in and out so the sever could get to the table next to us.  They basically throw the bread on the table.  Although the bread was amazing!! I have never been so rushed in a restaurant. The meal was good and if your looking for a fast food meal this would be the place to go.  If your looking for a relaxing sit down dinner avoid this place.

Reviews.Author: Eric C.
Reviews.Content: Yummy. I'm coming back here next time I'm in town. The butternut squash ravioli, as recommended by other Yelpers, is amazing. Creamy, smooth, and light! We also ordered another dish -- a frutte de mare, with half a lobster (I forgot the exact name of the dish) and it was good (I'd give it 4 of 5 stars). Just be prepared to wait to get in. We came in an hour before closing and got seated within 30 minutes (party of 2). And be careful if you park on the street -- we saw a few people get ticketed.

Reviews.Author: nga l.
Reviews.Content: Um, Hi... can you say "pillows of heaven"? That's how my friend Jenny friend described their Butternut Squash Ravioli, and she is 100% correct! They are light, soft, a little sweet, and melt in your mouth! I dont even remember anything else we had that night.. the butternut squash overshadowed everything else in comparison.We waited an hour (or more) in line, but it was so worth it!!!

Reviews.Author: Bhavin M.
Reviews.Content: I am not a big fan of Italian food - but a huge fan of Giacomo's! The food is priced extremely reasonably and I would pay 2x for the quality of the food (although I am not complaining, Giacomo's mngmt - pls dont raise $$). Food: OMG - we had a seafood pasta dish that was out of this world. Fresh pasta, sauce and amazingly fresh seafood - prepared to win over anyone's palate.  Service/Setting: Very casual and friendly staff.  I like the fact that they are helpful - dont take themselves, popularity too serviously. They facilitate the casual atmosphere.  Its nice to see that such a good place that is casual has not re-invented itself as a pretentious stuffy dinner place.

Reviews.Author: Cindy K.
Reviews.Content: Coming here is a treat for anyone, especially if you are visiting Boston.  The streets are lined with people who look like they just walked out of The Godfather. I'd recommend the homemade fusilli with lobster and scrimp.  The fusilli is very thick and chewy, which I really like, but I love the lobster in it.  I also love how you can customize it by choosing your own sauce.The butternut squash raviolis are also really good, especially if you like sweet and creamy.Great people working there.  High quality ingredients.  Tasty, tasty, tasty.

Reviews.Author: Manpreet K.
Reviews.Content: Great food, simple ambience and amazing value!  It's cash only but no issue if you come prepared.

Reviews.Author: Renee B.
Reviews.Content: Worth its wait in food!  We waited about an hour and a half.  Make sure you have cash on hand!

Reviews.Author: Cassie P.
Reviews.Content: The food is amazing. Their sauce (I prefer to do half Giacomo''s lobster sauce and half Fra Diavolo) is to die for. The service is very quick and straight to the point.  You almost feel rushed, especially with a line of people waiting outside. The food worth the wait though...and the price is right. I don't mind waiting in line, you will always meet some interesting people. You may even find yourself sharing an umbrella with them :-) I highly recommend this place, it is an experience.

Reviews.Author: Sam G.
Reviews.Content: This place is incredible. There is always a wait, even at 9pm when I went - so just expect that. The line will even wrap around the corner sometimes, which could be at least an hour wait. However, it is absolutely worth the wait. Cheap food that is fantastic! I would highly recommend any seafood dish, in particular the fra diavolo. The sauce was perfect and the seafood was very fresh. Another reason to come is all the reasonably priced bottles of wine. Almost every bottle is under $17, which is something you will not find anywhere else in the north end. The best reason to come here is the atmosphere. It is a very intimate setting, as everyone is really sitting together. The owner and all the waiters/waitresses are very friendly and involved with everyone there. It feels very "Boston" in here and I can't wait to come back here.

Reviews.Author: Charles M.
Reviews.Content: Great food.  Small inside but who cares?  Be sure to show up before they open so you can get in.  Some of the people waiting in line before they opened did not get in for the first seating.  They only take cash.  You cannot go wrong with their specials, whatever they may be.  Service was prompt and kind.  I will be back.

Reviews.Author: Mica N.
Reviews.Content: I am going to give this a 3 stars!  We waited almost an hour and a half in the rain for this much hyped restaurant.  I must say the food was fine but not spectacular.  My dish was the pumpkin tortellini and was actually quite sweet but well made.  We also ordered the salmon steak and pasta and we asked for it to be really well done.  When the salmon arrived it was partially raw and they forgot the pasta.  Our garlic bread was burned but tasted alright.  Our server Tony was very interesting...he didn't listen very well to our order, would interrupt or walk away mid order, but was entertaining to say the least!  Overall it was decent food but I wouldn't recommend this to anyone, as there are a million other restaurants without the wait!

Reviews.Author: Tom L.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love Giacomo's.Yes, you have to be prepared for at least an hour wait outside (even during New England winters). Also, you should be prepared for being slightly rushed through your dinner once you get to your table. Additionally, the service is authentic (but not exceptionally friendly), and the ambience is cosy (but not private).Food is amazingly delicious and prices are cheap. When my friends come to town I always recommend going there. We take our coffees and make the wait as a nice friendly gathering outside.PS. It's definitely worth checking out their specials!

Reviews.Author: Mindy P.
Reviews.Content: Giacomo's had very delicious food. I absolutely loved the pumpkin tortellini. I think the establishment could offer a better eating experience. I had to wait for almost two hours only to be shoved into a table and being, what felt like, rushed to finish my meal. The location is small and very noisy, what with the kitchen being right next to the small dining area.The food experience was worth the wait the first time. I enjoyed my food but with an atmosphere not unlike a busy fast food establishment, I wouldn't say that I would do it again.

Reviews.Author: carprin n.
Reviews.Content: food is good but not amazing. The wait is ridiculous!

Reviews.Author: Jenn S.
Reviews.Content: I had heard rave reviews (and still do) about Giacamo's, but frankly, was not all that impressed.Surprisingly, when I went, the 5 of us did not have a wait. I believe we were there on a week night. However, there is ALWAYS a ridiculously long line on weekends for this maybe-10 table restaurant. Yes, the food is good, but it's not the best I've ever had - in the North End or anywhere. I don't believe it's worth the wait and I remember it being fairly expensive.Perhaps I have to go back and try it again, but it definitely did not live up to the hype for me.

Reviews.Author: Anna R.
Reviews.Content: This has to now be in my Top 3 FAVORITE Italian restaurants!  The 35 minute line waiting outside for seating doesn't lie. Authentic and delicious meals await inside. I had the squid ink pappardelle with shrimp and capers. They knocked it out of the park! The squid ink isn't overpowering. It gave the pappardelle so much flavor while complementing the shrimp very nicely.The butternut squash raviolis were just as delicious. Don't be fooled that it might be bland with the absence of meat or fish. The butternut squash is a great stand alone. The service is warm and authentic. Portions are generous. Patrons are tourists and locals alike.  YOU MUST EAT HERE WHEN IN BOSTON!

Reviews.Author: Norry H.
Reviews.Content: Trusting Yelp reviews, I decided to go to Giacomo's for dinner last night. Since I am a DC area Yelper, I had to come all the way from Northern Virginia to Boston to try the Italian food in this North End section of Boston.I had tried lunch at the Daily Catch the day before and I really liked the food there. So at Giacomo's I had something to compare with. Giacomo's advantage I thought was the 1/2 lobster, clams & mussles over linguine for only $20. Their pumpkin tortellini was excellent too. The only disapointment for me was the clams. They obviously used already opened ones or dead ones versus live ones I must say. If they gave me real fresh clams in my pasta, I would probably have given 5 stars.

Reviews.Author: Karisa D.
Reviews.Content: Giacomo's is AMAZING!!! Their food is delicious and they have really good deals on wine. The service is fast because they want to seat people as quickly as possible. Trust me and everyone else, the food is fantastic and is definitely worth the wait. Don't let the line discourage you. Just means Giacomo's knows how to satisfy their hungry customers.

Reviews.Author: Alexandra C.
Reviews.Content: Okay, wow, after that last post I really should have tried the pumpkin tortellini. Or the lobster ravioli but sadly didn't.I had high hopes of finding the bf the best chicken parm ever. But it turned out to be the worst. The sauce there is pretty good. Personally, I like Rao's jar sauce better. The chicken parm looked great- perfect amount of sauce, melted cheese not burned at all but the first bite seemed off - rubbery. We sent it back to be cooked longer as the inside was pink. NOT good!  When it came back it was no longer pink but the texture was just as strange, rubbery...Awful.I'm glad we ordered the Caprese salad- it was the best part of the meal. Amazing balsamic they use.Complimentary garlic broccoli - good.My fettucini with creamy pesto sauce - nothing great. The pesto sauce was too bland. The swordfish and tuna it was mixed with was delicious though - fresh and melt-in-your-mouth. Just not enough of the seafood compared to monstrous portion of the pasta.I wanted to love it. Really I did. But only a pretty decent 3 stars I can give.

Reviews.Author: Sandra L.
Reviews.Content: This place is worth the wait. My boyfriend and I lucked out, we only waited about 30 - 45 minutes on a Thursday night.The dining area is crammed up to the door. All patrons waiting stood in line outside the restaurant and they called us in as tables opened.I had my heart set on the 1/2 lobster, clam, mussels over spaghetti special. But when we got in, we asked the waitress for her recommendations and her favorite dish. She recommended the Fusilli with lobster and prawn special and the Butternut squash ravioli special.We also ordered the fried calamari and a glass of wine.We started with the fried calamari. It was nicely battered, not greasy and calamari pieces were fairly large pieces. The calamari was tender, not chewy.The butternut squash was VERY good, unlike the others I've had. I had diced asparagus with prosciutto marscopone cheese sauce. IT was DELICIOUS. If the waitress hadn't recommend it, I would have ordered seafood. So far, the best butternut sqush ravioli ever!We also had the Fusilli special with prawns and LOTS of lobster in Giacomo sauce. Giacomo sauce is a lobster base cream sauce mixed with tomato sauce! Imagine lobster bisque with tomato sauce!! YUM.

Reviews.Author: Sara C.
Reviews.Content: Oh boy, where do I begin?Living in Colorado the first thing I crave when visiting the coasts is seafood.  What's better than great Italian food with seafood involved?  Hmm, I couldn't come up with anything on a Sunday evening but to try out Giacomo's which was recommended by my Bostonian friends.  After browsing through a laminated 2-sided menu and also a hand-written daily special card... (Mind you the penmanship was beautiful.)  My boyfriend and I decided on the most expensive thing on the menu, the seafood pasta dish for 2.  With a bottle of wine only costed us $65 + tax and tip!  What a great deal!!  Especially in Boston...  Our waitress came around before our dish arrived and said, "OK guys, this is how we're going to do this...."  while rearranged our table to her liking.  The tiny little room was filled with customer, almost no room to sneeze.  The dish has a full lobster, clams, calamari, squid, shrimps and generous portion of mussels and of course, linguini.  We went with the Giacomo's sauce, which is a house marinara with béchamel cream.  I think the portion is well enough for 4 but we killed it!  We had some pasta leftover but overall we couldn't stop eating. I have been to a lot of Italian pasta places but I would say right now this one tops it all for seafood!  I dreamt about it for days...P.S. - Quite a wait if you go on a busy time during the week, we waited about 45 mins before we were seated, but it was well worth my time standing in the chilly, misty New England fall weather.

Reviews.Author: Andrew H.
Reviews.Content: Giacomo's (pronounced jockamos by the staff) is wonderful.  They provide a very diverse menu with treats that you likely have never thought of!Butternut squash ravioli?  Pumpkin tortellini?  Who knew they would be delicious!So word of warning:  Do NOT eat an entree by itself.  Eat things family style or you will quickly be overwhelmed by the sweetness of the pumpkin tortellini or the oiliness of the calamari.  FAMILY STYLE.  I don't care if you're going with people you've just met.  This is a wonderful restaurant and they serve food that is very strong in a particular flavor.  Mix them and you will be pleased.Also, the prices are very very fair.  For a beautiful 3-entree + 1 appetizer (calamari) meal, we paid about $25 each including a generous 20% tip.

Reviews.Author: Huey N.
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to write a raving review but can't settle with mob mentality. I was in MA on business for a total of 4 weeks, tried coming here on at least 3 separate occasions. I traveled an hour to get the restauarant and waited in line in the rain for 20 mins. I prayed that it would at least meet my expectations.I ordered one of the specials, a home-made pasta with loberster, shrimp, and their house sauce. The pasta was much chewier than I would have liked, and the pasta sauce wasn't really different from what I've had many times over. The whole reason for getting fresh pasta is becuase of the texture. Its like eating instant noodles versus having a bowl from a japanese ramen joint. I would have been happier eating Barilla in this case. The food wasn't bad, but pretty standard. I want to go back and try the other items, but I don't know when that will be, if ever again. For now I will stick to my guns.

Reviews.Author: Zachary R.
Reviews.Content: It felt overhyped.  The food was solid; actually everything we had was quite good.  But it wasn't either cheap enough or good enough to justify their lines and hustle.  My favorite dish was the Eggplant Parmigiana.  The mixed seafood dish was well prepared, but the seafood itself wasn't anything memorable.There was a long line, which I've been told is totally standard there.  Service felt very friendly, but also very rushed - trying to turn the table to get the people standing outside in the freezing cold into eat.  It was a fun experience, but not really worth the wait and hype cycle.

Reviews.Author: Christine G.
Reviews.Content: Expect a wait. The tables are very close to each other. Everything is really quick and their special sauce is to die for! Cash only.Then find a place after for coffee and dessert where you can actually talk about how great dinner was!

Reviews.Author: Lissete D.
Reviews.Content: You  mention Giacomo's to my husband and he starts salivating. He loves their lobster ravioli. I, really like their chicken marsala. Everything tastes fresh and delicious. A quick walk to Mike's after dinner for dessert  and we're happy campers.The place is tiny. The wait can be long but we have never waited more than 1/2 hour or so. I don't think we would be willing to wait more than that. Of course, it also depends on the weather, since you do wait on the sidewalk. Service has always been friendly and quick, though we never felt rushed. Cash only. As long as you know ahead of time, I don't see a problem.

Reviews.Author: Jin C.
Reviews.Content: During the hour that I waited in line here, at least 3 people remarked about the length of the line and wondered why that was. If it's not obvious enough that we're standing in front of an Italian restaurant, then it should be obvious by simple inference that people stand in line for something because that something is good.Anyhow, the seating space is quite cramped and the service staff were extremely harried. It wasn't chaotic; no, it was more like an organized flurry of movement that seemed chaotic to the bystander. I got the clams over linguine with spicy red sauce, and I also tried to lobster ravioli. The food was good, definitely. Portions were massive too. The ingredients were fresh and good quality, but I'm not sure the cooking is interesting or unique enough for me to want to stand in line here ever again.

Reviews.Author: jun k.
Reviews.Content: Saturday, at 5pm, there was a fatty line.  Sunday at 5pm, there was a fatty line then too.  Luckily, I didn't wait in it - my friends did :-).OK, I really love this place.The service is boisterous, homey, professional, informed, and quick.The atmosphere is tiny and cute.And.the food. is bomb.Everyone got a variety of specials, pastas, etc.  I opted for the butternut squash ravioli since that is my favorite thing.  (I think though, even though people RAVE about it, I didn't think the BSR here was that great... I've had better. :-/ ).  The portion was generous and it WAS delicious.  (Especially after adding some freshly grated cheese and crushed red peppers).Oh.. I think I know why I was not overly impressed by the butternut squash ravioli.Let me continue.The fresh bread they provide is quality.  Haven't had this good bread since I went to places in CA!Their garlic bread is delicious and buttery and totally not good for you.  (All the more reason to indulge).The calamari appetizer is great because the pieces are large AND the sauce that accompanies it is yummy, tomatoey and a tad bit spicey.  My favorite parts were the fried peppers included with the calamari.  Oh my, mouth just watered.THIS is probably why I was not impressed with the ravioli.  I THINK I WAS FULL ALREADY BY THE TIME THE ENTREE CAME!!!!  In fact, I didn't finish 3 pieces.  And I didn't fully enjoy it.  I should've just taken half home... because they are VERY gracious about packing food for you (as I observed from my friend H).I didn't even try other people's food because I was worried about finishing my own... but I'm confident that whatever I get will be good.Oh, and the price is definitely reasonable.  Maybe a little on the higher end, but definitely worth it.PS. Like most places in North End, CA$H ONLY

Reviews.Author: Sasha B.
Reviews.Content: Wow. I lived in Boston for five years and never made it here... This makes me very sad now that I finally tried it haha...We got lucky, there was the typical 30-45 min line out the door about 15 people deep for the small restaurant of i'd say 20 seatings and she came right out and asked for a party of 2, so we got right in...The muscles and calamari to start were great, but the main courses were even better. I had the homemade fusilli with the Giacomo sauce - soooo good. My friend had the fresh halibut, also great...I'll definitely go back when in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Caroline K.
Reviews.Content: I won't mince words, but I developed a self-induced food coma shortly after dining here.  Rachael Ray definitely got her money's worth.The staff here won't particularly baby you, as they're your typical (and I say typical with great affection) food-loving Italians with thick Boston accents, but they're helpful and friendly enough to explain the best parts of the menu as well as the specials they offer that night.House special + bottle of Alamo Malbec + (super) fresh Caprese salad + mozarella marinara is what we ventured upon that night.  Mounds upon mounds of linguine, fra diavolo sauce, shrimp, calamari, mussels, lobster...Did I mention I'm still in recovery?

Reviews.Author: Aris L.
Reviews.Content: Best italian restaurant in boston...we ordered 4 dishes.. all of them taste excellent..the staff are also very friend..the queue was very long..so i recommend to go there before the restaurant close because the line is not going to be that long..CONCLUSION = RECOMMENDED!!! MUST TRY!!!

Reviews.Author: Jenny K.
Reviews.Content: There's no quibbling about it that the food here is awesome. Question is, are you insane enough to wait in that atrocious line for your lobster raviolis and seafood linguine? This is almost an existential question that you'll need to ask yourself. I came here under the most stress-free and ideal conditions. Given that we walked in 15 minutes before they were technically even open, my partner and I scooped the last open table. This is at 4:45 pm! Like the other reviewers noted, the service here is just okay due to the hustle and bustle factor. And as for the people waiting for tables:  You'll literally feel them glaring at you from outside, telepathically communicating for you to quit yapping and pay your tab.  Food is fantastic: Lobster raviolis, Seafood pasta, caesar salad, fried calamari, oh and the bread! It's like having an Italian grandma cooking for you!

Reviews.Author: Jenny H.
Reviews.Content: I waited about 20 minutes on a rainy Sunday evening to eat here, and the food was just OK.  The pasta is not amazing, but standard, decent Italian food I would get anywhere I think.  I am not sure what all the hype is about this restaurant.  I don't believe they make their pastas from scratch, although I think they do make their pasta sauce in house.We got their caprese salad, their mozzarella was OK, but the tomatoes were really good, large slices of ripe, sweet tomatoes, with slices of roasted peppers, sprinkled with olive oil, balsamic vinaigrette, salt and pepper.  I liked this dish because it added some freshness to an otherwise heavy meal.Their linguine with calamari and mussels had a nice, spicy tomato sauce but the calamari was really rubbery, not fresh at all, and the mussels were OK.   I got their butternut squash ravioli which was also OK, not as fresh or melt-in-your-mouth as I would have liked, and the alfredo sauce with asparagus that came with the ravioli was just OK , the asparagus was not cooked through so it tasted a bit stalky in my mouth.Given the rushed ambience of the place (they plop the pasta dishes in front of you within 5 minutes of your order, and expect you to finish quickly so they can seat the line of staring customers waiting outside), I would probably go elsewhere to eat for a more relaxed, leisurely dinner.  It's not worth the wait, in terms of both the food and the ambience.

Reviews.Author: Adrianne H.
Reviews.Content: Many of you should venture out and try something that hasn't been recommended millions of times because chances are.... there are other fantastic dishes. I ventured out and tried the Linguini with mussels and clams mixed with scampi sauce. AMAZING. The combination of all the ingredients made the dish complete and the array of flavors mixed great together. This is the first time ever having this dish in my life and I just cannot believe how great it was. Definitely get the Parmesan cheese on top, it adds to it. My only recommendation would be to add a slice of garlic bread with the dish but whatever. Who cares!Fried calamari: ok but it kind of ruins your appetite due to the richness. I would opt out.Garlic bread: I liked the use of olive oil rather than butter but for the love of god, add some garlic to it! It was way lacking.Being from Texas where everything is "big", I had some major claustrophobia issues going on but it's expected in older towns. Just giving anyone else who has claustrophobia issues a heads up.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany C.
Reviews.Content: oh my god.... zuppa di pesce for 2 for $55... AHH-MAAAAZING! Words cannot even begin to describe how good this was! The lobstah on top was cooked just right, they were very generous with the clams and mussels, the shrimps were big and yummy, and the scallops were good (though a tid bit overcooked). We got the giacomo house sauce, which was similar to a pink sauce... but lighter. For 55 bucks... this meal could feed 3-4!!!! For an extra 10 bucks, you can also pop open a bottle of wine! I pretty much walked out of the restaurant stuffed like a turkey and happy as can be. Beware though! The reviews are right... be prepared for a long wait outside (~1 hr for us on a Friday night). One more note... I found the service to be awesome! I don't get why other people didn't feel the same... but I found our waitress (the old lady) to be pleasant.. she was a bit sarcastic and straightforward, but she was very attentive and caring! She even gave us a tide pen after noticing pasta stains on our shirts!!! Doesn't get better than that! :D

Reviews.Author: Melissa K.
Reviews.Content: Giacomo's was definitely a highlight of my trip to Boston. After reading the reviews, I decided to give it a try especially since I wanted a legit Italian dining experience. I knew that there would probably be a line and that it was cash only, so I went early and armed. Arrived outside the restaurant around 5:35pm, and there was already a line of about 7 people. I immediately thought "Uh oh" especially since I could see that the space was small but then I reconciled that thought because no other Italian restaurant within sight had a line, which probably meant that the food was worth waiting for or that it was super-hyped. My wait time was only about 10 minutes. I was promptly seated and my server explained the menu ... pick a seafood and a sauce. Since I had researched Giacomo's before arriving, I knew exactly what I wanted ... calamari (appetizer), mussels with the spicy lobster sauce ($14), and a glass of cabernet ($5). The bread arrived and although it was room temperature (I am a sucker for fresh warm bread), it was crusty, chewy, and delicious. It is the kind of quality bread that really sticks to the palate. Soon afterward, my calamari arrived. Since it was a small order ($7), I had expected a few pieces ... no, this portion was very generous. I stared at it and said "Wow! Is that all for me?" The calamari was delicious. I marveled at the ratio of breading to squid and appreciated that each piece of squid was perfectly cooked ... tender, NOT chewy. Included with the calamari were breaded and fried jalapenos and other peppers. Delicious!! The marinara dipping sauce was perfect as well, with just the right level of acidity and sweetness. I couldn't wait to try the entree.When the entree arrived, I was stunned because of the portion size and because of the generous amount of mussels included with the dish. The mussels lined the entire perimeter of the plate and were fresh and delicious. The sauce was spicy and succulent, with just enough zest to warm me up. I could taste hints of the lobster. Definitely a very well-made sauce with delicate nuances in flavor. The pasta was cooked well and the entire dish was very good, and made me want to try every dish on the menu. Definitely a winner!

Reviews.Author: Vanessa K.
Reviews.Content: Worth every penny and every minute of the 45 minute wait.  Yes the line is daunting but it moves fast considering everything else.  i recommend EVERYTHING on the menu as it is delicious.  This is what we ordered:- Special Caprese Salad with Burrta Filled Mozarella- Giacomo Special: linguini with half lobster, mussels, clams and in gicaomo sauce ($20)- Lobster raviolo ($16)- Large Calamari ($10)Super affordable! Cash only!!

Reviews.Author: Jackie K.
Reviews.Content: AHHHHHHH sooo good. :) I came here with my friends exactly at 5pm and there were already people inside eating and we were the first in line outside. Basically, we formed the line and we had to wait about 20 minutes to get seated. We figured that this place was bomb because people were willing to wait 30 minutes or more.  It is a very family oriented environment. Between 5 people, we ordered a large calamari, the butter nut quash, frutti di mare with the spicy sauce, and the special of the day: homemade fusilli with the lobster meat sauce. The special of the day was seriously so good. I think it was good because the lobster sauce was just sooo delicious. I would die to eat that again. It is smart to order a few dishes and share so people can taste all the dishes. I would recommend this place to anyone in Boston. This place is a bit pricy, but it is totally worth it. Remember, it is cash only. No credit card I believe. The service is great. People are awesome and they just want to feed people. People are always attentive and ready to help you.

Reviews.Author: K. Brooke Z.
Reviews.Content: If you want wine with dinner, this is the place to go. If you want to get seated right away, as you can tell from the other reviews...this is not the place to go.Go there for the food, not the atmosphere. It's INCREDIBLY small and cramped. It also is very loud, so not a great date-night place if you enjoy hearing the conversation.However, the calamari was good with a nice zingy sauce and I really enjoyed my Chicken Marsala. I tried the butternut squash ravioli of my friend's plate and liked that as well. It was flavorful and had some subtle deliciousness added in to enhance the squash. It's a fun place to try out and wait for (35 minutes on Friday at 5:30), but not a place I HAVE TO go again.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer K.
Reviews.Content: I heard so much about Giacomo's Seafood pasta.. everyone that been to Boston or locals said I need to go there... I need to eat this... I need to go early to wait in line..Giacomo's on a Monday evening was surprisingly quiet.. No long queue of anxious people wanting to be fed...Great services from the wait staffs..We shared:Fried Calamari ($7)- Great portion and really tasty. Calamari is soft and tender and not oily at all! Love it!Frutti Di Mare with Fra Diavolo Sauce ($19)/Special of the Day - half lobster and seafood - with Giacomo Sauce ($20) - Really disappointed with the pasta- Portion is huge but I found the sauce tasted bland, the seafood is so so- Seafood is a little overcooked and some of the scallops are even on the chewy side- However for $20 you get a half lobster and tons of seafood, for value that cannot be beat!Luckily, I didn't wait for hours to get in. But I don't think I would go back to Giacomo's again....

Reviews.Author: Tammy K.
Reviews.Content: This is my go-to place whenever I have friends visiting from out of town. Giacomos, as well as the Daily Catch, are the epitome of the charming hole-in-the-walls that one finds in the North End, oozing with Boston-Italian charm. Their fresh fusilli would make my Italian grandmother weep (if I had one). You can substitute any pasta dish with their fusilli for an extra charge, which I highly suggest you do.Also, they do have another location in the Back Bay that is not nearly as crowded, but it is just not the same. If you find yourself needing to come during the weekends or anytime during the summer really, I would suggest coming early to avoid the long line- I think they open at 4:30pm.

Reviews.Author: Eileen P.
Reviews.Content: Love it here! It's always good but there is a usually a long line. Very casual and small inside. They rush you in and out pretty quick. It's not a restaurant you go to for the atmosphere but for good classic Italian dishes!

Reviews.Author: Doug G.
Reviews.Content: By far the best restaurant in the north end.  It is worth the wait to get in.  5 of us went there for the first time and we will be back.  It might be the only place we ever eat at again in the north end.  The place jammed with tables, very noisy, cash only, and the wait is long so you may want to skip over to another restaurant so I can get a table there sooner.

Reviews.Author: Bryanne R.
Reviews.Content: There's too much hype about this place not to try it...So my friend and I stood in line to wait for a table.  We had been told that although the line is long, you won't be standing too long - true.  Chaos is all I can think to describe the atmosphere inside.  You sit - you order drinks - you're told how they do ordering - then you order - you're given your appetizer - you're given your entree and the app is taken away - yes/no dessert? - no - get the check - you're out.  It takes about 20 minutes total.  It's pretty crazy.  Since there are so few tables, you're practically in the kitchen with the chefs dining to the romantic sounds of clanking dishware.  I'm a fan of long meals and awesome service - not the wham bam thank you m'am style.  ALL THIS ASIDE - their food is AMAZINGLY good.  Loved the calamari app, and the lobster ravioli with red sauce! Give it a shot, but don't expect a calm and romantic dinner.

Reviews.Author: Simona S.
Reviews.Content: I finally made it here on my third attempt. So glad I did, despite my sucky company. After waiting a considerable amount of time on a Saturday night (weather wasn't too bad at that point though), we were seated right by the window and had a terrific meal. I had to get the calamari based on the reviews and it was truly awesome. I'd go back there just for the calamari. I had their stuffed chicken special with hazelnut oil and though very good, the oil ended up getting to me-- by the end it was way too sweet for the entire dish. I still ended up eating the entire thing.Next time, I'll get a pasta dish-- despite my tumultuous relationship with carbs.Oh and service was great!! ... I just wish they had more seating. Might venture out and check out the South End branch.. considering it's just down the street.

Reviews.Author: Julie S.
Reviews.Content: Waited about a half hour on a rainy Saturday night to eat elbow to elbow with other diners-- and I'd do it again.  The bread is absolutely delicious.  Crusty on the outside, soft on the inside.  We started with calamari (which I don't eat but my husband loved) and garlic bread which was delicious.  I had the lobster ravioli.  The portion was enormous and there was a ton of lobster inside.  I'm not usually a big fan of cream sauce but this was delicious.  House wine is $4.50 a glass.  You can't beat that.  It was difficult to get refills of water or to ask the waitress any questions.  I know Giacomo's is extremely busy, but it would have been nice if she didn't lean over another diner to pour my husband's water.  That was awkward.  The meal was delicious, though, and we will be back.

Reviews.Author: Martha S.
Reviews.Content: Came here with friends for a birthday!  We thought we were showing up 30 minutes before opening, but, it turns out the restaurant was already open!  So, we ended up waiting about 40 minutes, which wasn't bad considering the place probably sits less than 50 people at a time and we were a group of 6!  Everything we ordered was so good we all shared bites of everything!  I got the handmade pasta and it was amazing in the fra diavolo sauce, and a friend got it with the house sauce.  Both were perfect with the deliciously textured hand made pasta! Calamari and mozzarella "sticks" were incredibly delicious appetizers.  Service is curt but they get the job done quickly and right!  There is a lady who is strict about keeping one door closed at all times, which seems mean when you are outside freezing in the cold, but you are extremely grateful for when you are the one inside eating with your coat off. Cash only, which in this day and age is a pain, but, it is so good they can do that!

Reviews.Author: Mireya V.
Reviews.Content: So it was around 9:50 on a Friday night and we were starving! After having several doors shut in our face (a moment which made me feel like Mary in search of an inn) it was Giacomo's that gave us a bite to eat. They were about the close so they told us that we had a few minutes to look over the menu and order. My back was facing the chalkboard menu, so I didn't get to see the other specials they had. I had a craving for gnocchi but didn't see any on the menu. Not to mention, they were nice enough to take us in so I didn't want to annoy them with questions. I ended up going with the eggplant parm as I serve up a mean one, so of course I wanted to compare. As I turned around, I noticed they DID have gnocchi on the menu and asked if I could change my order but they denied my request. My table also ordered various chicken and seafood dishes. The eggplant parm was "meh, ok". The eggplant was sliced really thin (almost looked like phyllo dough). I LOVE eggplant but it was lost in this dish. All you could taste was cheese and sauce. However, I did try the other dishes and they were all pretty tasty. +1 star for feeding our tummies! I would definitely like to try this place again but I will order the gnocchi next time around!

Reviews.Author: J V.
Reviews.Content: Great food, The only reason I'm giving it 3 stars is because most of the time, you are waiting in a line out front for about 1 hour +, then you get sat right on top of other dining guests, the place is so tightly squeezed.I do think the food is A+, but just better places for an overall dining experience in the North End

Reviews.Author: Melissa K.
Reviews.Content: WOW.We arrived here in the freezing cold to see that 2 parties were already waiting outside, since the place was so small. My Boston Host kindly asked if i would like to go somewhere else, but we decided it had to be great if people were waiting outside with temperatures in the teens. Seconds later, 2 more parties showed up in line behind us. We waited about 20-30 minutes.I loved how they had the menu on a chalkboard. Our waitress had the attitude that she'd been working there for 15 years--this is what we have to eat, this is how you order, i'll be right back and hopefully you'll be ready. But it worked, I liked her.The majority of the wines were under $20. Score! I wasn't paying but I was still excited about that. I got some swordfish with grilled vegetables. Swordfish wasn't too good. The reason why this place gets so many stars is the pasta was great (I had marinara sauce), the House sauce was GREAT, and the teeny cozy atmosphere was amazing. I'd really like to go back here next time I'm in boston and try some different menu items!

Reviews.Author: Greg M.
Reviews.Content: The Honest Truth:This place is reaaaally good.  Seafood is the freshest and cooked to tender perfection, portions are really big! All their sauces are pretty much lobster based.  Ask for the Fracomo sauce! (Half Fra diavolo and half giacomo).  Service is quick, but be ready cuz they don't mess around! There are always a lot of people waiting, so they get you in and out quickly! Worth the wait.The Details:I had to come here at 9 o'clock for the line to be manageable... The line is super long, so come early! The restaurant isn't that big and the tables are pretty close together, but they do a good job at moving people in and out quickly.  The service is pretty... italian, meaning they may seem a little harsh at first, but they're just trying to make everything as efficient as possible.  The menu consists of choosing a seafood and a sauce and they'll whip it up for you.  I recommend the fracomo sauce! It's nice and spicy and tastes amazing.  I got the mixed seafood also and there was a ton of clams, mussels, and calamari.  Portions are enough to split one for two people and the fried calamari is a good appetizer.  The pasta is perfectly al dente.  Definitely a must visit if you're in Boston!

Reviews.Author: Richard C.
Reviews.Content: Went here last night as tourists. AMAZING. I had the shrimp/scallop with spicy lobster sauce. It was to dieeee for! There is a long line to wait but its worth it. You should def bring a bottle of an adult beverage for the wait in line.....wink wink.

Reviews.Author: Kevin W.
Reviews.Content: Best Calamari I've ever had in my life, so amazing!!!  Rachel Ray was right, this place is very special.most dishes are $13-16, which is pretty good in the Northend.  The line was out the door on a Sunday evening, but our wait for two was only 40 minutes, and I mean ONLY because I've seen lines that stretch around the corner and I can't imagine the kind of wait for that.The staff was super friendly, very hospitable and talkative, I like that, makes me feel welcome and that my aunt or something is cooking for me.They ran out of pumpkin tortellini but they made pumpkin ravioli instead and it was very good, its semi-sweet, but coupled with the cheese sauce, it was just right.  We also ordered the fusili with lobster meat and shrimp, so good!!!  For the price and quality of food, its one of the best in the northend, can't miss!

Reviews.Author: Jenessa C.
Reviews.Content: Went with a friend on a cold rainy day - apparently the best time to go. Because every other time you go, everyone else has the same idea. They don't accept reservations, so the line is always to the corner, except on rainy cold days. Inside there's maybe 15 tables & be prepared to sit snuggly against the table next to you. Still, the place is great & well worth the wait. The line moves pretty fast. The menu is delicious. I had lobster ravioli. And you can't go wrong with their wines.

Reviews.Author: Chung T.
Reviews.Content: If it isn't good, people wouldn't wait in line to get in.There's really no comparison of Giacomo's to any other Italian Restaurant unless you need reservation and a romantic ambiance.  It's got the best Italian food I've ever had in any Italian restaurants.  (maybe except for Maggiano's all-you-can-eat, since... I... eat a lot and Maggiano's can fill my need to eat until I can't walk properly)The portions are huge, the prices reasonable, and the type of fish I ordered were always cooked to perfection.  I know it sucks that there's always a line -- but if you try like after 8 pm on a weekday, it's actually not so bad.

Reviews.Author: Gerard B.
Reviews.Content: (July/ 2007)Worth the 45 minute wait!We decided to have dinner here when we found out that our walking tour ends in the neighborhood. Coincidence? Who cares!We ran into some amazing Bostonians in line who were smart and experienced enough to know that there is going to be an extremely long line, that they bought canolis and offered us one while we wait. Inside, its very fast paced and loud so don't ponder too much over the menu-- everything's great! Top it all off with a glass of wine.

Reviews.Author: Samir P.
Reviews.Content: Best Italian food I've ever tasted. Linguini with Lobster and shrimp in a creamy, spicy, red seafood sauce. Simply irresistible. Christopher was an awesome waiter and had the best recommendations - so listen to him.There was a line outside when we went, but it moved quickly. We brown-bagged mini-wine bottles from the liquor store next door....so it was good to go.

Reviews.Author: Jennafir E.
Reviews.Content: They're ok. The mozzarella marinera are AMAZING. I would go back only for that. I had the fetticine with peas and it was good. Nothing that was oh my god, I need this again. The parmesean was ok too, but nothing that made my mouth water. My family enjoyed the fettucine with onions and tomatoes, as well as the chicken and broccoli. We left full, but for the wait, though expected for the North End on a Sunday, it wasn't worth it all. I'd go back maybe if I was there, but it wouldn't be my first place to tell people to go to. The service was very quick, the waitstaff was funny and nice, and the price was decent, but overall it didn't meet all my needs.

Reviews.Author: Aditi R.
Reviews.Content: The same exact things to say about this giacomo's as the one in the south end. The food choice is incredible, the prices are reasonable, and the small family owned feeling is still there, infact more pronounced than the other one since this is a smaller location and hence the longer waits. Make sure you get there at least 30 minutes before your planned dinner time. The staff is fast, efficient and helpful. They do have a sense of urgency as they serve you however, but thats granted considering the line that forms outside this establishment.The only downsides to it are the long waits and the cash only policy. It becomes a hassle and you have to remember to carry cash everytime you go to this place. But it's certainly not a drawback enough to deter me from coming back from time to time. Excellent!

Reviews.Author: Terry C.
Reviews.Content: Giacomo's is one of Boston's best casual Italian restaurant.The food is delicious!!(+)-The calamari appetizer is great - crispy and not oily.  -I had a shrimp and lobster special with homemade fusilli and it was so good.  Their Fra Diavolo sauce is heaven.  Giacomo's is the only place where the sauce is actually spicy.  The fusilli was really good as well.  -big portion-good price-cheap wine-great & friendly service(-)-cash only-this must be the n-th review about their long lineI can't wait to go back to try their pesto sauce.

Reviews.Author: Jean C.
Reviews.Content: Rosemarie ran this place like a well oiled machine. She also happened to be our server.  When we originally walked past Giacomo's while on our Freedom Trail, there were a group of woman starting the line.  That was at 3:30pm.  When we walked back to stand in line, it was already at the corner.  That was at 4:30pm.  This location definitely does not take reservations but I knew that so waiting wasn't so bad.  It wasn't until around 6pm we finally got seated right by the kitchen.Rosemarie greeted us and got us started on the calamari app and some beverages. I ordered the Linguine with Mussels in the fra diavolo sauce.  This was the best pasta dish I have ever tasted in my life.  I was told that the food here is worth the wait and they weren't joking.  The sauce was to die for and the mussels were cooked perfectly.  I couldn't stop eating but at some point, you just have to stop.  I took a to go container home and left it at my sisters house.  I wish I finished that pasta!Our dinner took 50 minutes which was a lot less than the wait.  Rosemarie kept the food coming but I never felt rushed.  You can definitely tell that she was the seasoned server and the one in charge.  She barked out orders and told the servers how many set ups to have at each table. She knew how to keep that line moving as quickly as possible.I can't wait to come back to Giacomo's.  I've been thinking about that pasta since I started eating it.

Reviews.Author: Alie A.
Reviews.Content: Potentially my favorite restaurant in the world.North End is one of my favorite locations ever in the US, I love the Italian love that occurs on Hanover Street. Giacomo's has a line halfway down the street every single night of the week. Plan on grabbing a drink before you come..because they will be rushing you out the moment you get settled. This should not deter you, however, from indulging in perhaps the best meal of your life. Their seafood selection and anything in the diavolo is mouth watering and so memorable that you will be dreaming of it months later. You watch them cook and then they watch you devour it..delicious. I can't even put into words how unbelievably amazing this place is. Just go..you will not regret it. Craving it right now..

Reviews.Author: Katie W.
Reviews.Content: Giacomo's gets people in and out pretty fast, but be prepared to wait at least 30-45 minutes. The food was good, but not amazing. None of the dishes left an impression. We ordered four different dishes with four different sauces (Scampi, Fra Diavolo, Giacomo, and Butternut Squash Ravioli). Out of the four, Scampi was our favorite. Giacomo's is a good place to go to once, but not sure if I'll return any time soon.Cash only.

Reviews.Author: Rouzhna N.
Reviews.Content: Okay, the four stars is really for the whole experience, not just the food. Minus the long wait, we had a really good time. The wait staff is very nice, and the owner is actually pretty talkative and follows the whole "i am an italian restaurant owner" personality, which is very entertaining and endearing. Food is just not THAT great, I mean it's good, but it's not something that makes you just drop your fork and say holy crap, this is good. SO, with that said, I would still recommend it. This is a great date spot, but it is not a spot for a group more than 4. Also, the bathroom is in really bad shape, just a thought.

Reviews.Author: Andy R.
Reviews.Content: I feel like I am at Nonna's family dinner. This place has absolutely incredible homemade everything. Small, intimate dining room reminiscent of a family dining room. Giacomo is the life of the room. The rest of the staff were incredibly friendly as well. This place is reasonably priced too, and well worth every penny. Two words: EAT HERE!

Reviews.Author: Jeremy D.
Reviews.Content: There are a ton of Italian restaurants in the North End. Some you can get seated right away, and some are a wait. This place is well oven an hour on the weekends but worth every minute. The food is great; one of the best Italian places I have ever been to and we live in NYC, land of the great restaurant. The Frutti diMari is to die for. Get the calamari, you won't regret it. Cash only

Reviews.Author: Bee B.
Reviews.Content: MMMM....I sortof hate to give this guy a 3, since there were so many things I liked.  Such as: Wine bottles for about 16 bucks!  What?!? That's amazing.  Waitresses who, though they hurry you, are quite hysterical (a tale:  My bro-in-law was struggling with a lobster claw?  tail?  I don't know it was something made of chitin, and the waitress grabs it in her hand, cracks it in half, pulls out the meat and says in her boston accent, "if I let him keep up like that we'd be here till tomorrow!), and the line thing is sortof an experience.  Now, the food -- My husband had the pumpkin ravioli which was creamy and sweet and very fresh-tasting.  It was probably 5 stars in and of itself.  I, on the other hand, selected the eggplant parm.  It was rather watery and not as flavorful as I would have hoped.  I have had better eggplant parm in my day...yes, in Rome, but also in (i am cringing as i write this, sorry!) Romano's Macaroni Grill.  I have never waited an hour and a half in the rain for mac grill.  I am so sad that all the house red sauces were made with lobster (which I don't eat) because they sounded amazing and way better than the bland stuff on my eggplant.  In sum -- I think Giacomo's is an experience.  It's a fun, reasonably priced dining experience, but be careful what you order.  I'd advice against the parm.

Reviews.Author: Priya C.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE the pumpkin tortellini here- it's in a delicious sage sauce and is so tasty!  The only downside of this restaurant is that they don't take reservations in the North End, and there is usually a long wait.  BUT, the good news is that they also have a place in the South End that does take reservations and is not nearly as crowded.  I am not sure about the rest of the menu because I can't get myself to order anything but the pumpkin tortellini dish, but it looks yummy!

Reviews.Author: Peter R.
Reviews.Content: I've been to both locations and must say i have been satisfied with both in food quality.... I'm surprised to hear that ppl enjoyed the service at the south end better though.. personally i had a better experience with service overall in the north end location... Major differences: The South End  = the host looked at me when i walked in and asked if i had a reservation.. despite the fact that the place was not even full and we had arrived way before any dinner rush he still stood there as if too think whether or not we should be seated.. the service overall was ehhh nothing great seemed some what unattentive and overall as if our table was not worth his effort to really wait on. The North End = Server was very friendly overall and helpful in directing us into the proper dishes which we would enjoy. Really seemed like she knew everything on the menu.. was extremely attentive despite having a ton of other patrons in the restaurant.. she even noticed i was having trouble trying to keep the red sauce off my shirt and brought me a bib... though i said no thank you.. my friends all insisted as to have a good laugh at my expense.. but hey it did allow me to focus more on enjoying my food...Yet the Food: Overall the Noodlezz are excellent i do feel the North End does have a slight advantage but it may have all been mental.. since i like the service there more.. but the food yummy and worth the wait or cost involved.. one need not order an appetizer unless sharing, portions are large and fulfilling.*** extra tip*** don't wear white

Reviews.Author: Jane R.
Reviews.Content: It may be something of a miracle, but I actually didn't wait a single minute for a table here. Showing up right when they open helps a lot; the long line outside forms soon after. I also appreciated that we got our food very quickly.I tried my mom's butternut squash ravioli since everyone in the world had recommended it and it was, indeed, pretty stunning. A nice consistency and a good sauce. I had a great fettucine; all the ingredients are of good quality and the chicken was excellent. Will definitely return to try other things on the menu and check out the appetizers. Staff were very efficient and quick, but pleasant. No complaints about the service. I'm sure they appreciate it when people help make their jobs easier when there are people waiting in the rain outside. It's a very small space, and it WILL be cramped, no two ways about it, but I thought it was a fun atmosphere, though it won't be for everyone. And the prices aren't super-low, but given the high quality of the food, it's worth it.

Reviews.Author: Meredith K.
Reviews.Content: Always worth the wait. And you will wait. trust me. you'll wait, and wait, and wait........ almost there... no keep waiting..just a little longer... and now you can sit....start with the calamari - it won't disappoint! It used to be they only had the menu on the blackboard, tonight we got actual menus. Basically you pick your fish (or chicken), pasta, and sauce. OR you can order one of the standards they have like chicken parm, OR just go with one of the tasty daily specials. Wine is reasonably priced (most bottles $15) and service is FAST. And like I said there's always a wait, so they try to move you out fast - so drink up quickly this isn't Cafe Victoria sipping cappuccinos.

Reviews.Author: eunice k.
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite Italian restaurants... would give it 5 stars but didn't find the seafood consistently fresh (but still good food, given it's one of my faves). It is definitely worth the wait. if you like spicy seafood: the Frutti Di Mare with Fra Diavolo. Their Gnocchi is also very food, VERY fresh and soft.only cons: usually a long line and few tables... but, quick service

Reviews.Author: Jon R.
Reviews.Content: This was a restaurant that was mentioned in my tourist guide for Boston and at the same time my friend told me that this was the best Italian place in the city.  After eating there, I would have to agree its probably the best Italian food I've eaten.  Its been awhile since I ate here but I had this angel hair pasta dish with lobster and it was divine!  The sauce was just so delicious.  We also ordered the calamari which was really good although I didn't really dig the sauce that came with it but that was just a minor thing.On a Saturday night this place was just packed.  There was a long line to get in and we waited about 45 mins.  Once inside there wasn't much room and the tables were really close to each other.  There's not much room to move.  Restrooms are also located downstairs in the basement.  Service was pretty good and they were helpful considering it was my first time.  She helped me with my order.

Reviews.Author: Princess M.
Reviews.Content: This is totally worth the wait if you're in Boston.  The food is so tasty and the quality and quantity of the food makes up for such great value.The wait was about an hour for a party of two on a Friday at around 7.30pm.  Do bear in mind that you will have to wait outdoors as there is no space within the restaurant for waiting.We ordered a small plate of fried calamari as an appetizer.  It was very crispy and had pieces of spicy pickled peppers deep fried with the calamari as well.  The marinara sauce was warm and tasty.  But overall I would suggest passing on appetizers as the entrees are large enough on their own and more delicious.We tried the daily special of homemade rotini with lobster and shrimp with Giacomo sauce (a lobster-based tomato sauce thickened with a touch of cream) and the frutti di mare (mussels, clams, scallops, shrimp)linguini with fra diavolo sauce (a spicy tomato sauce, no cream).  Both were absolutely delicious and came as HUGE portions.  If I had to choose one, I would highly highly recommend the Giacomo sauce with anything.The restaurant is constantly packed and very busy but the service is very efficient.  I LOVE this place.

Reviews.Author: Liza R.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely looooove this place!  This is really the type of place that you either love or just plain hate.  They have great food at really reasonable prices.  Do expect to wait in line unless you're one of the first to arrive.  I find that couples get in quicker than larger groups of people.My favorite dish here is the frutti di mare and the half fra diavolo half giacomo sauce is a must!!!  Also try the calamari, they're honestly the best I've had!This place is by no means fancy and the service can sometimes be not so great as the waiters are all over the tiny place.  But honestly, I go here just for the food, not the service.

Reviews.Author: Paul L.
Reviews.Content: There was a line to the corner when arrived at 7:15 and it was still there when we left around 8:20.  I was told this was a tame line compared to the busier nights and weekends.  This line exists for two reasons: the dining area is very small, but more importantly the food is very good.I had the pumpkin tortellini in a fresh sage mascarpone cheese sauce.  The portion was huge and the sauce was so rich.  It excited me to see this as a regular menu item.  The others at the table had eggplant parmesan, chicken parmesan and a steak special - nobody was disappointed.  The waitress even came around and hand spooned heaping amounts of extra cheese on our entrées. The meal as a whole was reasonably priced. It's important to note that they accept cash only - two of our five diners had to dash for the ATM before we could leave.  In addition, parties of five or more automatically have an 18% tip added in - still it came out to less than $100 for five hungry people.

Reviews.Author: Apolinaras S.
Reviews.Content: You want Italian, you go to Giacomo's... or you fly to Italy. Those are your only two choices. This was our 2nd time at Giacomo's. The wait was about 45 minutes and worth every second of it! There was not much talking while eating, we were too busy taking it in. You forget about the wait, forget about the other diners bumping into your elbows. Food is that damn good.BTW, fried calamari is the best! Give the chef the gold medal. 1-hour wait is worth JUST for that fried goodness.Waiter did a great job too.

Reviews.Author: Justin M.
Reviews.Content: WORTH THE WAIT!!! Don't let the long ass line that stretches around the corner discourage you. If you see a line stretched out the door; it has to be good! Stand in line, talk with the strangers standing in line with you. People are friendly. Why not make a new friend while standing in line? There's a good chance you'll be sitting next to them again.  It's a small tiny place.Yes, try the butternut squash ravioli! Really good! The creamy sauce is a bit on the sweet side, but it compliments it well!The fried calamari....crunchy goodness! Tender....not chewy!The wait staff was a bit pushy, as in asking if we would like to order the minute we sat down.  I can forgive them because I understand that have to turn tables fast with a line down the block.Prices won't break the bank!!! Great Italian food! As authentic as it gets!

Reviews.Author: Jay E.
Reviews.Content: Worth the wait but you just have to order the right entree.  My wife and I ate at Giacomo's last night after reading all of the great reviews on Yelp.  Funny enough we ended up eating next to another Yelp couple all the way from California, they were very cool.  The restaurant is pure chaos but the servers do a great job keeping everything running smoothly but you do feel a bit rushed.  It's an open kitchen that is very small but it's fun watching the chefs in action.  We ordered a Caesar Salad (a little watery), the pumpkin tortellini and the ricotta ravioli, they were tasty dishes but not what we were expecting.  The couple next to us ordered much more impressive dishes, butternut squash ravioli and a lobster pasta dish, they were very happy and said they would give a 5 star review.  We would go back for a second try, this time ensuring we keep to more basic dishes.

Reviews.Author: Winnie A.
Reviews.Content: Seriously the best pasta I've ever had in my life, no joke!BF and I ended up at this widely popular Italian restaurant on our Boston trip; thanks to all the yelpers' recommendation! We got there around 8:45pm on Wednesday night, we were seated away. Later on we found out that we were extremely lucky because usually there is a long line outside the restaurant and it goes all the way across the street. Average wait is about 1 to 1.5 hours. The place is also very small with a homey and intimate feel (not the romantic kind).We started with a small calamari ($7) and then we both ordered off of the specials that night. I got the pan roasted striped bass with mushroom risotto, grilled baby asparagus, and truffle aioli ($22). The staff was so efficient and everything came so quickly.Calamari was so delicious. The squid was perfectly fried and the dish came with some fried some hot peppers. The marinara sauce was so flavorful. Some may find it a bit greasy but whatever, you're ordering fried calamari!I got the bass which was cooked well. It was crispy on the outside and moist on the inside, though it was a bit fishy if you were just eating it by itself. The mushroom risotto was a bit too rich for my taste, probably due to the excess cheese in there (not a huge fan of cheese myself). But when I ate the fish and the risotto with the truffle aioli, everything came together beautifully. I could totally tasted the truffle in there. BF got the homemade fusilli with lobster and shrimp ($26) in the giacomo's sauce (a red sauce that used lobster broth with a tiny splash of cream). Portion was huge, lobster meat and shrimps abundant, and fusilli al dente!! Sauce was amazing and the whole dish came piping hot. I found myself wanting his pasta more than my own fish. We both finished everything except some risotto. Needless to say there wasn't any room left for dessert. :) We will definitely come back here to try other pasta dishes on our next trip here in May.PS - We walked by Giacomo's on Saturday at 5:05pm on our way on the Freedom Trail, it was a full house and the line already wen all the way to the stop sign and around the corner.PSS - BTW it's cash only.

Reviews.Author: Marcus L.
Reviews.Content: The first time I came to Boston was when I was about 11 years old and I clearly remember going to an Italian restaurant and thoroughly enjoying the food. The 2nd time I came was this past January 2010 and I am convinced that Giacomo's that restaurant I remember from my past. My family and I came here around 7pm on a Thursday night and the restaurant was packed. We waited about 45 minutes before getting sitted. Our waiter was MIA for a while, so it took a while to put our orders in, but it was a packed restaurant so it was understandable. We ordered a Caesar Salad, Calamari, Frutti di Mare. Chicken Parm and the special, Duck Confit Gnocchi. The seafood in the Frutti di Mare was very fresh and they give you a generous amount. The Chicken Parm was also very delicious. There was a large piece of chicken smothered with red sauce and cheese. The Duck Confit Gnocchi was clearly the 2nd best and most flavorful Gnocchi I have every tasted (after a hole-in-the-wall in Italy). If ever I am in Boston again, I will make every effort to stop by at Giacomo's and probably go during non-peak hours to avoid the wait.

Reviews.Author: Linda C.
Reviews.Content: Okay, I'm not in Italy but this is as good as it gets in America.  We came in at 5 pm and we were lucky not to wait in line!  We sat down and my hubby ordered Chicken Parm and I had the Clams & Mussels with Linguine. I picked the spicy red sauce and he had the regular.  Got our food pretty quick and it smelled soooo good!   The portions were huge and we digged right in!  OMG the food was so good!  One issue I had was my clams were undercooked so I had a little tummy ache but the flavor was so freaking good anyways, I didn't complained but just told the waiter to make sure his Chef is cooking it well done so he doesn't make people sick.  I'm sure it's a rare occasion that had unfortunately happened to me but you know what?  It would have 5 stars if it wasn't because of the clams.  Do come here and I'll be back! (Arnold)

Reviews.Author: Ryan G.
Reviews.Content: This place is so small and charming, good for a casual date or something.   One of the good things is that its not ridiculously expensive as compared to other restaurants in the North End.  Price range is like 10 - 16 bucks for a dish :) The thing about this restaurant is that its not fancy, its not big, but it sure as heck serves great food!  Fresh seafood combined with fresh pasta...cant beat that.Food: fried calamari, GET IT! and get the large.  It's awesome and totally worth the extra 3 dollars!  I also had the lobster ravioli which was very good, especially only for $16!  It was served with a garlic cream sauce that was delicious!Atmosphere: its kinda small and I would not recommend for over groups of 4.  But its nice and small and kinda reminds me of places back in Italy.  It is extremely casual and simple.  Like I said, great place for a casual date.

Reviews.Author: Thy L.
Reviews.Content: Giacomo's was an extremely small and busy restaurant. The first time I tried to come here with my boyfriend the line was down the block and around the corner. I came with a few coworkers this time right after we got off and rushed over there. Lucky us! We got the last table. I was laughing and saying "suckersssss" to everyone outside waiting still :). JK. Not really.  It was so cramped inside. There were people hovering over our table and intruding in our space constantly, but the food was well worth it.Fried Calamari appetizer - get a small and share. This stuff was good but gotta save room for the main entree!Lobster Ravioli was so reasonably priced and still tasted amazing. You don't have to compromise your wallet for good food.Pumpkin Tortellini was a bit sweet for my taste, but everyone else at the table enjoyed it.Butternut Squash Ravioli was delicious. It's soaked in a very yummy sauce and the filling was not as sweet as the pumpkin, which fits better for my palette. Sauce makes my world turn :)Chicken Parmesan was not bad, but you should probably try their specialties if you come here. You can get Chicken Parmesan at any other Italian restaurant.Scallops with the Giacomo and Fra Diavolo sauce over penne was pretty good. The Giacomo sauce is made with minced lobster, red sauce and bechamel. The Fra Diavolo adds an extra spicy kick to the pasta. This was really good, but I kept biting on something crunchy, which I assume was lobster shell.Chicken Marsala was not dry at all and tasted like it was marinated in the marsala sauce for days.Highly recommend this place. Try to avoid the rush, especially in this cold New England weather, by going super early or super late.

Reviews.Author: Esther Y.
Reviews.Content: So the husband and I thought we were going to be super slick, slide in at 5:30 (I mean, who is eating at 5:30 besides us and retirees?)  and have a delish valentine's day meal.  Yeah, it didn't quite work out that way.  Apparently, I'm not slick enough b/c everyone else had the same thought. The wait wasn't too bad, we ended up being about 4 groups back, and were seated within 30 min. Don't get me wrong, if I got there any later, I may have ditched the restaurant and just opted for something else.We started with the calamari (yum! love the addition of the jalapenos) and then I had the fussili with lobster and shrimp in a mixture of the giacomo and diavolo sauce, and the hubs had the salmon pasta. Both were excellent.  In other Italian restaurants, I always thought that the pasta was a little skimpy and that I always left hungry...but not here! I basically ate 1/2 of my dish and needed to pack it to go! I'm a wimp!!!I would definitely go back, definitely tell people eat here, and definitely prep my stomach better.  Lesson learned.

Reviews.Author: Raymond W.
Reviews.Content: After two visits I'll say that Giacomo's is the best value of all the Italian restaurants I've been to in the North End. The price and quality are more favorable than the wait on a busy night and the no fuss service. Cash only also hurts.The garlic bread is a pretty gross rip off, but the fried calamari saved some points on apps. Ravioli will leave you hungry, so consider a regular pasta dish if you tend to be a bigger eater.

Reviews.Author: Jenny M.
Reviews.Content: If you're driving to North End, don't bother trying to find street parking. Just pay $10 at the parking structure and save yourself two hours! Better yet, don't drive at all! Unfortunately for us, my friend drove to Boston from Amherst to pick me up, so losing the car was not an option. After an unsuccessful two hours and learning every crook&cranny and all the fire hydrants surrounding Hanover street, we finally made it to Giacomo!Every time we drove by, the line got longer and longer. But luckily by the time we made it to the strip of restaurants, the early dinner crowd died down and we got seated immediately. It was perfect timing, because after we got seated, a line was forming again!Anyway, the food was scrumptious!!! It could be the hunger talking...wait, no...it really was delicious! Fried calamari for appetizer = yum! My friends ordered swordfish w/ pesto and salmon w/ tomato cream sauce. I had the lobster ravioli in garlic cream sauce. The dish was cooked to perfection, ravioli and sauce not overly soft or too creamy, and packed with flavor. It was so good and so worth the two hours of parking torture!

Reviews.Author: Eric K.
Reviews.Content: Yep, its all true....The line wasn't as bad as it looked.  The place was charming, waiter was good, food was as good as advertised, the price was more than fair ($17 bottle of wine is unheard of) and the experience was memorable.  That is all.  Enjoy

Reviews.Author: Adam Z.
Reviews.Content: There's always a line here for two simple reasons. Great food, and great prices. I can buy a bottle of wine here for under $20. No other restaurant in the north end offers this. Additionally the food is always seasoned and cooked to perfection. I'd eat here once a week if I had the time/money. The service is always snappy and quick. You feel very accommodated so people maybe feel rushed but just relax and realize that you spent 2 hrs standing in line, you deserve the food you waited for! Try it it's a north end staple!

Reviews.Author: Lan N.
Reviews.Content: Probably my favorite place for their Butternut Squash Ravioli and it gets me every time. The location that I go to is located in the South End because they offer RSVP as the one in the North End doesn't. Everything about this place is delicious.

Reviews.Author: Sherry H.
Reviews.Content: With all these raving reviews, you know what you are getting. The food is delicious, the portion large, and the price is right. Additionally, great house-made wine for $5/glass

Reviews.Author: Emily W.
Reviews.Content: Best in the North End and one of the tops in Boston....if the line outside is too long go to their South End location, not another North End tourist trap ;)  (oh yea, don't forget, cash only!!)

Reviews.Author: Sarah C.
Reviews.Content: Waited outside in the snow tonight for 30 mins. Service was horrible! The waitress was friendly at first but pushed for us to order appetizers. When the waitress found out that 2 out 4 people were ordering salads and the other 2 entrees she become outrageously rude saying "are you sure?" 2-3 times. She rolled her eyes and looked very upset. We still ordered 2 rounds of drinks and had to call her over to ask for a second round. She never refilled water or brought us bread like the other tables.
