The overall service was average. The staff was impersonal perhaps because they were so busy. They didn't accept credit cards. The wine and beer menu was small. Desert was non-existent. I'm glad we tried the restaurant. Would I go back...maybe.

Reviews.Author: Nick N.
Reviews.Content: Delicious food. The place is small and can be packed easily. Go early. The calamari is awesome; not too oily. The butternut squash ravioli was excellent; possibly my favorite. We also got the half lobster with pasta and the fussili, which was also good. Everything is nice and fresh.

Reviews.Author: Ash C.
Reviews.Content: The best Italian restaurant experience i have ever had so far. We ordered zuppa di pesce and a large order of calamari. Calamari is juicy not rubbery the sauce, fraduavolo, was so fresh i couldnt stop ordering!

Reviews.Author: Lea N.
Reviews.Content: The food is great.

Reviews.Author: Abir H.
Reviews.Content: The food here is amazing!! My favorite by far is the fra diablo. Their fried calamari is great for an appetizer. IF you're really hungry try the chicken parmesan. THe only problem with this place is the noise, it's ALWAYS full and since the tables are placed to close together it can bother you when you just want to enjoy some chit chat but have to deal with the noise. They don't take credit cards so bring cash with you. It's very reasonably priced. I love how they have a choice of type of pasta, with several sauces and your choice of fish. If you don't like waiting for a table try to reserve ahead of time, it's busy from opening time till closing time.....SERIOUSLY!! But then again that shows how good the food is ;)

Reviews.Author: Michael C.
Reviews.Content: I sat at the bar so was one of the fortunate people who didn't need to wait too long to be seated.  Once seated, I was greeted by Rosemary who showed me the chalkboard menu and went over a few things.  By the end of the night, I had one of the best Frutti de Mare linguini dishes that I have ever eaten.  The service is fast and efficient and the food comes out piping hot.  You have to get the Giacomo pasta sauce with it.  There's a bit of a spice too it but just perfect!  A must for any Italien food lovers out there, but don't forget to bring cash.  They do not take credit cards. =(Recommendations: Callamari and Fruitti di Mare

Reviews.Author: H G.
Reviews.Content: The best Italian (and best restaurant) in Boston !!!!!!My wife and I eat there two nights in the row while visitting BostonBoth have to wait for 30-40 mins outside in the line and worth it !!.

Reviews.Author: Joe C.
Reviews.Content: Phenomenal.  Best Calamari appetizer I've had outside Italy.  Fresh and cooked to perfection (not a single overcooked piece).  Great dishes such as the butternut squash ravioli or the Gnocchi.  We got a bottle of wine which was even fairly cheap (relative to restaurant standards).  I thought the scallops & pasta dish could have had more spices (the fishy flavor of the scallops was a bit overwhelming the pasta).  Next time I am in Boston, I am going to Giacomo's.  Get there early in the evening though, as the line starts to pile up and they do not take reservations.  Also remember that it is CASH ONLY.

Reviews.Author: Emily R.
Reviews.Content: This has been my favorite restaurant since I was a little girl so I think it's only natural that it be my first review. First of all, you do need to heed the advice that this is a tourist trap and quality does diminish and tempers within become shorter during tourist season. That being said, wait in line in the snow and slush and you'll have the most amazing meal and service. The wait staff is very informal and friendly and by the end of the meal you feel like you're right at home except its not your turn to do the dishes. As far as the food goes, it's great. The fra diavalo sauce is my go to but I also really enjoy the salmon and sundried tomato dish as well as the butternut squash ravioli. The portions are HUGE but if you get an appetizer (go for the calamari) you can split a dinner and its perfect!

Reviews.Author: Nicholas K.
Reviews.Content: I love Italian food.  Long lines always intrigue me, and one weekend not too long ago, a few friends and I decided to check this place out.  We ended up in a very cramped table off to the side, which I was expecting given the long wait.  The waitress was very nice, and even though it was pretty crazy outside, and that line wasn't getting any shorter, she didn't seem to rush us.  This gave me a very good impression.Finally we did order.  Man, is this place cheap.  Very cheap wine and everything, which is A-OK in my book.  We didn't start with any appetizers, which we figured they'd be happy with, given the line.  I went for the chicken marsala.  Another friend of mine went with the pumpkin ravioli and the final friend I was with had a seafood pasta.The chicken marsala was bad.  Very bad.  Everything from the presentation to the taste missed.  I thought the pasta was bland, and seemed akin to a pile of wet noodles.  The Chicken was pretty well prepared and marinated, but there was very little of it and it did not bring the dish back from the deep hole that it was digging.  The dishes that my friends ordered were very good, however.  The ravioli was especially good.Stick to the seafood or the ravioli here, if I ever find myself here again (sort of unlikely with so many other options and such a long line for this place) that is what I will do.

Reviews.Author: Sharo A.
Reviews.Content: Giacomo's is probably the most famous Boston Italian restaurant that doesn't take reservations.  People wait in line for upwards of an hour to get into this place.  The menu is constantly rotating, but is always affordable. I had the Frutti di Mare, it was superb.  The calamari was a bit greasy, but nothing that is uncommon.  Finally, despite the really fast turnover in this place--the service is pretty good. I would expand and take reservations, for the love of all that is delicious.

Reviews.Author: Andrew T.
Reviews.Content: I love Giacomo's!This is classic North End dining, small place, nothing to fancy, amazing food. Unique at Giacomo's are the menu options. While they have some truly amazing and unique dishes ready to go - they allow you to pick a pasta, sauce, and protein and kind of do it yourself.The wine is VERY reasonably priced which makes the whole experience that much more enjoyable.Hope you don't mind an early dinner, I try to get here around 6:30 to try and beat the line outside. I guess that's the cost of popularity.

Reviews.Author: Warren A.
Reviews.Content: Food was great and the atmosphere was just what we wanted - a unique uncomplicated little spot. True the place is tiny and one must wait outside on the sidewalk, but if you can slow down and enjoy the whole experience you are in for a treat.The butternut squash ravioli was very tasty, as was the calamari.I hope I have the opportunity to visit here again

Reviews.Author: Jeff H.
Reviews.Content: This really is as good as it gets. I really have not had Italian this good and I have been to Italy twice. All the pasta is clearly homemade and very fresh and cooked to a perfect al dente. I had a special dish which was a pasta with Lobster meat and shrimp in the house Giacomo sauce. Everything about this was great. There was a good amount of tender lobster, the shrimp had a great flavor and crunch. I am not even a big shrimp fan, but I loved this, it was cooked to perfection. The sauce also was incredible and I definitally would reccomend the house sauce which is made with a Lobster base.I went early, around 5:50-6:00 and we were able to get a seat right away, although the place was already crowded. So go early, but if you have to wait, it is worth it.

Reviews.Author: Dave A.
Reviews.Content: So, I reviewed that crappy Ricardo's Ristorante, but I think I should balance the force by reviewing a great Italian restaurant -- and that would be Giacomo's.  Hot.  Rushed.  Loud.  Cramped.  These are not words I would normally use to describe a great dining experience, but at Giacomo's they seem to fit.  Yeah, the place was cramped and loud and (on the August day we visited) kinda hot.  The service was rushed as they were trying to turn the tables around in this tiny spot.   That said, the atmosphere was kinda cool -- if you're looking for a uniquely "Boston" kinda thang.But wait.  We gotta talk about the food.  Let me put it simply.  When our waitress ran over and plopped our plates on the table, something happened...  the heavens opened up and a bright light shined down upon the table.  Angels sang.  The world was at peace.  The fettuccini with proscuitto and peas in a garlic cream sauce was one of the best things I ever ate -- it was so good, I nearly shed a tear.  It was so good, I wanted to slap my mama.  But I digress...My travel partner had a similar, near out-of-body experience with his plate of chicken fettuccini.  For both of us, it was the best Italian meal we've ever had and the benchmark by which all other Italian meals will be judged.The meal was so good, we weren't bothered by the hot, loud, and slightly chaotic atmosphere.  We actually ate and rushed a bit to make room for others to enjoy a great meal -- this is the kind of stuff you just gotta share.If you're looking for a quiet, romantic, dark Italian experience, Giacomo's ain't your place.  If you want amazing food combined with a great Boston experience, don't miss this spot.    If you go to Boston and don't make the time for Giacomo's, you'll regret it for the rest of your miserable life.  A few quick tips....  Take cash -- they don't accept credit cards.  Arrive early -- I recommend getting in line no later than 4:30 to avoid a long wait.  Get up, have brunch, skip lunch, and have an early dinner at Giacomo's.  After that, hit up one of the great Irish Pubs in Boston for a pint or two.

Reviews.Author: Steve U.
Reviews.Content: Great food. I don't remember what it was called, but it was lobster and clams with spaghetti and a red sauce and some merlot. Really, everything on the menu looked tasty, it was really hard to choose. The space is cramped, must be 25 people in this tiny room, customer service has...uuummmm...personality, and CASH ONLY (there's an ATM across the street). Although this all sounds negative, I really enjoyed this place. All those factors add charm(?). Besides, the food is brilliant and it was over all a great experience.

Reviews.Author: TJ P.
Reviews.Content: A great place with wonderful pasta. The famous butternut squash ravioli was great (if pretty creamy) and I loved my husband's pesto and mum's red sauce. The broccoli and garlic as an appetizer was surprisingly fantastic (don't order if you're hoping to score later!). Great price ($90 for four). Four of us got there at 9.15pm on a warm Saturday night in early May. We waited 30 minutes for a table. We were done with two courses by 10.30pm, so pretty quick. As the waiter joked with us, 'chew and screw' (eat and get the hell out to turn the table around ASAP!). No dessert! I hear this is the case with most restaurants around here (go to Modern down the street or Mike's across the road - great bakeries specializing in cannoli).Friendly staff and fabulously cheesy 80s music. Big minus for cash only! DODGY!!

Reviews.Author: erin n.
Reviews.Content: I went to Giacomo's this evening for the second time and it was my husband's first time.  The place is small, just as reported by half the people reviewing this restaurant, but there is no way I'm going to complain about such a small thing because it is well worth it!  The food is incredible...I don't know much about food other than the fact that I really, really, like it, but the dishes are traditional and simple with a little something special.  For example, I ordered gnocchi that was stuffed with goat cheese in a mushroom, basil plum tomato sauce.  Fan-freakin-tastic!  My first time I ordered butternut squash ravioli which was sooo good, too.The turn over is pretty fast so that the people waiting in the freezing cold don't have to wait forever, and as a patron, you're not waiting forever for the meal, refills, check, waiter, etc...I understand this aspect wouldn't appeal to those who like to camp out in restaurants, but i'm not one of those people.  Not to mention the prices!  I'll gladly pay Giacomo's prices (my dish was $17, the hubster's $26) considering I've paid much, much more for much, much less quality, service, taste!  By the way, it's cash only which, yes, is a pain but it didn't seem to matter too much as I sat there in a glassy-eyed, slightly intoxicated, food coma.  Please go!  It's a good time!

Reviews.Author: Grace H.
Reviews.Content: This North End family restaurant blows everything I've ever known about Italian food out of the water. Ordered their antipasto to start--a perfect balance between sweet roasted peppers and salty salami and olives. Coupled with the soft texture of their imported cheese (tasted like a softer version of parmigiano-reggiano), it definitely set the stage. Our first entree was the wild mushroom ravioli with a light pesto sauce. The pasta was cooked to perfection and the pesto was made with high quality olive oil--you can definitely taste the difference. The star of the night was definitely their lobster fusilli with Giacomo's house sauce (spicy lobster). This is one of two specials that never fall off the restaurant's list and rightfully so. The fusilli was cooked to perfection  and tossed with generous chunks of fresh lobster meat. Married with the restaurant's signature spicy lobster sauce, we were in pasta and lobster heaven. The place is small, the wait was long (don't go in big groups), but we met the friendliest people here--must be the food.

Reviews.Author: Peter Li-Yang W.
Reviews.Content: I love their food. For appitizer try fried calamari, it's amazing texture and flavor. And try it with the dip on the side. I get a scallop with giacomo sauce, it's a lobster based sauce with creamy and rich flavor. Normally um not a big fan but this time I surrender! The amount of food is authentic, the cheapest white wine cost $16 for a bottle. Try it, if you are in Boston, totally worthy!

Reviews.Author: Kendall H.
Reviews.Content: If God created a horrible italian restaurant run by barbarians raised in the Sahara Desert  with no culinary education, no knowledge of food outside their upbringing, learned from every single mistake that could possibly have been made and opened up a second italian restaurant in Boston's historic north end... this would be it (the second restaurant that is).Simple, rustic, satisfying Italian food prepared correctly coupled with friendly/fast service.  Not pretentious, reasonably priced and a great time.  The wait is inevitable, but so essential to being a part of the experience.  Really can't ask for much more.  Easily worth the wait and the extra time to add another review to their hundreds already on yelp.

Reviews.Author: Alexis W.
Reviews.Content: I have to be honest I don't see where the average of 4.5 stars come from. The wait staff were very friendly and it's a cute restaurant with an old school Italian feel. I enjoyed the pumpkin ravioli but it wasn't the best pasta I've ever had. The seafood looked great but the friends we went with also couldn't claim it as being the best. I guess I expected a bit more and I really hyped myself up after reading reviews when truth be told it was slightly above average. Maybe I should have had the lobster ravioli?

Reviews.Author: Jess W.
Reviews.Content: Christmas came early this year when I waited JUST 30 minutes outside of Giacomo's for a table and not the full hour that I stood there during a previous visit.Food- ridiculously fresh, huge portions, served piping hot.I've had the 1/2 lobster special with fra diavolo (spicy) sauce, lobster ravioli (creamy and rich), butternut squash ravioli (sweet and savory), and the fried calamari appetizer before. ALL DELICIOUS!!Service- you better know what you want or make up your mind fast because the waiters will definitely rush you.Price- for the quality of the sauce and the freshness of the seafood, the prices are definitely very reasonable. Don't ask for a recommendation of what's good here? EVERYTHING!Do yourself a big favor and DON'T drive. Parking is impossible with all of the "North End Resident Parking" signs that are virtually everywhere. We somehow missed this memo and got a ticket. Of course this would happen to me.

Reviews.Author: Fred V.
Reviews.Content: Over 800 reviews can't be wrong. Very small with the menu on the wall. Prepare to wait for a while to get a table but... BUT! Well worth it. All the food is fantastic and the owner is right in there mixing it up with you. Make sure if you buy wine you Salute! or the owner won't stop pestering you until you do. Fantastic and worth the wait! CASH ONLY!

Reviews.Author: Jonathan H.
Reviews.Content: Wow .. everything is great here..We literally ordered 2 additional orders of garlic bread after trying it. The pasta is wonderful and the sauces were amazing.I tried the Spicy Lobster Tomato sauce (Along with Clams / Mussels  / Lobster) over pasta.. Was simply out of this world good.Ceaser salad also was very rich on flavor.

Reviews.Author: Nancy W.
Reviews.Content: I've seen the lines and have read the reviews, and the only thing I wonder is... "really, guys? really?"You can find much better Italian food elsewhere. I also wouldn't give an Italian restaurant more than 3 stars if they don't offer handmade pasta that's made daily... Flavors were good, service was okay, but all in all, I wouldn't make the effort to fight against tourists to go back to this place, especially if the same amount of money can buy me a better experience at Sportello.

Reviews.Author: Camille M.
Reviews.Content: Came here at around 6pm on a Wednesday night and waited about 20 minutes on line in the rain. Wasn't sure what I was getting into, but man was it worth it.Got the mussels with calamari in butter and oil sauce (scampi?), and my date got the works in a tomato mix sauce -- I forget the name of the sauces at the moment. Both were perfectly seasoned, with perfectly cooked seafood -- not too overdone, just right. I thought I was going to need salt and pepper but I didn't at all. Both pastas tasted extremely good! The best Italian I've ever had.

Reviews.Author: Krysia V.
Reviews.Content: My family just went here yesterday for Father's Day. There were 6 of us, celebrating my father, and we each got a different dish. EVERYTHING, including the bread, was delicious. The portions were large, yet depending on your appetite, might have been perfect or leave enough for take home. We ordered fried calamari, swordfish and tuna fettucini with a creamy pesto sauce, salmon and sun dried tomato served over fettucini in a lobster based tomato sauce, lobster ravioli, summer squash ravioli, and zuppa di pesce house special in fra diavolo sauce (including a cabernet wine). All of our dishes came out together, steaming hot, and gorgeous. There was not one thing we did not love. It's a popular place, and pretty small, so there is always a line to get in. It opens at 4pm. We got there at 3:15 and were the second in line. Our food took longer than other tables, but I knew it was because we were a larger party. It was worth the wait. I'm not sure how long other customers had to stand in line, but I know it took us about an hour to finish all our food.This a great place to bring out of town guests for a true North End experience, family members for special occasions, and would be a nice place for a date too. They do not take reservations though, so you either get there early or wait!

Reviews.Author: Simon F.
Reviews.Content: Great food. except the time outside waiting :)

Reviews.Author: bru a.
Reviews.Content: We went there seeing a 4.5 star over 1000 reviewers. We also heard about the exceptional long waiting line. It sounded like the best thing ever existed in north end. To be honest, the food was ok, maybe a little above average. Don't know because we had too much hope or what, nothing really stood out. One star was given to the service. The four of us were cramped to a table that is designed for two. Hard to fit four plates on the table, and just forget it if you have appetizer or anything. The older lady who served us was very rude in general. One of us wanted to try a second entry and was replied very rudely "you can't do this. don't ever do this again" and a dirty look. On the bill, gratitude was added in, no wonder she didn't care about a decent serve.

Reviews.Author: Amy W.
Reviews.Content: Maybe I ordered the wrong thing; although I don't remember asking for a plate of grease with some soggy eggplant parmesan slapped onto it. I'm being the total weirdo here and stating that I enjoyed the atmosphere and cozy quarters, and had no palate for the cuisine; I've had tastier Italian food from a shopping mall. I LOVE Italian so I'm not sure what the issue is with me and Giacomo's. I would be willing to give it another try if I ever get the urge to wait in a really long line again.

Reviews.Author: Evan S.
Reviews.Content: The Swiss Chard Ravioli is "to die for". I haven't had a meal this good in far too long. Well worth the trip, and very reasonably priced for the quality of service and food. This is a must do if you're in boston. It's one of the rare times that a Yelp review meets expectations. It's four stars all the way.

Reviews.Author: Cindy H.
Reviews.Content: This is the best Italian food I've ever had. The fried calamari is tender, fresh and perfectly crispy (without being covered in batter). My seafood fettuccine with the spicy red lobster-based sauce was delicious! The homemade noodles were all covered thoroughly with the sauce, and my shrimp and scallops were very fresh. (Now I know what fresh scallops taste like - almost like a marshmallow.) I have to come back and try other dishes on the menu!

Reviews.Author: C B.
Reviews.Content: This is a tiny little restaurant.  If you want to go somewhere to have a conversation.  Go somewhere else.  You will be shouting at each other to possibly be heard.  The tininess also influences their flexibility when it comes to being late on your reservation, which isn't something I strive to be, but when in a city that isn't your own, this can happen.  Here, they will not seat you until everyone in your party has arrived, and if some of them are late, while you are standing right there in front of them, they will give away your damn table.  That was super annoying.  Thanks Elisabeth (Dragon tattoo chick)!However, putting all that aside, their food is fantastic!  I highly recommend the lobstah' (say it like a New Englander) ravioli.  It put all the other dishes to shame and the other dishes were quite good.  The ravioli not only has lobster in it, it has lumps of it on top of the pasta as well, and I am not talking about decorative style...it was heaping.  I highly recommend eating here, but leave obscenely early for the restaurant because Boston is a mess when it comes to traffic and you will have to suck down the $14 valet because there is no readily available parking either.

Reviews.Author: Eugi H.
Reviews.Content: Took my brother here to eat the night I arrived in Boston. I read that this was the best Italian place in Boston, and I love me some Italian food. I went in with high expectations, and though they were not fully met, it was still a good experience, enough to warrant 4 stars.The wait here is supposedly really long, so we dropped my brother off at the restaurant to get on the waiting list while we drove around to look for parking. It was the best idea I've ever had, because by the time we found a lot to park in ($25, I was crying inside) and walked back to the restaurant, we were just in time to be seated. No wait, hooray!The staff was super nice but the pace here is quick. It's not a restaurant where you sit around and chat over dessert and coffee in the end, more of an order, eat, out kind of place. And since the place is tiny and they have a large line, it makes sense. We ordered the calamari appetizer, the butternut squash ravioli, and seafood spinach fettuccine to share. The calamari was good, though it got a bit too salty for me towards the end, and I could have done without the jalapenos that were also fried and served with the calamari. I felt like it was more of a filler and felt slightly jipped of calamari :(. The ravioli was absolutely fabulous, the pasta had a great bite and the butternut squash was sweet. I loved that there was asparagus included in it and the sauce was creamy and rich. Definitely a dish to get there every time, I could see why it was a favorite amongst yelpers. The seafood spinach fettuccine was a mixed bag for me though. I LOVED how fresh the seafood was, the salmon was amazing, cooked perfectly. The spinach and sundried tomatoes it was cooked with gave great flavor and I loved the sauce. What I did not love, however, was the fettuccine itself. The pasta was overcooked and not salted enough when boiled. That was quite a letdown for me since I love pasta so much. But that was really the only major complaint I had about the meal. Well, that and the jalapenos in my calamari. Overall, it is a solid Italian restaurant. If it is the best Boston has to offer, though, I don't think that it can compare to some Italian restaurants in LA.

Reviews.Author: Cat D.
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing, as you can tell from all of the reviews. It's pretty tiny and feels a bit crowded and the service is extremely efficient if not very welcoming. Worth it for the food! I had the calamari (a MUST) and pumpkin tortellini, which were both great.  The prices are reasonable for food of this quality, and you can get a glass of wine for $5!The line moved much more quickly than I expected - we waited about 30 mins on a Sunday evening.

Reviews.Author: Cara C.
Reviews.Content: After reading all these great reviews we were so looking forward to this restaurant. Waited in line like everyone else mentioned. not too long. Service was ok, not nasty like other reviews. We ordered burratto, tough yuk! Fried calamari, greasy, but ok! Fra-diavlo sauce was rated 5 stars so 3 of us got it, sauce was 5 stars... Clams  & mussels a 1, lobster cooked to perfection, however the claw unlike the tail didnt come pre-cut! Not sure about you but I'm not picking up a claw I'm RED sauce and cracking it over my clothes! Overall we say a 3...but haven't compared it yet to the other north end Italian restaurants. Cash only but that didnt bother us at all! Wine great value $17 a bottle for most. I heard Boston little Italy was better than NY.... Don't agree with that!

Reviews.Author: Jeff D.
Reviews.Content: I expected this to be a tourist trap. Not the case, at least it wasn't the case on a Monday night at 9pm. It was slow enough to have good conversation with the staff. The food was fresh. The portions were perfect and the price was right. Plus....my pasta was al dente, so I left a happy man.

Reviews.Author: Chloe K.
Reviews.Content: So great! Well worth the wait. My group waited over an hour!! But our waiter stayed cool under pressure. And sometimes you make friends waiting on line outside. Very cool atmosphere inside. Quirky tiny rustic italian place. Loved the giacomo sauce hmm go try it.

Reviews.Author: Misti M.
Reviews.Content: This place was ok but I wouldn't go again or recommend it.  There are better places in the North End.

Reviews.Author: Laura H.
Reviews.Content: Great food a bit of a wait to get in and they squeezed us into two seats right at the counter so we got to see them cooking up close. Small place but if you don't mind waiting awesome italian food

Reviews.Author: Kaitlin H.
Reviews.Content: I have absolutely no idea where all of these reviews are coming from. Giacomo's was one of worst dining experiences my boyfriend and I have ever had. We came in late on a weeknight and were half-greeted by an unpleasant woman who nonchalantly motioned to a table. This woman unfortunately ended up being our waitress for the time we spent there, with help from her odd busboy who practically stared at us the entire time we ate, standing right next to our table and put on his grey hoodie DURING DINNER SERVICE. Both of them wreaked of cigarettes. Upon sitting we were not given any menus but told to look up at the chalkboard and "pick our seafood." We weren't planning on ordering seafood. We tried to order salad but they ran out (?) and this lady did not give us one second to think. She was practically hunched over my boyfriend asking us what we were ordering. We had only been sitting there for about 5 minutes and already wanted to leave. We quickly ordered the calamari and two chicken parm entrees. The food came out fast and piping hot. It was less than alright and even if it was amazing, it was nearly impossible to enjoy anything in this ambience of employees counting money in different corners of the restaurant and a young man staring at us with a hoodie over his uniform. Out of all the great restaurants in the North End I can't imagine why anyone would choose this place. It really did seem like no one in there knew how to behave in or run a good restaurant. We could have had a much nicer night somewhere else and I am so disappointed that this was our first North End date night experience.

Reviews.Author: April P.
Reviews.Content: Worth the wait!!!!! We waited an hour and a half with 2 kids and the smile on my daughter's face as she dug into her muscles and calamari was worth it's weight in gold. The entire time on line floated by, like it didn't even exist. Just bring cash. No credit.

Reviews.Author: Charissa H.
Reviews.Content: Meh.  Not THAT great.  Too much hype.

Reviews.Author: Carmel I.
Reviews.Content: Best Italian restaurant I have ever been to. The food is like no other. Just a heads up: It's cash only. Also- Do not be offended if the owner is rude to you. We were told that he just has a strong personality and to not take it personally. At first my sister and I were a bit taken back, but we ended up joking with him and having a great time.

Reviews.Author: Anne G.
Reviews.Content: Went to Giacomo's last night and it definitely lived up to all the reviews.The butternut squash ravioli and the salmon linguini were to die for. Then our fantastic server Chris gave us a taste of the pumpkin tortellini and they were heaven. I strongly recommend this restaurant when in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Alexandra Z.
Reviews.Content: So, i decided to go dolo to Giacomo's. The wait wasn't as long as i expected, but my waitress was amazing, and seated me at the bar. I had ordered the Calamari & it did not disappoint, honestly. As my entree I ordered The Lobster Ravioli and boy ... Hands down best pasta dish I've had, I wanted to order another order to go. I will defitnetly be coming back on my next trip to Boston!

Reviews.Author: Chuck R.
Reviews.Content: You will not find a better Italian meal for the money. The calamari was cooked perfectly. The butternut squash was extremely good as was pretty much everything we ordered. Being crammed into this place that seats about 36 is just part of the experience. Italian waitresses with heavy accents just makes the food taste that much better. If the line is to the corner its just over an hour long wait. Get there early and bring cash!

Reviews.Author: Jami D.
Reviews.Content: By far the my favorite resturant in ALL of BOSTON. I go here any time I can, I can't say enough good things about Giacomo's! The BUTTERNUT SQUASH RAVIOLI is OUT OF THIS WORLD! I'm telling you, you have to get it. I went one time and didn't get it, I was with people who did, and I ended up trying to eat all of theirs!!Yeah the wait outside isn't fun, but it is totally worth it. Anyone who says otherwise is crazy. If you haven't been here just trust me, you'll love it. The downsides that others have pointed out won't seem to matter once you take that first bite!

Reviews.Author: michelle w.
Reviews.Content: This place Always has a wait, which is much of the reason why I haven't been here up until now. However, this time around I had friends in town and we thought we could catch up during our wait. It was only 30 mins until we got seated  (on a Tuesday night) which was not bad, considering I've seen the line twice the size. The prices and food portions were huge and very reasonable (most dishes are around $15). Oh and where else can you get a $15 bottle of wine? The dishes were pretty standard, but really flavorful. I choose the seafood pasta dish with the garlic sauce. They certainly gave a lot of pasta, would have liked to have seen more seafood. Overall a great experience, and my friends really enjoyed it!

Reviews.Author: Shawn B.
Reviews.Content: This place has all the great dishes of Boston's North End without pretentiousness and prices. The food is great and you can get a bottle of wine for under 20 bucks. I've had the Lobster Raviolis and the Butternut Squash Gnocchi ....and both were very good. Worth the long line out the door, so don't let that deter you when you arrive unless the weather sucks. Pick up a Cannoli at Mike's and have dessert while you wait.

Reviews.Author: Phoenix P.
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best meals I have had in Boston.The staff was super friendly. The food was unreal and the wine was delicious. This is the real deal.Minus one star for having to wait outside in line for an hour and fifteen minutes to be seated.

Reviews.Author: Jackie K.
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't give this place 5 stars if it was not worth over a half hour wait at 9pm in the middle of the week. IT WAS WORTH IT. Lobster Ravioli, Lobster Ravioli, Lobster Ravioli. Get it, eat it, love it. I crave it, right now, at 12pm... mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmThe waiter was too cute (lil old italian guy)And we were kind of shuffled in and outbut who cares, when you have tons of delicious pasta in front of you and a glass of wine. Fabulous.Go and wait, don't give in to a neighboring restaurant, even though they'll be trying to take your order on the street. YOU CAN DO IT.

Reviews.Author: Naomi H.
Reviews.Content: The long line was worth it, as countless others have pointed out. The place is crowded and everyone sits elbow to elbow, but I didn't mind because the food was great.We started off with the calamari app. Dish was large enough for the 4 of us to share. It was very fresh, and had just the right amount of kick from the peppers. The tangy dipping sauce was a nice addition. Best I've ever had. Everyone ordered some kind of ravioli, and they all looked fabulous. I got the lobster ravioli and it was mouthwatering. Just the right amount of cheese and lobster in every bite. The buttery, creamy sauce was so light and flavorful, it didn't overpower the pasta.Service was sufficient, quick and to the point.  Overall, very affordable compared to nearby restaurants. I will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Author: Steve M.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Boston for our honeymoon (I know, I know, all Bostonians were asking WTH) and Giacomo's was the only restaurant that came up on 4 different lists we had from 4 different people. We were walking around North End and found this tiny little place and took note of the hours and since we had a hockey game to get too, decided to get there at opening. Boy, it was a good thing we did. We got there about 5:04 and the restaurant was already packed. We opted for the 2 seast at the 'bar'. Keep in mind, it's not really a bar. It's a tall structure that they put a bunch of stuff on. Honestly, I don't remember what we ordered as far as entree's are concerned. I do remember that we were both very satisfied with our meals and thought they were outstanding. What we do remember is that the calamari was off the hook. I am not a huge calamari fan and it took some serious arm twisting from my wife to get us to order it. I am so glad we did. It was very light, tasted extremely fresh and not at all greasy. It almost led to our first fight as a married couple as we were duking it out for the last few pieces on the plate. Smartly, I let her lick the plate clean after we polished the whole thing off. Ok...not really but we were both really tempted. It was that good. Just be warned, if we had gotten there 5 minutes later, we would have been standing outside in the cold with 8 of our closest friends. 20 minutes later and it would be with a good 20 people. Obviously, the folks waiting know it's well worth it.

Reviews.Author: Ali B.
Reviews.Content: Excellent italian food!Service - snappy and quick but always friendly.  Julie is my favorite!Food - Oh my where to start.  I always get lobster and shrimp with giacomo sauce over pasta.  One tip is to ask for fra-como sauce where they combine giacomo and fra-diavlo sauce, absolutely outstanding!  There calamari is incredible, always tender never rubbery.  Mozz. Marinara is also a great app.They are also incredibly consistent, I have been here many times and they always deliver consistent excellent quality food.The only downside is the wait, expect to wait at least an hour on a weekend night.

Reviews.Author: Melissa L.
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome.  The seafood pasta with fra diavlo sauce was outstanding and with a bottle of wine was only $65 (for TWO people!)!!!  The food was SOOOOOOOOO good!!! This place lives up to the hype.  If there's a line outside, there's a reason why.  Bring a magazine and wait - it will be well worth it.(Warning - this is a cash only place, so be prepared!  If not, there's an ATM literally right across the street)

Reviews.Author: Liz G.
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine highly recommended this restaurant when she heard I was going to Boston.  She warned me that there would likely be a long line out the door because it is a smaller place and quite popular locally, but I shrugged off her advice thinking no one would wait outside in the Boston December cold.  I was, to my surprise, quite mistaken, and so I found myself huddled in a line with the masses for about a half an hour, as well.The wait, however, was well worth the charming atmosphere, mouthwateringly tasty food, and excellent wine selection that awaited inside Giacomo's doors.  The service was incredibly friendly, and not at all in a rush given the ever-present line out the door.All in all, don't let the line dissuade you--this place is worth the wait, for sure.  Also, remember to bring cash, as they don't accept credit cards.  The seafood dish I ordered tasted  incredibly fresh, and the entire experience left me vowing to go back here every time we go to Boston.

Reviews.Author: Tommy L.
Reviews.Content: Best resrestaurant in the North End by far.We had to wait 15 min on a Tuesday evening as they don't take reservations and well worth the wait.It was our first time there and the waiter had a feeling we were a bit clueless without menus.  He blurted out the menus were on the walls and that we needed to tell him what sauce we wanted if we choose XXXX but luckily i had read up on dishes to try and sauces to go for.  We ordered the Butternut Squash Ravioli and 1/2 lobster with Fra Diovolo sauce along with a  bottle of Chainti and was not disappointed.  Food is simply amazing.If you don't mind tight quaters and down to earth waiters that tell you how it is this place is for you.

Reviews.Author: Jeff B.
Reviews.Content: Giacomo's was a good experience overall. The food was good, tasted fresh, and is worth coming back for.  I had the caprese salad first, which was pretty standard, but exactly what I was looking for.  A couple of Peroni's later, my shrimp and scallops served over linguine with Giacomo sauce came out piping hot.  If you order one of the entree options, order it with Giacomo sauce...it's a homemade lobster cream sauce and was good.  Unfortunately, I didn't have any dessert here, but recommend you have a canoli down the street at Mike's Pastry!!!Service - very rushed and not overwhelmingly nice the night we went.  We were rushed to place our order and the dishes nearly flew onto the table...good thing i had my hands ready to catch the hot plate!Although this is not the best Italian food I've ever had, I definitely recommended it and would go back.  However, I had no wait and i'm not sure i would wait more than 30 minutes to get in considering there are a lot of other restaurants in the area.  Also, they are CASH ONLY!  So be prepared, unlike many of the tables around us.  Most dishes are in the 15-20 range, but specials were higher than that.  I'll probably try something else next time I'm in the north end, but I'm sure I'll be back at Giacomo's at some point.

Reviews.Author: Monica N.
Reviews.Content: Small space so be prepared to wait... but it'll be worth it.Loved the food.  I had the fettucine with salmon and sun dried tomato... yummi!  Can't go wrong with the fried calamari either.Our waiter was a little scattered running between tables, but the overall experience was good.  I'd come back!

Reviews.Author: Canarsie Mama S.
Reviews.Content: FIrst TImer at Giacomo's and now am a believer!!Only had to wait about 30 minutes on a Thursday for a party of 5.Calamari fritti and Mussels with scampi sauce was unbelievably good. Kept asking for more bread for the scampi sauce.The Fra Diavolo sauce is spicy - but not overly so. Abundant servings of shrimp and scallops with linguine. The Giacomo sauce was also very goodGreat prices on wine and the servers are fun but quick.  This is not a place to linger.  Now want to try their place in the South End to compare.

Reviews.Author: Andrew B.
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing and has some great Italian, even for the North End.  There was a line outside and we had to wait a while.  So be sure to check the weather report (And don't be like me, the visitor from Arizona who didn't understand places are still cold in April).  Depending on the night the line moves pretty fast, though smaller groups get in quicker.  The place is tiny inside and seating is limited, so I wouldn't show up with more then a party of four, two probably better.Once you get in and seated the service was great and the food was amazing.  The bread came fast, the appetizer came fast and the meal came fast and drinks were always full.  Add that to some totally amazing food, it was well worth a wait outside in the cold.A word of warning, cash only and the ATM across the street costs $2.50.  Opps.

Reviews.Author: Kay W.
Reviews.Content: This place does not take reservations and the wait can be a little long but this is something you know from the beginning. Their food is AMAZING. The calamari is the best I've ever had and their sauce is fresh. The calamari is fried to perfection and never rubbery. The butternut squash ravioli are sweet without feeling like candy and every pasta dish I've had whether from the menu or off the specials are delicious. The dinner for 2 is a steal for $55 including a lobster, clams, mussels, scallops and calamari. Throw in an extra $10 for a bottle of wine. This dish can serve 3 people easily. The service is great and the servers are very knowledgeable about the menu. Yes it's a challenge getting around the restaurant because it's super tiny and tables shift over and over to accommodate the different parties. However, the food is worth the wait and the service is top notch.

Reviews.Author: Ali P.
Reviews.Content: If you could put heaven on a plate, this would be it!  SO GOOD! There is a hefty wait at what seems like nearly all times for this place, but it is SO worth it.  Generally you are seated in a 1/2 hour or less (even with a party of 4-5). I recently ate here with four of my friends - all but one of us had eaten at the wonderful Giacomo's before.  On our second trip out from California we knew that the last restaurant of the trip HAD to be this one.  At this no-nonsense eatery, you'll see a menu on the wall with your pasta and sauce options.  Your server will hand you a handwritten list with the night's specials.  You'll have about a solid couple of minutes to decide what you want.  Look outside the window - those hungry people are jealous, and staring at your food.  Go ahead, get the 1/2 lobster special with the Giacomo's sauce (or for vegetarians like me - they do the butternut squash without the prosciutto and have other TO DIE FOR veggie options). Savor your food.  Don't worry, they'll get theirs soon enough.  Word of caution - this place is not suitable for vegans.  Don't even try it.  I'm sorry to say it, but you would be gravely disappointed!

Reviews.Author: Cassie H.
Reviews.Content: Lobster ravioli was amazing! 16$ bottlesOf wine and great service. Absolutely worth the wait. Cash only.

Reviews.Author: Gary G.
Reviews.Content: If you don't like waiting there are many good restaurants in the North End.  We decided to wait and it, in my opinion, was well worth it.We arrived about 45 minutes before they opened (Saturday) after spending the day on the Freedom Trail) and were 1st on line.The waitress was very personable and explained the various sauces to us.We ordered calamari as an appetizer and it was very good. Much better than the same appetizer at Legal Sea Foods the night before.I ordered shrimp and scallops in the sauce the waitress recommended (giacomo) and it was outstanding.  My wife's veal was delicious. My daughter ordered her standard (chicken parm) which was also very good.Cash only...and the entire bill, with tip and wine...less than $100.Can't beat it!

Reviews.Author: J R.
Reviews.Content: Great Calamari, perfectly fried with red and hot peppers, and sweet marinara for dipping. Seems like standard bar food, but this was the best I've had.. $7 for small( very large) serving. I also had the excellent salmon fettuccine with sun dried tomato.  My girlfriend opted for the more expensive special, fussili with shrimp and lobster. The  pasta was simply terrific on all the dishes, but the lobster and shrimp were extremely overcooked. I faced the window and felt bad as I stuffed my faced while dozens of freezing people looking into the dining room waiting for their table.We were seated just before the rush and didn't have to wait. The waitress will rush you a little, but they are friendly and hard working.  They are really busy, so don't expect an ass kissing. We'll  surely be back.Oh, CASH ONLY!!!

Reviews.Author: Holly F.
Reviews.Content: This place is just as good as everyone says it is. Delicious, authentic Italian food for a great price. Fast service, very friendly environment. If you don't mind dealing with the New England weather while in line, it's so worth the wait! The only reason I didn't give Giacomo's 4 or 5 stars is because of how quickly you were almost forced to eat dinner. I was almost put off by how rushed the meal seemed. After waiting outside in line for an hour in the brutal wind it would have been nice to be able to take our time to enjoy dinner, but we only were in the restaurant for a grand total of 30 minutes. Service was very fast, and our orders were taken (including drinks, appetizers, and entrees) within five minutes of sitting down, and the food took less than ten minutes to come to the table. The check was at the table as we were taking our last bites, if not before. It all felt very rushed... although I can't say I blame them for wanting a very fast turnover due to the huge line that is outside. I'll definitely return :)

Reviews.Author: Matt H.
Reviews.Content: What can be said about Giacomo's that hasn't already been said? It is top notch Italian and well worth the 1hr wait (mercifully it was warm out). It's a bustling Italian place and it was loud, busy, and perfect. It would take VERY little to convince me to become a regular here...too bad I don't live in Boston.I had the fruit de mer with a mixed sauce (can't remember the name). My hosts had the lobster fusilli. We all shared a calamari app. Food was excellent and service was prompt - absolutely recommended.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer D.
Reviews.Content: I've been here four times now. Each time with a wait, each time worth it.Giacomo's offers fresh, inexpensive (for seafood), and tasty dishes. This is not the place to come for a romantic date, or with a group of people. I'd say stay away if you have a group larger than four, maybe five. The dining space is very small, and sometimes you're basically sitting at the same table as the group next to you. The service has always been good and swift. They try to get you in and out quickly as there's always a line of people waiting to get in. Lingering is frowned upon. That's okay though as there's many great dessert/coffee options all around that are a must when in the North End. I've tried something new every time I have been here. Each has been delicious. I've had the fried calamari, salmon fettucini, butternut squash ravioli, pumpkin tortellini, and the scallop linguine with spicy Giacomo sauce.  I think my favorite so far is the scallop linguine. My husband's favorites are the mussels and calamari linguine, and the clams and mussel linguine. Both with spicy Giacomo sauce. My longest wait was on a clear Friday evening in September. I'd say I probably had to wait an hour and a half. Every other visit has been about a 45  minute wait. Come on a weeknight, just before they open, or on a rainy/snowy evening for a shorter wait. Although, my last visit was on a rainy Wednesday night, and I still had to wait a good 45 minutes.

Reviews.Author: Ariana S.
Reviews.Content: Giacomo's, Giacomo's is very good! Giacomo's is a fun little place to come and have an upbeat and quick Italian meal. If you are planning to relax when coming here, think not because this tiny place is all but that! Be prepared to wait up to 2 hours for a table. The restaurant is very small and cozy only fitting about 8 tables plus two people at the bar watching over the kitchen - My personal favorite! Surprisingly though, the line moves quickly and the service is fast inside too. Other than the service being fast, it is nothing. If you are like me and love parm. cheese, the man will throw a teaspoon on the plate before running away! I asked the waiter again if I could have some more and he replied saying, " I gave you some already!" and ran away again. In my book, that doesn't go down so good. The Chicken Parm and Shrimp Scampi is excellent. Not to mention the amazing smell of calimari that fills the place! Sometimes, in the winter a waitress will come out with a plate of callimari to faithful customers and let them have samples! I would recommend Giacomo's to anyone seeking a fast paced delicious Italian meal. Giacomo's is also perfect for a cozy date right sitting right by the counter overlooking the kitchen.

Reviews.Author: Carrie T.
Reviews.Content: Awesome place. Great food for the price. Their calamari was delicious along with everything else.  Worth the wait. Cute venue as well.

Reviews.Author: Ippei T.
Reviews.Content: Yummiest pasta dishes ever.  The sauces are to die for.  I always get the Giacomo sauce (lobster-based red sauce), and it is out of this world.The wait can be long, the space is tight, they don't take reservations, and they aren't open for lunch. Give yourself 45 minutes.  Despite these setbacks, this place is worth it.  In fact, I don't consider these setbacks at all...the long line is a testament to their quality food.  (and don't worry; once you are in there, they don't rush you out.  but people know better to not relax and loiter around.  You go to this place for the food.)Compare them to the other establishments in North End...who became tourist traps, jacked up their prices, and ride the coattail of the neighborhood's reputation.  The quality has gone way down over the last few decades.  You would be sad to realize that some of those places are owned by big dogs.  Yep.    Not Giacomo's.

Reviews.Author: Katie L.
Reviews.Content: Long lines & no reservations. Food is good, but there are places with better service / atmosphere for similar quality of food.

Reviews.Author: Samanta F.
Reviews.Content: very good

Reviews.Author: Anthony M.
Reviews.Content: Generous portions of good italian food.  Linguine and clams are very flavorful, but lack of fresh pasta noodles is noticeable.  Great atmosphere, but be prepared to wait in line for a seat.

Reviews.Author: Alex P.
Reviews.Content: This place really doesn't need another 5 star review. Just go. It's worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Rob O.
Reviews.Content: When I went out to an early dinner here I felt like the late guy to the party. They open at 4:30 and I found myself wondering why I was waiting at the door at 4 o'clock in the afternoon for dinner, but in literally seconds there was a line down the block that would apparently regenerate all night long. Everyone in line seemed to know how this place worked, it was a bit foreign to me, but I liked it right away. They pack a ton of people in this tiny dining room and the waitstaff hustles- but with charm. The waiters were a riot, actually and the interior was very cool. Oh yeah, it's cash only! The food was incredible and VERY affordable. They had an unbelievable bottle deal on some delicious wine (buy one get one half off as i recall?). Like I said the food was great, but it was the new and different experience that really made this little North End gem so much fun! Fra Diavolo, was remarkable, by the way.

Reviews.Author: Bill B.
Reviews.Content: This place took me back to being in my grandmother's home and kitchen. The service was friendly and personable. The food was incredible although the courses came out very fast. The caprese salad was excellent. The mussels were incredible and their Homemade fussile with lobster and shrimp was amazing. Total cost for two including a bottle of wine ($95) and that included two apps, two entrees and the bottle of wine. Hard to beat that deal. They do not take reservations and only take CASH so come with a pocket full of it. I would highly recommend this place to anyone visiting Boston.

Reviews.Author: Larry F.
Reviews.Content: My wife came here 24 years ago while in school and insisted we return on our family trip to Boston.  She had to have the Zuppa di Pesce.   We got there at 6:15 pm. and waited one hour to get seated.  It was completely worth it.  One of life's best meals.  Despite the bustling atmosphere, our waitress who has been there over 25 years herself was attentive, pleasant and accommodating.Giacomo's was a definite highlight of our stay in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Scott L.
Reviews.Content: Great affordable Italian in the North End! This place is about average sized for a lot of the restaurants nearby. It can get busy during the times you'd expect, but the Northend location doesn't take reservations (the South End does)...so if you don't want to wait long for a table show up early. Service was pleasant and prompt, and most importantly the food is amazing!

Reviews.Author: Tricia F.
Reviews.Content: I go to the South End Giacomo's - they take reservations, and its easier to find parking. Food is always excellent in both places - especially the pasta and seafood dishes. Only issue is that service is fast-paced, and sometimes feels rushed. And it gets loud - but if you go with a large group, your voices will just blend with the din.

Reviews.Author: Justin M.
Reviews.Content: Amazing food!! The place is tiny, you wait in line outside and get kind of rushed inside BUT it is definitely worth every uncomfortable minute. Not a place to have a LONG meal and take your time. It's go go go but delicious and amazing!!

Reviews.Author: La F.
Reviews.Content: I have been here twice now and both times were memorable (good memorable)! We ate early, within an hour of their opening, and didn't wait either time. After a day of sightseeing in Boston we were ready to eat early. Hit Mike's Pastry for dessert after. That is a great meal!!

Reviews.Author: Mike I.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic food at a great value. Friendly service. Awesome meatballs and chicken parm. I'd avoid the mussels. Cash-only, expect a wait, but it's worth it.

Reviews.Author: Nick S.
Reviews.Content: Obtaining a seat in Giacomo's is not unlike being served soup in the "Soup Nazi" episode of Seinfeld.  You must follow all instructions to the letter.  Do so, and you will gain entrance to the restaurant and some seriously good, very affordable, Italian food.This is not a place you are going to sit around for hours having multiple courses and after dinner drinks.  This is a place to sit down, have a great meal at a reasonable price and get out.  The food was great-we shared calamari, my wife had the lobster ravioli and I had the mixed seafood with a spicy vodka sauce.  Including a bottle of wine, the total was $60.  Incredible.  Worth the wait and the semantics.  Would definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Daniel F.
Reviews.Content: Excellent food.  Terrible, rushed, rude service.  They can unfortunately get away with being rude due to their amazing food at a very resonable price (cash only).

Reviews.Author: James M.
Reviews.Content: We went there very early (5pm) and there was already a line. We only had to wait about 20 minutes to get seated. It had a very quaint restaurant and atmosphere. The tables and seating was very tight, and the restaurant small but this only added it the mystique. We started with bread, which had olives infused. Very good. I had the chicken parmesan for my meal with linguine. Hands down it was the best chicken parmesan I've ever had. The marinara sauce had a beautiful flavor, the chicken was nice and lean and had just the right amount of cheese. I would recommend that if you get the opportunity to eat hear, definitely do so!

Reviews.Author: Lissa B.
Reviews.Content: yum yum yum.  I had the Frutti Di Mare in a mix of Fra Diavlo and Giacomo's sauce along with a chicken and vegetable plum tomato sauce dish.  Gooood.  And calamari had a few pieces of pepper mixed in.  There is often a wait.  Note there is also a South Boston location.

Reviews.Author: Randy D.
Reviews.Content: We had a quick trip to Boston and found this place on Yelp. We LOVED it.  The atmosphere was perfect.  The food was amazing. We fortunately didn't have to wait too long outside in the cold. It's a small place with plenty of personality!!

Reviews.Author: Li L.
Reviews.Content: My favorite restaurant in Boston. Be prepared for a long wait even in bad weather but everyone will tell you that it's totally worth the waiting. I've tried other high score restaurants  in North End and Giacomo is just better. There is a reason why people are willing to wait.Cons: (1) the restaurant is really small and tight, (2) it barely has A/C during summer and (3) cash only. The service is fine but not outstanding. But come on, you are not here for the atmosphere and service. Here comes the food.The calamari is a must try - hands down the best I've ever had. Perfectly seasoned and fried. And I've been to Giacomo's several times and not like many other restaurants, every time it is perfect. Go with the large portion; otherwise you'll regret.Love the zuppa di pesce with their homemade Giacomo sauce. It says it's for two but there are so many fresh and crunchy seafoods (shrimps, scallops, calamari, clams, mussels and lobster) that three of us cannot finish it. And it's only $65 including a bottle of wine! Of coz, every seafood pasta with their special sauce is great, it's just the zuppa di pesce can provide you the most you can get from this small restaurant. On the other hand, the butternut squash ravioli, although recommended by many, is not my thing.

Reviews.Author: Amie W.
Reviews.Content: Great little place. Packed, we happened to get in line before they opened. Pumpkin tortellini was fantastic, so is their house pasta sauce. Fried calamari appetizer is worth the wait alone. Very few tables, packed and cash only, but definitely would go again.

Reviews.Author: Ryan S.
Reviews.Content: Going here for dinner and drinks again after an amazing dinner yesterday that i can not stop thinking about. The pasta was so fresh and the sauce is my new obsession. Thinking of throwing a large dinner meeting here because it would be the perfect spot for a hearty delicious meal and team building. The mini crab cakes are homemade and delicious. They open at 4;30 weekdays, perfect to have cocktails and an early dinner before the crowds arrive in the North End.

Reviews.Author: Annie C.
Reviews.Content: We happened upon Giacomo's Ristorante after walking the Freedom Trail.  We headed back to the North End to grab a couple of appetizers a little after 4:30pm on a Thursday since we weren't quite ready for dinner, yet.  We stumbled across Giacomo's and decided to go in because we were on the hunt for calamari and an antipasto plate.  They had both on the menu and we were in luck!  We ordered both of these items and a glass of wine.  Everything came out quickly.  As soon as the appetizers were delivered, our waitress, Rose Marie (or Rosemary), asked us what we'd like for dinner.  We told her we weren't planning on eating dinner, and that what we had was just fine.  Apparently this set her off.  She snatched the menus out of our hands and proceeded to ask again if we were having dinner.  We told her we were not.  She then let us know that she wasn't going to let us sit there for 30 minutes and then decide to eat, and that the appetizers were all we were getting.  Unfortunately, her lack of concern for the customer totally ruined our experience.  She went and complained to a waitress 3 feet away from us about how we weren't eating dinner.  I didn't realize that was a requirement for the restaurant.  I would have ranked this with one star; however, everything we ordered tasted great. The run in with Rose Marie/Rosemary made us feel extremely awkward for the rest of our time there, and we couldn't get out of there faster.  She didn't check on us after that except to deliver the bill.  Overall?  Definitely not worth it if you're looking for a good experience or if you just want appetizers.  The awkward feeling overshadowed the taste of the food and unfortunately that's the memory we walked away with, as well as the one we've told our friends.

Reviews.Author: Hayley H.
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed in North End and noticed a long line outside for several days. We have 4 young children and decided to order for take out rather than stand in line for over an hour. The staff is extremely busy, but when they get to you, you have their full attention. We ordered veal parmigiana, shrimp diavolo, and the calamari. The veal was good, the shrimp was lacking (they only gave us four shrimp and the sauce didn't pack a punch) and the calamari a huge hit, especially the sauce. The portions were enough for our family of 6 to eat 2 meals, and the cost was extremely fair. I wouldn't ever wait in line for it, but would definitely order it take out again.

Reviews.Author: Nikhil P.
Reviews.Content: Came back here again on Friday night, and rocked my socks off all over again.  This time, got the shrimp and scallops with the lobster fra diavolo sauce.  And the fried calamari appetizer again.  Can't be beat.  3x in a row coming, and a solid 5-star each time.  Oh, I love...

Reviews.Author: Steven C.
Reviews.Content: Salmon, sun dried tomatoes with lobster cream sauce is beyond delicious and a good deal for $16, even after the hour and forty minute wait. The service is quick and to the point, yet welcoming and friendly. The space is tight though, but it compliments the homey Italian restaurant feeling.

Reviews.Author: Steve T.
Reviews.Content: Great food. Yes.  But...seriously, waiting in line for two hours to sit in a tiny cramped, loud restaurant where your meal is served to you at breakneck speed? Prices were good.  I'd give it 3.5 stars.  Tourist trap. I know that you can eat equally well in Boston without all that nonsense.  And cash only?

Reviews.Author: Carmen C.
Reviews.Content: We decided to check out this place during our stay in boston because of enormous amount of reviews and it was indeed a good choice.  For entree, I ordered the tuna steak (medium cooked) which was amazing and as for appetizer, we got the fried calamari- I'm personally not a fan of fried foods so I won't comment on that.  Overall, great food and good ambiance...service was good, food came quick (within 15 mins) and we were out within one hour.

Reviews.Author: Eddy S.
Reviews.Content: I was really happy to have found a good eatery that is recommended by the locals and on Yelp. However, I left with a bitter taste in my mouth. I was in Boston for 3 days. On my second day here, I end up chatting it up with a local and she highly recommended this place. I promptly looked it up on yelp and the reviews look fantastic! So I stopped by early the next day, filled with excitement to try this place out. Waited in line, no problem, that's to be expected. Promptly seated, excellent. The waitress approached me and went over the spill of menu on the board and the specials and took my order, OK so good so far. While I was waiting for my food, I was trying to correspond some stuff on my phone (no, not talking on the phone, just emailing and internet). Then an older male waiter (I think he's the owner) came up behind me and practically threw the plate in front of me hence pushing the phone out of the way. Then, he said to me, "put your phone away and eat your supper!!" I was sort of caught off guard and a little embarrassed. Since it is a small restaurant, almost everyone turned around and was staring at me. I shrugged my shoulder and laughed it off thinking maybe he was just trying to be funny and promptly thanked him and put my phone away. Just as when I was about to dig in, he came up again and began to add powder cheese to my food without even asking and practically shoved the forks in my hand out of the way. Now I'm agitated. I was okay being talked down to like an 8 year old, I have thick skin, it didn't bother me all that much. But when you start to mess with people's food without even asking, now that is crossing the line. To be honest, the food was probably pretty good, but I was so fumed I didn't even enjoy it. If I pay $30+ for a meal, I expect at least the meal would be the way I wanted it and a little bit of courtesy and respect. By having great food doesn't mean you can mistreat your customers. Because of this horrible experience, I have no choice but to give it a star. I hope this is a one time thing because I can't think of a quicker way to turn your customer away.

Reviews.Author: Jenni M.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the best experience ever!Was looking for a good date night experience as we were traveling. This did not disappoint. You are definitely crammed in next to other people, but that is part of the experience that made it so fun. It's like it's a huge family reunion, Italian-style. The butternut squash ravioli was to die for. The cheese appetizer was delicious. We couldn't get enough of the garlic bread. We ordered so much for just the two of us, and everything was perfect.

Reviews.Author: Fiona O.
Reviews.Content: This place is worth the wait!Cute little restaurant with fiery waiters. Very small, and everyone's seated elbow-to-elbow.We got the small calamari with peppers, and it blew my mind. That was probably the only time when I would voluntarily eat peppers on their own (I absolutely HATE peppers). For $7, it was reasonable.I got the half lobster, clams and mussels with linguine in the giacomo sauce for $20, and it was delicious! $20 is not bad at all for what I got; I struggled with the lobster claw for a good 20 minutes, but alas the lobster won.My friend got shrimp and clams with linguine ($16?) in the diavolo sauce and our only complaint was that it was actually not spicy at all.Service was good, if not rushed, and food was quick and extremely delicious! One star off for not accepting credit cards :(So yes, the wait was worth it. After reading these reviews I want to go back to have the butternut squash ravioli. mmmm.

Reviews.Author: Abbey H.
Reviews.Content: Giacomo's. What can I say that hasn't already been said? It was DELICIOUS. I ordered one of the specials: gnocchi (they were all out the cheese-filled gnocchi, so I had the plain potato) with chicken, mushrooms, broccoli rabe (the dish originally included spinach, but I asked for a substitution), and pomodoro sauce. It was lovely. The gnocchi were perfection, and the dish on the whole had an unbelievable flavor. HIGHLY RECOMMEND. You will not be sorry.I tasted the butternut squash ravioli (unexpectedly tasty, not too sweet - I never much cared for butternut squash in any form) and the pesto [had a nice flavor and the basil was interestingly a bit coarse in texture - it was also more liquid-y than the kind of pesto I prefer (my mom's, of course), as if they added some broth to the sauce]. Wine is $4.25 a glass.. beer $3. Entrees from $14-17-ish. Very small space. Line out the door. You will not be seated until your entire party is there, so be aware of that.Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: v y.
Reviews.Content: I love Giacomo! Some of the best most reasonably priced Italian food you can get in the North End. There's a reason the line is always so long (on a weekend night, expect to wait around 45 min to an hour half, unless you're willing to wait in line and eat during the first wave (I think it's at 5:00 pm) so if you're willing to line up around 4:30 the this is your best bet.I always get the calamari! It is the best calamari I've had in Boston. Not only is it crispy hot and fresh, it doesn't sink in your stomach. I can easily share a large plate with another person (I'd say a small feeds two, a large feeds 3-4). It just makes me drool thinking about it.Also I like to keep it simple, so I usually go for some seafood cooked in their Fracamo sauce (a mix between the spicy fra diavlo and their house Giacomo sauce). It always hits the spot. I've also ordered the Chicken Marsala before which is superbly flavorful, but a little sweet for my taste. There current specials have always been decent as well, but I can't get over how much I love the Fracamo sauce.It is EXTREMELY tight seating though, so expect to be more or less on top of the table next to you and if you're by the window, people will glare at you to finish your meal faster.But overall, this place is DELICIOUS and always worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Jackie W.
Reviews.Content: Worth the price, not the wait. We had the famed calamari; it was on the greasy side but not too chewy and not too dry. The butternut ravioli was on par with other posts- sweet, soft, creamy, with just the right amount of savory.  We also had linguini al dente with shrimp, scallops and Giacomo's sauce.  My only complaint was that the shellfish should have been a bit more crispy before going into the pasta.  Otherwise, a great dish.We had a nice dinner at a great price.  I suspect the quality of the meal was somewhat compromised by the breathtakingly rapid table turnover.  That said, we didn't feel rushed and were still able to enjoy the cozy ambiance of Giacomo's.

Reviews.Author: Jessica C.
Reviews.Content: OK, it seems that I visit Giacomo's when out-of-town visitors want to eat at Italian establishments in the North End.  Which is great, because I love Giacomo's!  We had calamari (delicious) and garlic bread (also wonderful) as appetizers.  For entrees, my friends and I ordered:- grilled swordfish tuna steak (so tender) with marinara and pasta on the side- chicken marsala with proscuitto and mushrooms- frutti di mare-shrimp,scallops,calamari,clams and mussels- lobster ravioli with diced tomatoes in a garlic cream sauce- and another freshly made pasta but I don't recall its nameThe entrees were all excellent, and our tourist friends proclaimed it worth the wait as well.  It was up to their New York standards, and very reasonably priced.What I don't love is the wait, or the service.  The last two times I was there, the waitress was rushed and rude once we were seated.  She slammed the plates down on the table when we asked for extra plates to share.  I understand, since the table turnover rate is so high and the restaurant is tiny - a huge line snakes around the corner, and the crowd hungrily eyes the orders of dining patrons inside.If you're looking for a leisurely sit-down 2-3 hour Italian family style meal, this is not it.  Giacomo's is great for tourists who have time to wait in line (1.5 hours when we came in late October, and half an hour on a cold February Saturday night) because it's solid Italian food at a reasonable price.Oh yes, cash only.  Hurrah Giacomo's!

Reviews.Author: Nisrine E.
Reviews.Content: I like this place. I think it is slightly over hyped but all in all an interesting and tasty experience. The calamari appetizer was REALLY good, they batter and fry peppers with the calamari (yum). It might be the best calamari I have ever had. The main course was good but the Fradiavolo sauce was kind of watery and uneventful. The wine was very cheap... and pretty good. The only real bad thing was that it was uncomfortably crowded and clustered in the restaurant. We were practically sitting at the same table with the people at the tables on both sides of us.  I mean you are packed in there like sardines!

Reviews.Author: joanne g.
Reviews.Content: loved the pastas, loved the lobster raviolis, liked the price and hatedthe wait in line.  I still gave it 5 stars, although it was certainly a different experience waiting 1/2 hour outside for a table, the food was very good.The service was very rushed, but we expected that.  Idon't think I would wait in line again though, there are lots of good restaurants in the North End.

Reviews.Author: Brian G.
Reviews.Content: This place is what true italian cooking is all about.  Do NOT get discouraged by the lack of waiting area or the fact they do not take reservations or have fancy valet parking.  Stand outside and wait your turn for the best (& most affordable) dinner ever.My wife and I stumbled upon this gem as we were strolling around the North End and fell in love.  The wine list is simple but excellant and affortable, go with your favorite red or white.Start with the calamari and I highly recommand the Fra Diavolo!  You do not need fancy additions - all you need is great food!

Reviews.Author: Michele T.
Reviews.Content: I'd like to start saying that I'm an italian from Bologna where we claim to have the best food of the world. Having said that I have to admit that Giacomo's has some great food, cooked and served in a so italian way that it was like been home! The fried calamari saw awesome and the zuppa di pesce was delicious. The only cons was the Wait line of more than one hour but everyone stepping out of the place kept telling us that the food was worth the wait.Price is reasonable and staff friendly.

Reviews.Author: Chris S.
Reviews.Content: Overall it's OK.  The prices are very reasonable for the wine and food.There is no atmosphere and dining is cramped.The wine and food are average, at best, thus the low cost.Don't wait 1 minute to sit, there are many other choices within 1 block.  It's not worth the wait, nor the "experience" of dining at Giacomo's.

Reviews.Author: Dennis K.
Reviews.Content: Fun atmosphere, but the garlic will stick with you for days!!

Reviews.Author: Chloe L.
Reviews.Content: My friends and I go to the north end all the time. We've never been to Giacomo because of the long line, but it was my birthday and it was still early so we decided to give it a try. We waited around 20-25 minutes. Our waitress was so nice and welcoming. The food was simply amazing. Best Italian food I've ever had. Garlic bread A+. Def must try!

Reviews.Author: Todd M.
Reviews.Content: Long lines but great, authentic Italian good.  The lobster, mussels, clams, linguini were awesome.  I felt like I was in Sicily.  We received quick and personal service once we got in.

Reviews.Author: Suhel S.
Reviews.Content: The food is ok. Waitress was racist. She asked to us to pay exta tip cuz we're not blond hair and blue eyes beside being rude with us. I will never go back again.

Reviews.Author: Chris H.
Reviews.Content: Got calamari, lobster ravioli, and pumpkin tortellini. All were really good. Calamari was as good as everyone says it is. Came at 8:45 on a Sat night and only waited 5 minutes, although it was January, so the lines are probably shorter.

Reviews.Author: Kerrie K.
Reviews.Content: Giacomo's is certainly one particular restaurant that one of my most adored Italian spots in Boston. I've been to each the North Finish location and also the South Finish area. They are owned from the very same owner and also you get a distinct feeling at each. North Finish is far more quickly paced since they are attempting to turn the tables so fast and South Finish is a complete opposite. The menu is genuinely exquisite and can never ever disappoint. This really is the only location where I'll eat their popular butternut squash raviolis and not have a breath of fresh air while doing so. I order this each time and never ever after have I been disappointed over the consistency. The gnocchi is good too, and also try their seafood dish which my boyfriend gets each and every time. Would suggest to all to try this great restaurant simply because I know you will not leave without dropping a fat tip. P.S. Bring cash, they don't take plastic.

Reviews.Author: Mary E.
Reviews.Content: Long lines and typically short dinners...

Reviews.Author: Simone H.
Reviews.Content: As always the best Italian restaurant in the area especially if you like seafood.  The homemade fusilli with lobster and shrimp is usually the special.  I mixed the fra diavolo and Giacomo's sauce for a nice blend of spice!  The line was not too bad, need to catch the right seating time, either go early (5 pm) or around 7.

Reviews.Author: Reena P.
Reviews.Content: Overall, 3.5-4 stars. I did really like the ambiance of this place and the wait staff was amazing, but i was a little disappointed in the food.  We ordered, the pasta linguini in Giacomo sauce with shrimp and scallops, the lobster ravioli, the calamari appetizer and the mussel appetizer.Lobster ravioli--definitely the best thing here. The flavor was very good, however, just a tad salty. Would give this a 4-4.5 stars.The Pasta with seafood-overall flavor a bit bland. However, some of the scallops were very soft and definitely good, other pieces not as much. This gets a 3.5The calamari--some pieces rubbery, some not as rubbery, but overall wasn't anything special. The flavor also was a bit bland. 3The mussels were kind of fishy tasting. Dangit! Hate that. 3I hate that I don't have a great review. I definitely wanted it to be amazing since it's soo highly rated. Would go back for the ambiance, but probably not just for the food. :(

Reviews.Author: Gustavo D.
Reviews.Content: Overrated, overcrowded, tourist trap. That's how I would describe Giacomo's in three words. Food is ok for what you pay for but in my opinion is not the best italian food in town.

Reviews.Author: Chad D.
Reviews.Content: I would consider Giacomo's one of the best Italian restaurants in the U.S. My recommendation: Come early and bring cash. This establishment has limited seating, no reservations, and is cash only, but WORTH it! Their menu is written on a chalk board and you can choose one of 5 family recipe sauces with each dish. The butternut squash ravioli is a must try at the table. I would recommend having each individual of your party pick a different dish and sharing with the table.
