This is one of the best gems that Boston has to offer.

Reviews.Author: Sam B.
Reviews.Content: good

Reviews.Author: John B.
Reviews.Content: Solid.

Reviews.Author: john e.
Reviews.Content: Great

Reviews.Author: Rhett S.
Reviews.Content: A picture is worth as thousand words; Therefore "FraDavalio!!!!!" yelp.com/biz_photos/2u_w… But here is a few more words from your food eating sponsor... We arrived to the North End around 5pm and decided to walk around perusing the Italian shops, restaurants, and bakeries. It was pretty quite considering it was a Thursday, except for one restaurant among a sea of Italian restaurants. I've been to Giacomo's three times and every time it's always packed to the hilt with a queue forming outside along its windows. The Jekyll and Hyde inside everyone becomes apparent during the transition from waiting to eating. When you're in line all you want to do is yell, punch, kick, and scream at the happy eaters to hurry their asses up because "I'm Hungry!". You ask yourself if anyone would notice if you went inside and just started taking food off peoples plates and guzzling wine right from their tableside wine bottles.   Would these crazy people who keep bumping into you care at all? Would anyone care?  Arghhhhhhh! It seems the moment you reach your "Jekyll Climax" your name is called and you feel happy/excited like you won a game of Keno from a deli in a Vegas hotel..... Once your seated you want to take your time sipping the wine slowly, savor every bite, then marinate in your chair hoping you get hungry again soon to finish the meal or maybe order more. Giacomo's is a 10 table sort of restaurant with a family country bumpkin feel. The recipes are surely passed down from grandma to granddaughter and so on. The menu is classic Italian in every way and very simple. Giacomo's sticks with what they know and trust me... they know Italian! Everything on the menu is very good; however, my favorite and the best Italian meal I've ever had was Giacomo's House Special. I've been all over Italy from Milan to Tuscany to Venice to Rome to Florance to Cinque Terre and back to Bellagio. Giacomo's was the best and cheap for what you get. The House Special was designed for two people to split; however we were four and couldn't finish it. This behemoth of a pasta had a rich and spicy "arribiata" sauce which used lobster as its base. The linguine pasta had a dozen mussels, clams, calamari, shrimp, and scallops. It was then topped with an entire whole main lobster (about 2 lbs.). It was the kitchen sink of seafood pastas and everything was perfectly cooked. From the pasta being perfect aldente to the seafood being perfect texture. Words really can't do this review justice. It was a 6 out of 5! The entire special was around $55 and included a bottle of wine. We ordered a 02' Chianti from Tuscany and it paired perfectly. Let me reiterate, I've never had a better Italian meal.

Reviews.Author: Spud J.
Reviews.Content: Excellent, excellent food.  The fra divolo is perhaps the best I've ever had.  Really, all of the pasta dishes are the best in the area.Giacomo's offers the classic North End experience...wait in a long line out on the street, get to know the people in line with you (offering hopefully helpful opinions to amazed tourists from the mid-west), eventually get seated at a tiny table cheek by jowl with fellow diners, get rushed by the brusque yet competent waitstaff, leave stuffed and then go wait in another mosh pit at Mikes or The Modern for dessert.  But if you're into that kind of thing (and clearly lots of people are), this is your place.  Even if you're not, the food at Giacomo's really makes it all worthwhile.  Just remember that during the hour or so that you're standing in line.Or you could next time make a reservation at their Back Bay location and enjoy the same quality food in a more relaxed environment.Tips... CASH ONLY (lots of ATMs in the area).  Eat early. The line is faster on weekdays than on weekends.  Arrive before 6pm any day and it's better than later in the evening.  Not so good for big (more than 4) groups...you'll wait forever and other people in line will secretly hate you.  Sometimes not so secretly.Also not so good for little kids...they'll probably think the food and atmosphere is fun, but it's a rare kid who actually likes standing in line for an hour while hungry.  I'm just sayin'...

Reviews.Author: Jessie C.
Reviews.Content: you haven't lived until you try their BUTTERNUT SQUASH RAVIOLI! don't even think about it, just order it... I converted my dad from a non-ravioli and non-butternut squash believer into a huge fan of both. get their calamari too, go for the large. you'll regret it if you settle for the smaller size. the first bite is like a tease for your taste buds and they will leave feeling very satisfied

Reviews.Author: sal a.
Reviews.Content: I'd never been to Giacomo's until last night, and boy did I get fooled by all the 5 star reviews.  I won't let that influence me ever again.  I can't give away stars that easily, and I can assure you this was not my first visit to an Italian restaurant, nor was it my first exposure to Italian cooking, whether in this country or Italy.  To be honest, I've eaten in more Italian restaurants in Italy, than here in the States. That being said, our food lacked an important element in Italian cuisine.  Flavor.Who cooks pasta without using salt?  Apparently Giacomo's does.  Now, if I were on a low sodium diet, this place would be ideal, but c'mon Yelpers... which REAL Italian chef cooks without using salt in the pasta!?  Also, please stop referring to Giacomo's as an authentic Italian restaurant.  It's not.  Now don't get me wrong, it's not terrible, and aside from feeling a bit cramped at the table and rushed by the waitress, the prices aren't exaggerated like many similar eateries, though this certainly isn't a reason to go back, unless you like speed-eating in overly crowded dining rooms.The long blond hair in my wife's pasta certainly didn't help my review.  She has red hair.

Reviews.Author: Dessa R.
Reviews.Content: Most of the time, I can frame my reviews in whole star denominations with no real distress, but every once in a great while, I run into a real dilemma with a restaurant and my need for the half star. Giacomo's was one of those places. Let me explain.I ordered their famous lobster ravioli, which was served piping hot in a garlic cream sauce. Delectable! The ravioli was obviously made fresh, and the lobster meat mixture inside them was just right. My companion ordered the veal parm, which I tasted, and thought was also excellent. The side of "ziti" (which actually was penne) that accompanied his veal parm was practically inedible. It was cold, overcooked, and completely unappealing. The bowl sat lonely at the side of our table, until the perplexed waiter took it away. This seems to me to be some kind of sacrilege if one is boasting an Italian menu, particularly in the North End. Fluke? Maybe. Since the penne was not the main star of our show, we didn't put that much stock into it. Sometimes, pasta goes wrong. Thankfully, we were both pretty pleased with our entrees. The table of four next to us ordered some enormous seafood platter that included lobster tails, mussels, clams and the like, which smelled really good. The service was somewhat disappointing-- two and a half stars. Our server, who had a loud, speedy, and jarring voice reminded us of a police radio dispatcher. He slid our water glasses towards us, reached over us without saying excuse me, forgot my diet coke, and kind of gave us that rushed feeling. After waiting almost an hour in the cold on a weeknight, we didn't really appreciate it.The other stuff: How can I not mention the wait? A line down the block, even on weeknights. I can't even begin to imagine what this place must look like on a Saturday night. I generally don't deduct for long waits (note: I five-starred Cuchi Cuchi AND Zaftig's, both of which are notorious for their long waits), but I found both the wait and the method of handling their waiting customers less than impressive. No list, no names, no reservations. Anything goes. No protection from the cold or rain, no little morsels of sustenance for hungry waiting customers. Won't penalize for that one, just making a point. Dude. I watch Gordon Ramsey. The space was really unexpectedly small. The tables are jammed so close together, that the people from the table next to us had to actually get up to let us in and out of our seats. Two and a half stars on the space, setup, and customer service. So what's a girl to do? If Yelp allowed me those damn half stars, I'd feel pretty good about awarding Giacomo's three and a half stars. Fourish-star food, minus a little for all the other nonsense. After some thought though,  I'm sorry, Giacomo's, but I'm rounding down to three stars. There's just a little too much room for improvement this time around. I'd give you that extra half, if I could.

Reviews.Author: Kristina B.
Reviews.Content: The homemade fusilli with lobster and shrimp is delightful.  The red wine named "Citra"...not so much.

Reviews.Author: Jessica S.
Reviews.Content: This has been quite the big foodie week for me, finally making it to both Giacamos and to Gracies in Providence. yea me. We got the seafood special, the butternut squash ravioli, lobster ravioli, burrata, and garlic bread. Overall we liked everything. I agree with another reviewer who said the sauce on the squash ravioli is a bit bland so that was dissapointing. The bread they give you was also just ok. The food was good enough to try again but I wouldn't wait an hour for it. If you time it right in the off season you can get right inThe food here is ok but the service is less than stellar. I find it disrespectful when places don't make the time and minimal effort to properly advertise important things like hours. Both the website and the door say 5pm. They opened at 4:30 that day and I had told my friends to meet me at 5. This means I was standing outside for 45 minutes instead of 15 and had I known the correct time I would have told them. The woman was unapologetic and brushed it off like whatever. It was also raining all day and they won't let you in until your entire party is there. Our server wasn't much better with the attitude, both older women with short hair. When we went to pay our bill we all had 20's because this place doesn't take credit cards and we had just gone to the atm. We just needed a few 10's. When we asked for change for 2  20's the woman said no and said she will get us change for one and walked away. my jaw dropped. um if you want to get paid and want a tip especially, then you should get us change and what kind of attitude is that?? The attitude seems to be the door revolves so quickly that if you aren't happy so what. Maybe you should take credit cards if this is an issue. It's not like we asked for a bunch of singles or nickles. It was taking us a while to try to pay the bill and we were irritable at this point so she did give in and offer to get us change to get us out of there it seemed like.  A good restaurant does not rush you, especially when you are not dawdling, and other people here commented on feeling rushed so that is not good business. If it were up to me I  would have just taken the money we were trying to work out out of her tip and the bill would be no issue but my friends are nice.When we first got there we went to our table where it was set up with 3 chairs and for some bizarre reason they took one chair away and put it by the door, as if they were confused by the difference in 2 and 3 people. So we are standing there for a couple minutes while they move the table around and whatever then I finally ask where is our other chair?? They acted confused and brought back the chair. Service definitely needs some work and let's have enough respect for customers to post a sticker, change the website, anything to make sure the opening time is correct. They own Panza and I had the exact same issue with them before because the advertised hours were not accurate. I was a little underwhelmed overall. The food was good but I've gone to better places with much better service for the same price. This is not a 5 star restaurant by any definition. They need to take a lesson from Gracies on the service.

Reviews.Author: Karman L.
Reviews.Content: dude...even my super italian friend recommended me to come here!!! def worth the wait (yes, there is a line outside the restaurant)we really enjoy the food there...i had chicken marsala!! yum yum yum!! waitress was super friendly...big plus!!!

Reviews.Author: Ashley S.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite Italian restaurant ever! There are 2 locations in Boston, but I much prefer the original one in the North End to the newer one they opened in the South End. Be prepared to wait a while to sit down unless you come at a really off time. Theres always a line out front because people know this place is good! This is definitely an Italian restaurant for seafood lovers like me. The calamari appetizer is great, especially if you come here starving. It doesn't taste too greasy-just right. But I would recommend you save your appetite for the main course because the portions here are generous. I have tried a variety of the seafood and pasta plates, but my favorite wil always be the house special. It's meant to be shared between 2 people, but it can easily feed 3 because we always end up having leftovers. It comes with a lobster split in half, scallops, shrimp, mussels, and squid over pasta and your choice of sauce. The best is the white wine garlic sauce. The red is also very good but gets too messy when your trying to pick apart the lobster! The price is a little high- I think it was around $55 for the meal, but for the amount of seafood you get, it's well with it. Also you can add a bottle of wine for only $10, so it's a great deal overall.

Reviews.Author: Greg K.
Reviews.Content: Yeah so I've heard about Giacomo's.  Been there before.  and as you probably know from going yourself or from reading other reviews that they've got a handle on the fast cheap north end seafood dinner thing.  I went last Thursday, first real nice day of the year, and it did not disappoint.      In fact it went above and beyond what I had remembered.  You know the story, no calling ahead, waiting in line outside.  Looking through the windows trying to see what meals looked good and who was almost done with their meal.  Making small talk to the people in line with us.  Table for 2?  Yes please.  Sit down.  Really nice waitress comes over, tells us without telling us that their calamari is the shit and we should probably get it.  Small order please and a bottle of red wine.   The wine list?  Oh the wine list is phenomenal.  One of every kind of wine.  All priced at 15.99.  My goal was to drink 2 bottles between the two of us.  We'll see how that turns out.  Order dinner, I got Scallops and Shrimp with Giacomo sauce, Sarah got Clams and Mussels with Giacomo sauce.  The specials looked really good, and next time I will be getting one of those, but they do seafood and I wanted seafood so I ordered seafood.  Calamari comes, wow it is good.  Best I've had in a long time.  Can we get extra marinara?  Of course!  When you go, just get the calamari.  don't play the whole 'trying to watch what I eat' game.  You'll be sending me comments to thank me.Calamari is gone, pasta's come quickly.  How much cheese do you want?  One scoop (for rookies), Two scoops (for the ladies) or three scoops for a man like me.  Dominated the pasta.  Actually couldn't finish is all but finished all the shrimps and scallops.  The second bottle of wine was nonsense.  What was I thinking.  Instead we said thank you, tipped big for being awesome, and walked off one of the best meals I've had in a while.If you haven't been, you should probably go, it's one of those places with a lot of charm and FAN-TASTIC food5 stars!

Reviews.Author: Daren M.
Reviews.Content: Went with a party of 5 on Tuesday night around 8:30pm. Seated immediately.  It's nice but intimate enough with the open kitchen to feel almost 'down-home.' The sauces were delicious and I nearly licked the plate. Ambiance was somewhat jovial, though noisy and the manager was bombastic but keeps mood lively. This is my go-to place in the North End now; I've been around 7 times in 2 months! The only thing I'd change is the fact that if your party is less than 3, you will most likely be seated directly adjacent to another couple, privy to their entire conversation. It's a bit awkward but that's the time where you say lots of outrageous stuff and then they request another table.

Reviews.Author: Michael M.
Reviews.Content: Yea we waited outside for like half an hour, but it was well worth it! I could honestly say the butternut squash ravioli could be one of the best meals that I've ever had! I don't think I'm even willing to order anything else in the future, as I had a bite of my wifes pumpkin tortellini and that was good, but not great!

Reviews.Author: C K.
Reviews.Content: We used to love Giacomo's in the South End but had a very disappointing meal there recently.  The lobster ravioli was heavy and bland and the service was disastrous.  On the plus side, the glasses of wine are very generous.  We won't be going back.

Reviews.Author: Shan C.
Reviews.Content: 52 minute wait in line, but very quick friendly service. The food was great and very filling. The calamari was pretty good and simply made with a nice light tasty breading. The eggplant parm, whew, that was very mouth watering. I certainly want to come back and try other items on the menu.

Reviews.Author: zoomcracker ..
Reviews.Content: i LOVE LOVE LOVE the lobster ravioli here. actually i love everything here, but especially the lobster ravioli. and the prices are great compared to other restaurants of the same quality.they don't take reservations so plan on waiting, even at 5:30pm. cash only.

Reviews.Author: Jo B.
Reviews.Content: Okay, I confess.   I was a huge Giacomo's skeptic.  I would always walk by and see the huge line and think, "why on earth would anyone wait on line for Italian food when there are dozens of other amazing Italian restaurants in North End?"   Until one day I walked by and there was no line (Sunday at 5pm) so I figured, what the heck, let me see what the fuss is all about.  So here's what I would recommend:Do go to Giacomo's if:-  You don't mind waiting in line and you want to see what all the fuss is about for yourself-  You're looking to have a quick dinner (they will have you in and out of there in 45 minutes)-  You want good food.  It is definitely above average.  Portions are big too - one plate is enough for two people to share.  I got the calamari appetizer - it was excellent.  I also got the grilled salmon with marinated vegetables.  Sounds like an ordinary dish, but it wasn't, the salmon was fresh and grilled to perfection.- You don't want to spend an arm and a leg.  Wine was $16/bottle, $4/glass.  Beer $3.  Entrees approx $14.  Cheap for North End.- You don't mind sitting in very tight quarters, literally centimeters away from the surrounding tables.  -  You don't mind reading the menu from a big chalkboard on the wall -  You are the type of person that can decide what you want to order within 30 seconds of sitting down.  Seriously,   the waitress asked me if I was ready to order 3 times in a 2 minute span of time.  She was polite about it, but didn't try to hide the fact that they are trying to turn tables around quickly.    Do NOT go to Giacomo's if:-  You're taking someone out for a romantic evening- You want to sit down, relax and enjoy a long dinner where you don't feel rushed.-  You want to have a conversation.  It's incredibly loud.- You have small children with you.  I didn't see any high chairs and couldn't imagine bringing my kids to sit in that cramped environment.- You don't have cash on you (they don't take credit cards)

Reviews.Author: R Y J.
Reviews.Content: My friend who lived in Boston for years told me that it was mandatory to go here no matter what. So my friends and I waited in line for more than an hour. In the rain. IN THE DANG RAIN.The verdict? Not worth waiting in the rain for. Yeah, all the Giacomo's groupies can try to track me down and attack me, but it really wasn't THAT great. It was PRETTY good, but not mind-blowing. As a table of five, we had the linguine with scallops and fra diavola sauce (not exceptional), another shrimp and scallops dish with fra diavola (I don't know why we got two similar dishes. Fail.), a chicken in pesto cream sauce dish (probably my favorite one), and two other dishes that I don't remember. Oh! We had the calamari appetizer as well. That was pretty good. Go for it.I was glad to have finally eaten here, but it wasn't amazing. I feel inclined to give it 4 stars because I was expecting to somehow rate this 9 starts out of 5.

Reviews.Author: Harri S.
Reviews.Content: I really don't get the hype about this place. It had decent ravioli, but not near as great as everyone claims. The sauce was really runny. I was actually sad after this meal and all I could repeat in my head was "fuck you Rachael Ray" over and over again. Sad face. I'll try it again just in case. (Also, freakin welcome to the 21st century. Get a credit card machine).

Reviews.Author: Lily L.
Reviews.Content: Food:Butternut Squash Ravioli:  This was way overhyped.  It was very good, but it wasn't that out of this world.  There is a slight sweetness to this dish from the butternut squash.Pumkpin Tortellini:  Tastes very similar to the butternut squash raviolio except it's even sweeter.  Lobster Ravioli:  Had small bits of lobster meat so I was happy.  The flavor was good.Service:  OMG!!!!  This time, the service was TERRIBLE!  My waitress from last time wasn't at our table.  =(  The restaurant opens at 5PM and 35 min later, a party had already departed.  We were wondering how in the world people could eat so fast and depart so quickly.  Our guess was that they had to go somewhere.  But once we sat down, we realized why they left so quickly.  It's because of THE belligerent waitress!!!  So, 4 of 5 were first timers and they were handed a menu.  Three of us had some trouble deciding what to get.  So we asked for an extra couple of minutes.  Instead of going away, the waitress takes the order from the other 2 people at our party and then says half angrily for us to decide faster.  WTF?!?!  Dude....  Calm down yo!  My friend thought she was mad at him for not knowing what to order.  Another thought it was just her personality and told him not to take it personally.  But dude, you're in the service industry.  If you don't like, get another job.  Don't be so belligerent.  So, two people didn't feel like ordering a full entree.  So, I think we wanted 3 entrees + 2 appetizers.  She says to us that for a party of 5, we had to order at least 4 entrees.  Again, where did this rule come from?  It certainly wasn't written anywhere.  Whatever, we got 4 entrees + 1 appetizer.  After each of us finished our dinner, the plate was immediately snatched away.  My friends ordered chardonnay and one was a slow drinker.  So another friend had to gulp down the chardonnay because the bill had already come.  The chefs save this restaurant because the food is pretty tasty and the price is reasonable.  But man, they certainly give any Chinese restaurant a run for the money when it comes to bad service.  On the plus side, it makes me appreciate service from American restaurant soooo much more.  God bless the USA!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer P.
Reviews.Content: INCREDIBLE!!!  Some of the best Italian food I've had in my life.  We waited a little over an hour and next time I'm in Boston, I'll wait again.  The lobster and shrimp fusilli pasta changed my life!  Excellent service.  Loved every second!!!  See you again soon!

Reviews.Author: P. G.
Reviews.Content: The food at Giacomo's is always delicious, but as the saying goes, "it is what it is."  In this case, it's often a hassle.  This will always be the case when the tiny restaurant can shoehorn in about 30 people maximum, and there's always a line of people watching you eat.  The people who come here on the weekends amaze me, I personally couldn't deal with the wait and the crowd, etc.  Best bet is to go for either an early or late dinner early in the week.  Calamari is excellent, as are the Scallops and the Fruitti de Mare.  Service is mostly great, there's one old guy who fancies himself a comedian but is less funny than Gilbert Gottfried and should be taken out back Old Yeller style.

Reviews.Author: Michael T.
Reviews.Content: Giacomo's in the N/End is def. one of the top three restaurants in my book in this plethora of Italian food.  It never fails; consistency is so important with restaurants and its staples, daily specials, and service is always great.  They have this seafood risotto that is unreal; rich, creamy, and full of lobster and other seafoods.  The wine list isn't huge, but very good; service staff are friendly (mention you saw them on the Food Network and they won't stop talking); and they have this weird policy in the winter where you need to open the two entry doors at different times so as to not let in a draft.  Whatever, food rules supreme...whether its dates, parents in town, special occasions, anniversaries, you can never go wrong here.  Per cortesa mangi, mangi!

Reviews.Author: Jason S.
Reviews.Content: Bomb everytime   Fried Calamari always a must.  Get there 15 minutes before opening or wait 45 minutes to sit.

Reviews.Author: Sophia L.
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I drank too much before sitting down to eat here. At first I couldn't tell if it was amazing because I hadn't eaten all day and was drunk but then I realized after having the Butternut Squash ravioli that this place was just damn amazing. THE END.  the server was extra friendly too.

Reviews.Author: Susan W.
Reviews.Content: Whatever could be said about Giacomo's has already been said?  There's a reason the line extends down the block.  The food is so wonderful, the service quick, pleasant and efficient, the prices SO reasonable, and the atmosphere super super fun.  We waited in line for 45 minutes on a Thursday night, and, as many others apparently do, enjoyed meeting the folks from all over the country who were waiting in line w/us.  We ordered calamari for the appetizer, chicken parmesan, butternut squash ravioli and chicken w/fettucine, onions, peppers in a red(?) cream sauce.  Also ordered a bottle of wine for $17 (I think that's the price of all of the bottles of "house" wine).  Everything was the best in its class.  Total bill $90.  What a deal!Our waitress RoseMarie is the sister of the owner, who told us she has worked here since it opened (27 years ago I think).  She was THE BEST!  We would like to try their South Boston location but we don't want to miss Rose Marie.We just ate here last night and we're already trying to figure out when we can return.  Eat here.  Your stomach will thank you.

Reviews.Author: kristen c.
Reviews.Content: pumpkin tortellini!!!  that really is all you have to say!  it's a cute, quaint place on hanover street right in the heart of the north end.  not too many tables, but plenty of people and good food.  the service was BEYOND spectacular... the entire waitstaff was friendly and forthcoming with suggestions.  we ordered chicken parm and pumpkin tortellini.  both meals were absolutely spectacular and came out in a matter of minutes.  no lie.  we barely had enough time to pour off some oil, mix it with crushed red peppers and dip some bread into it before our meal came!definitely highly recommended.  you can't go wrong with this place!

Reviews.Author: Opal K.
Reviews.Content: Stood in line in the cold for 45 min to finally get a table. We debated going down the street to other restaurants but decided to stay. I told the waiter I was vegetarian and he immediately ordered the pumpkin tortellini for me. It was phenomenal... I'd wait in line again for this any day :)

Reviews.Author: Kenneth F.
Reviews.Content: One 5-star experience and one 3-star experience.  Since the 3 is more recent, that's what the rating is.  Let's start with the good:The first time I came here I ordered a plate of calamari, a Friacomo (mixed Fra Diavolo and Giacamo) fettucini with shrimp and scallops, and the butternut squash ravioli.  The food was simply AMAZING.  I used to think calamari could not really undo other calamaris...but boy was I wrong.  The little peppers and the perfectly fried rings were freaking delicious.  The Friacomo was also out of this world - although the scallops tasted somewhat...metallic?  The butternut squash was super rich and unique and I was definitely glad I had that as well.Now for the worse experience:The second time I ordered (why change what was great before right?) a plate of calamari, the Friacomo fettucini with shrimp and scallops, and a salmon in lobster based cream sauce.  The new dish was great...glad I was able to try it and might even order it again.   The rest however were disappointing.  The calamari whipped out of the kitchen in about 2 minutes...but it didn't seem nearly as great as that first time.  Perhaps the batter was slightly off or they didn't add in enough jalapenos.  The bigger disappointment was the Friacomo.  First, it came with linguini which I'm not a fan of.  When we questioned the waitress, she said that's not what she heard....but then again she was in such a hurry who knows what she heard.  Also, it was a lot more liquidy this time.  I had assumed they used the same ratio everytime they mixed their Friacomo - but maybe it was more subjective than that and this time we didn't get a good mix.  Or maybe the linguini didn't soak up the liquid well, which the fettucini did, which is why we liked it so much the first time.All in all, I would have waited 2 hours for that first meal I had there (even though I didn't have to).  However, for the second meal I waited 1 hour and I probably wouldn't have waited more than 10 minutes for that quality.  I'm surprised they didn't even acknowledge their mistake in the ordering.  Seriously, I'm not a compulsive liar trying to trick you into wasting food as I laugh evilly when u make a second batch.  They might not have though the difference of noodles was too big a deal - but that mistake combined with my bitterness of the mediocre calamari and sauce made for a unsatisfactory experience.With all of the other good restaurants in the area, I'll at least try out another local spot for Italian next time!  This restaurant had 5-star+++ taste the first time, but if it's not consistent, what's the point?

Reviews.Author: Elijah C.
Reviews.Content: Been here many times. Usually a wait to get in, but worth it. Never had anything less than delicious, and I've had most of what's on the menu there. Don't miss this one

Reviews.Author: Amber T.
Reviews.Content: I could not have loved this place more. When we arrived I was put off about the line outside but it went really fast and the staff there is the most effecient I have ever seen. Our waitress was amazing. All business. but friendly and very helpful. The food was superb- we had caprese salad and my friend and I split the pumpkin tortellini and eggplant parmesan, both delicious vegetarian entrees. I almost forgot- all of the bottles of white wine were only $16! Hello! What a steal! My group of 3 girls left with full bellies and smiling faces and our bill was only $84 for 2 appetizers, 3 entrees, and a bottle of wine. Perfect!

Reviews.Author: Sam O.
Reviews.Content: i really don' know what all the fuss is about. the owner must have a large family of reviewers who are rating the place as high as it is.the food is ok (mediocre) and the ambience is ok as well. however, the service is absolutely ridiculous. to make a long story short, i had to try to finish my beer so fast that my stomach hurt for a while after we left this place. the waitress (middle aged lady with short hair and glasses) was doing everything in her power to try to get us out right away. we didn't really take long at all. i understand it can get busy on weekends and they are trying to turn over the customers as fast as they can, but you can't just stop shy of physically pushing people out.

Reviews.Author: Ryan G.
Reviews.Content: No amounts of 'please' and 'honey's can feign actual politeness at this restaurant. I have never in my life been to a restaurant with so many employees who were this rude.When you get to the restaurant you will see an hour long line outside waiting to be seated. When you get closer to the door, the host will come out and ask you the number in your party. When it is finally your time to go in, the host will come out and yell out the number of people in your party then tell you a general area of the restaurant where your table is and then walk away, For my party of 4 we were told "In the front".The restaurant is very small. As we walked through the door, a party of four in the front of the restaurant began getting up from their seats to leave. Because there was hardly enough room for one person forget about two, I decided to step to the side by the door to let them out. Before they had even passed, our waitress began screaming at us "In the front! In the front! Just go! In the front!" When the other party had finally left, we went to our table which was actually in the back by the bar/kitchen (we knew this was our table because it was the only clean an empty table in the whole restaurant, there are only about 10 to begin with).We sat at our table for a good 5 minutes before our waitress came over and asked us if we had been to the restaurant before somewhat confused (what could possibly be so unique about an Italian restaurant in Little Italy?) we said no. "Well let me get you menus then" She then proceeded to patronizingly explain that the menu is the same as what was on the blackboard and that there were entrees on both sides of the menu (wow who knew?).We were given about 2 minutes to decide which would rarely be enough to even agree on an appetizer but fortunately we spent a good 15 minutes on line staring at the menu so most of us already knew what we wanted. The waitresses yell the appetizers across the room to the kitchen (which again, was in the room just behind a bar which made the entire room even hotter than it was outside) They would add a 'please' to the end of their yell, as if that made it polite. After writing down our entrees, the waitress then lectured us about how we needed to put our bread plates in front of us (then why did you set them on the corners of the table?) "Oh no that ones not yours this one is yours." She then made us pass our plates to the left. She then lectured us about how we needed to make room in the middle of our table for the fried calamari which wouldn't even be served for another 10 minutes.The restaurant is far too small only out done by the size of our table. We had four people huddled around a small square table that two people would feel cramped at. We were close enough to the table next to us that we could breath on them. There was no room to be comfortable, I had to sit sideways so that I could get as close to the table as possible. And yet I still was smacked across the back every time a server walked past. I had to bend down and lean over the table just to take a sip of my drink because if my elbow ever left the perimeter of the table, my elbow would have been rammed and my drink sent flying, While taking one such sip the waiter brought our appetizer and almost smacked me in the head with it because he couldn't be bothered to wait two seconds for me to get out of the way. This wasn't the last time calamari was shoved in my face though. One piece had fallen onto the table while transferring to my plate (not a big deal, but I didn't really trust the table to be clean enough to eat off of). I put the dirty calamari on my plate when I was done, and so when the waitress came to take my plate she held it up to my face and said "finish this last piece", yea no thanks.The only slight glimmer in this train wreck was that the food was decent, but hey if you can't find a decent Italian restaurant in the North End that doesn't treat you like a herd of cattle, the North End would have gone under a long time ago. The waiters would clear your plate as soon as you finished your last bite even though everyone was still eating, one by one they would take someone's plate. Literally as the last plate was being taken, our waitress slapped the bill on the table.There really is no excuse for how god awful this restaurant is. Do let anyone tell you that this is a genuine Italian experience. I grew up in an Italian household. I have been to many different parts of Italy. I have never seen a waiter shoving whole pieces of bread in his face in full view of customers. I have never seen a waitress grab an elderly customer's chair and move it with her in it to "balance the table out". Don't give this sorry excuse for a restaurant your business or your dignity. If you're going to the North End, there are plenty of other restaurants that you can get a good Italian meal.

Reviews.Author: Rachel Z.
Reviews.Content: This place is worth the wait, as evidenced from the 1000+ reviews. It's relatively inexpensive, considering the location and atmosphere.Their butternut squash ravioli is incredible, as is their side order of broccoli. It is really the best broccoli I have ever had. The wait staff was excellent, the wine was great, and the food (just to reiterate) is spectacular.

Reviews.Author: Arianna L.
Reviews.Content: Every positive thing that anyone has said about this place is absolutely true!! We went on the 4th of July, and having read many reviews, were prepared for the worst. How wrong we were! I guess everyone was otherwise occupied with the fireworks, because there was virtually no line - we got in under 10 minutes. The food options are great, creative yet simple, and we settled on the butternut squash ravioli and salmon fettuccine. Both were delicious, but the ravioli - OMG. Definitely highly recommended. Plus, the wine is incredibly cheap, and the service is speedy, albeit a bit robotic, that's probably just because they're trying to keep a high turnover. This meal made my trip to Boston worth it!

Reviews.Author: Aaron B.
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic.  I took my parents here after reading some reviews.  I have an unfortunate history of making them wait forever in line whenever I pick a restaurant, and this place was no exception.  However, Mike's Pastry is just a block away so I suggest having someone wait and then having someone make a cookie run to tide you over.  The place is very tiny, so you may be waiting up to an hour.  We got lucky and only stood for 20 minutes. On our way to our table, the hostess asked what was in the pastry box.  We offered her a cookie and she happily picked through the box for one she liked while we were sitting down.  I was already sold on the character of this place.  As per the suggestion of the group ahead of us in line, we ordered the house special with wine and an appetizer. Before the meal, a few notes about the character of this restaurant.  Don't go here expecting a quite or romantic meal. It is tiny, the waitresses shout at the busboy from anywhere in the restaurant, and you may get the back of your head elbowed a time or two.  I thought it was great, it felt like being inside their kitchen rather than being at a restaurant.  But, this may not be your style.We started with the calamari appetizer.  It was very fresh tasting, not chewy at all, and had just the right amount of breading.  The house special is a mixture of lobster, calamari, clams, and shrimp over linguine.  Get it with a bottle of wine for $10 bucks more. The wine (normally $15 a bottle) was fantastic for the price.  I would have been thrilled to come home with a $15 dollar bottle this good from the store, let alone to have it be $10 in a restaurant.  The seafood plate itself was huge.  We had to do some serious rearranging to get it to fit on the table.  Remaining calamari was moved to a bread plate, the bread basket was balanced on top of this, etc.  My favorite part of the entree was the fresh tasting pasta.  Nothing makes a meal like being able to tell the pasta was rolled out that day.  The seafood was all delicious and fresh.  My favorite was the scallops. my mom's was the shrimp, and my dad's was the lobster.  If there was one downside, I thought the Giacomo's sauce was a touch runny and would order a thicker or different one next time (of the choice of 5).  Not enough to knock it down a star though.The total bill including for appetizer, a bottle of wine, a huge entree (the menu board says its for 2, but we were stuffed on what we ordered), and a very generous tip was $100 for 3 people.  Not bad for such a great meal.  I hear the South End location is even better, I can't wait to try that.

Reviews.Author: Mary S.
Reviews.Content: 2 words says it all....Simply Amazing!  Its my 30th birthday and I just got back from eating at Giacomo's. I loved it so much I just had to log onto Yelp to write a review right way. I am Italian and was looking for good Italian places to have dinner with my boyfriend for my birthday. I read lots of reviews but something about Giacomo's stood out. I mean people seriously said they waited outside for close to an hour in a ICE STORM???!! I figured it had to be good. And the menu online looked stupendous. So Giacomo's it was.So after the ordeal of finding parking in the North End... fun... Lol! We easily spot Giacomo's as it is the one with a line in front of it.... on a Wednesday night??? I know odd... but there it was. My toes sticking out of my cute peep toe shoes were just about frostbitten by the time we got in there. It actually only took about 20 mins or so... but it was cold! Once we get in I am swept away in the atmosphere... it was like being welcomed into a family's house in Italy.  The aroma and the warm ambiance drew us in. Our waitress was very friendly and provided great service. I was afraid that I would be cramped since it was a very small place but we got a seat in the corner making it more private. I was also afraid they would rush us out as soon as we ate as people have commented.... but this was not the case. The line disappeared as we were eating, so we relaxed and ate and drank... and ate. The food was DELECTABLE! I ordered the infamous butternut squash ravioli which was as good and even better than others say. Then I got the singing of happy birthday which was punctuated by cheers throughout the restaurant. I felt like I was at home with my big Italian family. It was great! And the best part was when we got our check and our eyes popped out... It was soooo AFFORDABLE!!! Such a great value. We had 2 appetizers... one calamari and the other the Caprese Salad with fresh mozzarella. The Calamari was AMAZING!!  I never thought I liked Calamari until I had this one. In addition to 2 entrees, bread and wine. The bill was less than the awful sushi we had last weekend. Crazy!!! The entrees were about $15 each, wine $5 per glass and the apps were about $8 each. Then to top off the night we stopped at Mike's for dessert, which after eating at Giacomo's is now only my 2nd love in the North End :)All I keep thinking about since I left is... when am I going to go back!!! YAY!  Amazing 30th birthday dinner. Thanks Giacomo's!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Annie K.
Reviews.Content: Best Italian food I ever had. (Note: I haven't had crazy fancy Italian, but for the average person, this is amazing!)Line was 40 minutes, but it was worth it. Sure it's touristy, especially since Rachel Ray has been there (yum-o!). But I'm a tourist. And some places are touristy for a reason people.The place is tiny, but that makes it feel really homey. Especially with the waiters running around and yelling things in their awesome east coast/Italian accents like "Ey Tony more bread over here!" (Yes, there was really a guy named Tony) it made me feel like i was eating real home cooked Italian in someone's kitchen. Each plate of pasta is cooked and assembled when you order, so the plate comes out PIPING HOT, just how I like it. I got the linguini with scallops and shrimp in the spicy red lobster based sauce, which was sooooo goooood. Although, I should've skipped the shrimp. It was just typical slightly overcooked rubbery shrimp. But the scallops were very tasty and a great complement to the lobster sauce and linguini. Initially, I went there for the lobster ravioli, but our waiter suggested this dish, and I am so glad he did! By the way, our waiter was super friendly. I also loved that he gave me a quick, straight answer when I asked him if he would recommend linguini or ravioli. I hate when waiters are like "Umm I don't know..."Anyways great little place for Italian, and bonus! You can run right across the street afterwards and get some yummy cannoli for dessert.

Reviews.Author: Christine L.
Reviews.Content: great food, great service! we walked in around 9, so luckily for us there was a short wait. the prices are good considering the amount and quality of food we received, and we all walked out feeling full and satisfied. definitely visiting again soon!

Reviews.Author: D. James R.
Reviews.Content: Interestingly, my review of this place disappeared. I did a date search. It's not the most overrated place in the North End but you're denying yourself better food in nicer settings for less money. There's more to the neighborhood than Hanover St, people...

Reviews.Author: Stacie K.
Reviews.Content: This restaurant was quite tasty. We had heard that if we were in Boston, we had to visit the North End and find some Italian food, so that's exactly what we did. Having over 1,000 reviews with 4.5 stars, we thought it'd be a good choice.  After eating there, I agree with the good reviews. But be prepared to wait! The restaurant is pretty small, maybe 12-15 tables at most. The food was quick and the service was attentive and friendly. You could see the kitchen and the chefs working, which was a nice touch. It felt like a personable, family atmosphere. My husband had butternut squash($16), which he loved and was very fresh tasting. He did however feel that his dish was a little smaller in size than he expected when he compared it to the other pasta dishes people had ordered, and I agreed. But he was still happy he ordered it, and just asked for an extra basket of bread in order to soak up the remaining sauce. I had a special for the day($23), halibut with a risotto with asparagus and lobster meat. It was divine and filling, I even had leftovers.

Reviews.Author: A F.
Reviews.Content: Butternut squash ravioli was delicious, almost too rich but just so good! Also had caesar salad and garlic bread which with both tasty. On a Wednesday night at about 6pm, we only waited 20-30 minutes. Fun place!! CASH ONLY!

Reviews.Author: Jane H.
Reviews.Content: I will start with: worth the wait.We got there at 5:30 and stood on line at the end of the block. We were seated about an hour later. I apologize to the woman who could feel me staring at her from behind, but I was looking at the food, not the people! When we finally were seated we were not only pleased by the prices of the food and their descriptions, but also by the wine list. Got a glass of white zinfandel for 4.25. Is that unheard of in a restaurant or what?! They also have bottles of wine for $16 -- amazing prices!!Neither I nor the Fiance were disappointed by our food, which came in quickly and SUPER HOT! (Warning -- due to the turn over, everything you get will be super hot!) They have the option of picking your choice of seafood and sauce OR choosing from their set entrees. I got the scallops and shrimp over their Giacomo house sauce, and he got the salmon fettuccine. The house sauce was amazing, seafood incredibly fresh, scallop size is large! I absolutely enjoyed my dish. I would DEFINITELY come again, especially when the rest of Boston's "Little Italy" has similar fare for higher prices. Worth the wait!Word to the wise, the basement is where the bathrooms are located, and there is no air conditioning down there... so if it is a hot day, go only if you really have to!Note: cash only!I will end with: next time I will make my order to go as take out. Noticed one couple standing at the front of the line had ordered their dishes to go and waited a mere 15-20 minutes and left happy with their food.

Reviews.Author: Wesueum W.
Reviews.Content: I loved this place.  My food was delicious as was the other two people I was with.  I would go back there in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Author: Josh R.
Reviews.Content: Very well worth the wait in line! The food here is amazing and the atmosphere is fun! They don't come any more Italian than the owner; he had my girlfriend and I cracking up with his "tough" humor. You can't go wrong. Guarantee you will want to come back.

Reviews.Author: Sara C.
Reviews.Content: I went here in the off season (to avoid the lines). The staff was nice enough but it was really loud and cramped. The food? I just didn't like it. The Chicken Marsala was tough and over seasoned. I sampled a friend's veal and a simple pasta dish. Eh. The veal was tough and the tomato sauce on the pasta lacked flavor.

Reviews.Author: Linda M.
Reviews.Content: I have been to Giacomos several times when visiting Boston.  I finally decided to write a review.   The only time I resented waiting in the long (2 hour) line was once when I finally got in and sat down, they were out of lobster (I like the linguini with 1/2 lobster, clams and mussels dish..name escapes me).  Other than that one time, everything is consistently excellent.  It is my favorite place in Boston...."bar" none.The calamari is excellent, the sautéed garlic broccoli is excellent! and the huge dinner  for 2 mixed seafood/shell fish dish over pasta is out of this world!!  All the seafood is fresh and excellent....excellent.For those that criticized the service or the fact they only take cash:This is NOT white linen $$$$ dining.  If you want  excellent food, great italian wine (fair priced), fast service (the place is small, they need to turn tables quickly) then please do to try this place.  Don't hesitate!!!  If you want over-priced "romantic" quiet places with opera music piped in, there are loads of those places up and down Hanover.  Yes, the wait staff can be curt, they get rude if you don't order fairly quickly....so?  They do drop the food in front of you - steaming hot and cooked to order.  I prefer that to an overly polite patronizing server who serves me re-heated food pre-prepared faire.  Cash only? - the credit card companies charge  restaurant establishments big fees  for the  "privilege" to offer charging to their customers.  I don't want that included in the price of my meal or wine.  The prices at Giacomos are VERY VERY fair.....need an ATM?  There is one directly across the street.  This place is not for the leisure-dining crowd.....uh uh.   I went once at 4pm on Sunday when they open early and it still was quite rushed.  I eat slow, they don't mind that but once you're done, be prepared to sprint....I look forward to returning soon!!!

Reviews.Author: Matt M.
Reviews.Content: Great service. Great food. Great wine. Great time. Go!

Reviews.Author: Laura L.
Reviews.Content: What an exceptional little pasta place. Found the positive reviews on yelp enticing, so we stopped in. Get there early. Its worth the wait if you must wait in line, but if you get there before opening to get a table, you'll be happy you did. We got a seat at the bar; this was the best choice ever. You can't go wrong with the food choices. Talk to the waiters -- they enjoy getting to know you. Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: George M.
Reviews.Content: By far the best quick bite you could ever enjoy in your life. Giacs is amazing, and the plan is..... Wait about an hour, sit down, order a bottle of wine ($16), large calamari, ceasar salad, 2 entrees, and leave in a span of about half hour. Quick, easy and super delicious. By far my favorite Italian spot. Service is real great too as long as you follow the rules... Thanks Rose Marie.

Reviews.Author: Kelly G.
Reviews.Content: PEOPLE - THIS IS A TOURIST TRAP!!!!  Read the review below about herd mentality. CLUE # 1: notice the disproportionate number of Yelp reviews from people who don't live in the Boston!  I live in the North End and am always shocked at the number of people (clearly out of towners) who will stand in line outside this place for hours while there are plenty of other tables at the 50 other Italian restaurants in the North End.  I swear one of the trolley/duckboat/bus tours must tell people this place is the ONLY place to eat Italian in Boston.  Don't get me wrong, the food here is great - but it's not any better than Strega, or Cibos, or Daily Catch, or Taranta, or any of the other great little family-owned joints on any Hanover side street.  If you are visiting Boston, save yourself a bunch of time and sit down and un-hitch your fanny pack at any other restaurant in the North End - they're all just as good.

Reviews.Author: Lynn O.
Reviews.Content: I live around the corner from Giacomo's and I used to snark on this place all the time. "Ugh, look at all those clueless tourists waiting in LINE to get into that  cramped, overrated place! " Well, I was wrong and I have since been converted. I just can't deny that the food is incredibly fresh and delicious for the price. Plus they have bottles of wine for $16. SIXTEEN BUCKS! Giacomo's earns a couple of stars for that alone! With so many North End restaurants churning out mediocre (at best) food at insulting prices, it is no wonder Giacomo's has built up the reputation and loyal following that it has. I'll reiterate a few key points that other Yelpers have already made: -CASH ONLY! Easy to plan ahead for since there are literally 2 ATMs across the street from the restaurant. -This is NOT a good place to bring a large group. Maybe a party of 5. Tops. -The line moves surprisingly fast, but on a super-busy night you could easily spend more time waiting than you will actually sitting and eating. (Honestly, I don't *quite* think it's worth that kind of a wait. Especially in the rain or the cold...)-The servers are very nice, but they also want to get you in and out as quickly as possible and you'll probably feel a little rushed. This is not somewhere you can hang out and relax after you have finished eating. -No dessert or coffee (they really don't want you hanging around!) but who cares? There are plenty of other spots nearby to get those needs met. -They will make food to go! Skip the line, pop your head and and place an order with a server.  But know what you want ahead of time!

Reviews.Author: Marcus D.
Reviews.Content: The last time I ate here was when the DNC was in town - I wish the DNC came to town every four years due to the fact that it scared people away from the city.  We didn't have to wait in line and we weren't rushed out.  I agree w/Christopher M, the fra diavolo is a must. It's another of those small, homey Italian places that seem to be rare in the North End, where the prices are decent and the food is good.

Reviews.Author: Carlie C.
Reviews.Content: come hungry and  be prepared to wait in line.  it is definitely worth the wait if you're in the mood for some authentic italian food.  you can't just put your name down and leave, you actually have to stand there with your whole party present in order to be seated.Food: Burrlata: A big mound of burrata cheese served with basil, tomatoes, olive oil, and a dash of balsamic vinaigrette (so delicious!  this was one of their special appetizers of the day)Maine Lobster with mussels, clams and linguine in the Giacomo sauce: (this was a special of the night)  I like how you can choose from five different sauces to be served with this dish and the seafood pastas ranging from red, fra diavolo, pesto, and their Giacomo house special sauce which is a lobster based red sauce with bechamel.Butternut Squash Ravioli with Baby Asparagus: This is a seasonal dish they offer in the fall and it was amazing.  If you have a dining companion, I would recommend getting 2 dishes and sharing or if you both love the Lobster linguine special, they offer a gargantuan size with a bottle of wine for $65.00.You also can't resist getting wine here since it will only cost you $16 a bottle, but if you're being conservative, you can get a glass of wine for only $4.25.I've also never been served at an italian restaurant so fast in my life before (less than ten minutes) nor have I eaten so much pasta in such a short amount of time.Giacomo's is definitely worth trying!

Reviews.Author: Anonymous P.
Reviews.Content: Solid, basic Italian food at reasonable but by no means cheap prices in an uncomfortably cramped but comfortably casual little space. Beats me whether Yelpers are right or wrong or on crack about this restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Alexander S.
Reviews.Content: Worst service I've ever had. Sure the food might be amazing, but that only makes the waiters more cocky and arrogant. I politely informed the waiter of a larger party of five (it was my birthday) and he kept cutting me off and repeating "no reservations" and then began to cuss me out. Boy, was I wrong about more restaurants in LA having worse service.

Reviews.Author: Surfdawg M.
Reviews.Content: Still don't get this.place..pastas are very good, but other stuff is mezzo-mezzo. it is loud, the wait is atrocious, service is good. Except for one old guy who gets a kick out of yelling and being curt. Wine. list is below par. Forget the antipastos too.This restaurant would not last a week in Italia. Go else where is my sentiment.

Reviews.Author: Akina K.
Reviews.Content: Waited for a one and half in the freezing cold. And it was worth every second... Anytime you are in the Boston, you must try this place.

Reviews.Author: Kris A.
Reviews.Content: One the best Italian restaurants that I have ever been to.  We found this restaurant through Rachel Ray's $40 a day book. When we first got there, the line was about an hour wait since the restaurant was compact which was the only downside to it.  When we finally got seats, we started with the mussels and calamari.  The calamari at Giacomo's the best one I have ever had so far.  I loved so much at I requested a second serving of it.  After the calamari lovefest, we went to the main dish in which I ordered the fettuccine with salmon, sun dried tomatoes and  their special giacomo red sauce.  It was so good of a dish that I had to take the rest to go because I could not finish it since the calamari consumed the hell out of me.  If you live in the Boston area, you guys are lucky to have a restaurant as good as this and if you planning to travel to Beantown make the effort to go here.

Reviews.Author: Janice T.
Reviews.Content: First of all, can I please say that I love the North End?  And that I also really loved Giacomo's!   Had not been living in Boston that long when my fiance and his parents and I stumbled into this place.  We had no idea what Giacomo's even was, but the line that was quickly starting to form gave us a clue: people are willing to wait for as long as it takes to eat here.  The calamari was phenomenal: I love, love, love the stuff, order it often, and can safely say it's the best I've ever tasted.  It was tender, not overly breaded, and mixed within were pieces of breaded and fried banana peppers.  The lobster ravioli was so savory, so tasty, so yum, I must return for more.  My favorite place in my favorite part of Boston.

Reviews.Author: Judy L.
Reviews.Content: The wait on a Sunday night at 5:30 pm was 1 hour and a half. Thanks to all the Yelp review so we knew to go ahead of time when we weren't quite hungry yet :) so by the time we got to the front, we were hungry and ready to eat! The place is tiny! But the food was AMAZING and definitely worth the wait. We ordered:caprese salad: the mozzarella and tomatoes together were the perfect combocalamari: BEST CALAMARI EVER! I don't know what they did, but it was fresh, crispy, but not overly greasy or overly fried. GET ITlobster special: 1/2 lobster with mussels and clams over linguine with red sauce. Delicious. Of the 2 entrees, we liked this one better. The lobster was pretty huge, and the pasta with the sauce were perfectlinguine with shrimp and scallops, shrimp and scallop linguine over giacomo sauce: giacomo sauce is red and a little spicy. Overall, it was delicious but the lobster special tasted even more superiorDEFINITELY RECOMMEND. It is worth an hour and a half wait.

Reviews.Author: Allison Y.
Reviews.Content: 4.5 stars on +1k reviews haha best believe there's a line out the door and your meal will be hella rushed. but the food...oh my god. so amazing. i don't know how they do it. i was like ok i've had good italian food before but how good can it be? I WAS SO WRONG

Reviews.Author: Maggie D.
Reviews.Content: Small, impeccable service, excellent Italian food.Very reasonably priced for Boston. Seafood/Lobster dish special was $20. Glass of wine - $5. The line was down the street by 4 pm on Sunday and now I know why! The reason I gave it 4 stars is that it's really small and you're pretty much on top of your neighbor and I was blinded by the sun for my entire dinner (no blinds). Other than that-it's one of the best Italian restaurants I've ever been to~

Reviews.Author: John F.
Reviews.Content: Wow. This place is marvelous. We waited outside on a brisk fall night for what seemed like eternity, but it was totally worth it. The food was amazing. I had the ziti with chicken and broccoli in a garlic cream sauce and I was in heaven. There's a lot of seafood on the menu, but there's also delicious-sounding things like pumpkin tortellini. This is some of the best Italian food I've ever had. It's cash only, cramped, and there's usually a wait, but still, Giacomo's is not to be missed!

Reviews.Author: Eileen S.
Reviews.Content: Got the frutti di mare over linguine with the spicy red sauce (fra diavolo)... fabulously perfect!  Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Amanda M.
Reviews.Content: Love the roasted red pepper stuffed gnocchi and fried calamari.  Yes...the lines are long, but a waitress brought out some some garlic bread while we were waiting.  My boyfriend has been dying to return ever since we went, but we're trying to round up others that will tackle the wait to get inside!

Reviews.Author: Bloss P.
Reviews.Content: We sat at the bar too; think it can seat 2 at a time...Friendly staff. Awesome calamari and lobster ravioli. They don't make you sit around and wait ...the service is fast and efficient. I would go there more often if parking and waiting were less of a pain. Finish off with cannoli at Mikes, almost right across. Another wait...but worth it.

Reviews.Author: A. C.
Reviews.Content: wow, i wish we had more time here in boston. otherwise we'd go back for more!we came here for a late dinner (10 PM) and it was still crowded.  we were lucky to get seated immediately in a still super crowded dining room.  good luck getting a table any earlier!  we walked by the next night around 6:00 and this long crazy line wrapped around the corner. since it was so late and we weren't starving, we split the lobster ravioli.   i don't know if there was any real lobster meat in the ravioli...maybe just the essence of lobster?  it was still a great meal.  we walked out with a $20 bill (my dining companion had a glass of chianti).  the next table was sharing the house special, the zuppa di pesce.  i was so freakin' jealous but there would have been no way for us to even eat half of it; it's really meant for 4 people.   i would definitely come back when i'm boston again.service is fast and furious with so many people.

Reviews.Author: Dorothy B.
Reviews.Content: i lived in boston for 5 years...and i cant believe i never went, not once, to giacamo's while i lived there. i'm so mad at myself. on a trip back to boston in 2007, my fiance and i stopped in on a ridiculously blustery, cold, wet april evening. we got in just in time, before the line out the door started - we got lucky! now THIS is italian food. i loved how the menu was up on the a big chalkboard. the service was also fast and effecient. and the food...oh the food. i had the pumpkin tortellini's and my mouth is just watering thinking about it. sooo delicious, i didnt want the meal to end! i really love this place. we will back in boston this june, and i will be there for sure.the ONLY reason i didnt give this place 5 stars, is because the tables are soooo close together...you are literally dining w/ the people next to you. there's like 4 inches of space between your tables, you might as well scoot them together and join them. some people like this and think its part of the giacamos charm. however, i like to have a table w/ the people that i want to be there with, not complete strangers. but still, i LOVE this place and i will be back anytime i'm in the boston area. (oh and dont have dessert here...walk on down the street to mike's pastry!!)

Reviews.Author: Pedro L.
Reviews.Content: The Buratta was to die for, the most creamy mozzarella and the juiciest tomatoes. The wait was not too bad since the tables moves pretty quickly!

Reviews.Author: Lisa H.
Reviews.Content: I found this restaurant thanks to Yelp! Woo hoo! The only restaurant in the neighborhood with the line out the door. And I highly doubt it's because the place is small. Their food is Delicious, capital D. Tasted like authentic, homemade Italian food. I haven't had such delicious pasta in a while. Their seafood was very fresh as well. The lobster was very meaty and the calamari was amazinggg. It was definitely worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Sarah A.
Reviews.Content: The best meal I had in Boston.  I was there with my boyfriend on April 29th, we both loved our pasta dishes, and our waiter was fantastic.  I had the lobster ravioli, which was great and reasonably priced.  Please open a location in Chicago!!!

Reviews.Author: Brie L.
Reviews.Content: Overall: Recommended by a friend, and Rachael Ray! Excellent Italian food with homemade ravioli! Generous portions. There is always a wait here, so come early. So good I almost would fly back just to eat here again! Ambiance/location: In Boston's famous North End, you can easily take the T to Haymarket then walk about 10 minutes up Hanover. The restaurant is cozy, with seating for about 20 people, and it's open to the kitchen which is noisy but adds to the atmosphere. Food: Everything looked and smelled delicious, I wish I could try it all! - Calamari - breaded & fried, served hot. Crispy and light, with the calamari cooked to perfection! It was not chewy at all - we easily shared a small between 2 people - Butternut squash ravioli in lobster cream sauce - soooo good - the ravioli is hand made, with fresh pasta, and filled with the sweet squash filling. The cream sauce is rich but not overpowering. When I come back, I'm ordering this. - Fruit di mare with Giacomo's sauce - a red cream sauce with lobster base and generous on the garlic - a compilation of flavors that make you want to keep on eating long after you're stuffed. The seafood was also perfectly cooked - no chewy scallops or calamari here! A generous portion of muscles an clams too. Service: Waitresses work well to quickly serve everyone to accommodate the large crowd outside. They are friendly but move swiftly so you have to catch them! Price: entrees: $14-20, very reasonable wines at $4.50/glass. No desserts (that we saw, at least)

Reviews.Author: Steven W.
Reviews.Content: all I have to say is bomb dot com, there are only like 10 tables in the place and every single one is always packed! the food is awesome and the service is amazing! I loved it, great experience and its hilarious to watch the people outside looking in desperately waiting for their turn to indulge in the delightful food. I had the butternut squash ravioli, antipasto and calamari. All great!

Reviews.Author: Laura B.
Reviews.Content: pumpkin tortellini. go.giacomo's loses one star due to the obnoxiously touristy nature of this location. but let's face it- nearly every business on hanover street is pain-in-the-butt touristy. go mid-week and the line will be shorter. pomodoro is a few doors down and surpasses giacomo's as my favorite spot to eat dinner at in the north end. if you're waiting in line as you read this, i urge you to step out of line and check out pomodoro.

Reviews.Author: Mary P.
Reviews.Content: Standing in line is definitely worth the wait.  There's not much room inside, so if you're claustrophobic, this is not the place for you.  Very loud environment, but that's what you would expect when plenty of people are packed into one small are:)  Food is fantabulous!!! My dad got the Zuppa di Pesce in red sauce...oh boy did he love it.  I took a bite, and it's the best red sauce I've had with this type of dish.  All the seafood was fresh.  Very hearty size.  I had the butternut squash ravioli and it was amazing.  My mom had the lobster ravioli, and it, too, was amazing!  The amount of ravioli that comes with each dish is just right.  Most places I feel don't give enough, but the servings at this place are very appropriate.  Best of all, the price is right!!!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer J.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend had been talking about this place for weeks before we visited Boston, so I had high expectations.  I was not disappointed!  We went on a Sunday afternoon (about 6:30) and got in by 7:10.  We were lucky to get the two little seats at the bar area so we could watch the food be made.  The caprese was super fresh and the butternut squash ravioli was sweet and savory.  My boyfriend got a special with lobster, clams and mussels and he really enjoyed it.  Definitely try this place!  It is worth the wait!  Only part that sucked was the parking... everything on the surrounding streets is resident only.

Reviews.Author: Trey C.
Reviews.Content: Service so bad I registered for a yelp account. When we joined the line out front, the hostess informed us we would be the last party seated for the night. We were given the unpleasant task of turning away disappointed patrons struck with denial. Once we were seated, and they lost their enlisted non-greeter, rather than locking the door or hanging a sign, they let people come in, stand at the door, and be shouted at, "we're closed".  The staff was clearly more interested in going home than providing a pleasant dining experience. The waitress rushed our order sans menu, they were out of items we ordered, when food was brought to the table it was haphazardly slung, when filling water glasses no care was taken not to pour into nearby dinner plates. They rushed the courses of the meal; bread, appetizer, salads, and main course were all on the table at the same time, as well as unnecessary dishes resulting in a table so cluttered it was hard to eat. It's a good thing they don't serve dessert, because that would have been on the table before we were finished with salads. Drink service was as slow as food service was fast. Good food, improper service.

Reviews.Author: Thomas R.
Reviews.Content: I live near Giacomo's and I've been there a million times. Before you go there, here are a some very important tips. 1) it's cash only 2) no reservations and there's always a line out the door, especially if you go at a peak time with nice weather 3) they will rush you. I once ate a meal, split a bottle of wine with my date and we were out in 27 minutes. literally. If you're looking to take your time and have a longer experience, my advice would be to either go somewhere nearby for a bottle of wine and appetizer, then go, or simply choose somewhere else. For option A, cantina italiano is a good option. Sit at the bar, have some antipasto and a bottle of wine, then head to Giacomo's for your entree. You can keep an eye on the line from Cantina - it's across the street. 4) the waiters and waitresses are salty as hell, but they're also characters. Have fun with them and you'll enjoy the experience. If you're sitting at the table texting away on your phone, they will tell you to put it away. As you should. Some may see that as rude - if you're that type, go somewhere else. They won't kiss your butt at Giacomo's. There's a line out the door looking to take your spot.  5) It's cheap and the food is absolutely amazing. I've never had a bad meal there. 6) The wine list is also very reasonable for this neighborhood 7) they don't do coffee or desert. There are plenty of cafes nearby. Pick one.

Reviews.Author: Jess K.
Reviews.Content: This North End locale always has a long line, but for a good reason.  Specials are a good pick, but their pasta dishes are all very solid.  Waitstaff is generally pleasant, but they tend to rush you out the door. Pretty affordable for a popular Hanover Street spot.

Reviews.Author: Christina G.
Reviews.Content: This place is Great, and It's popular for a reason. Yes, you can wait in a line down the block to get in, yes it's cramped, and yes dining is a little more fast paced here than most, but it's all part of the Giacomo's experience, and it is worth it!  I have never felt like I was sitting down having a home cooked Italian meal as much as I have when I've come here. It's very inexpensive, and the food is just amazing! I always get the Calamari, and one of my favorite pasta dishes is the lobster fusilli. Our server was fantastic the last time we were there. He was so helpful, down to earth, and didn't make us feel rushed at all. I've never not been impressed with this place!  I need to go more often.

Reviews.Author: Jenna H.
Reviews.Content: I have tried Giacomo's twice now and am stressed just thinking about the experience. While i expected to wait in line and to be served in a rushed atmosphere, I did not expect to be yelled at for not finishing the bottle of  wine my friend and I got fast enough. A couple waiting in line yelled at us for being disrespectful for taking so long and the waitstaff did nothing!! I was not going to waste my last glass of wine that we paid for so someone else could sit down at our table. The food is decent and the prices good - but the place was too stressful for my taste.

Reviews.Author: Cherie H.
Reviews.Content: This place is cash only - just something to know before you go. Best meal in Boston so far. Wine is very cheap, service is great, mussels appetizer, chicken marsala and lobster ravioli are all delicious. I need to go back to try the pumpkin ravioli. And yes, there always seems to be a long wait to get in and no reservations.

Reviews.Author: Arnold W.
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best place I ate my entire Boston/NY trip. True Italian from the food down to the service! The waitress/hostess/owner? is brash. We had to wait about 40 minutes or so, and it was well worth it. We had the frutti di mare. If you order the "for 2" you get a bottle of wine and lobster comes in the frutti di mare only in the "for 2". Anyways, the sauce is creamy and robust in flavor. The seafood is succulent. One of my most favorite hearty meals I've ever had. Much happiness!! The fried calamari isn't too bad either. Fried with chili peppers as well, gives it a little kick. This place is a must visit whenever you're in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Emily R.
Reviews.Content: This is the place you see with the giant line out the door, that is because they have about 5 tables in the place. At first I was reluctant because I was really hungry and did not want to wait...BUT we got in super fast...and then I learned why. You better think about what your in the mood for when your outside because they make you order immediately, the waitress was not messing around. They were very fast getting out drinks and food out. I had lobster ravioli, and it was TO DIE FOR. I have never had any like it. The rest of my party were all blown away by their food as well. They get you out of there pretty quickly, as to turn more tables, so this is NOT a place to go for a long, stretched out meal. I would not try to catch up with an old friend here, but I would go for some of the best Italian food in the North End.

Reviews.Author: ryan j.
Reviews.Content: Amazing!

Reviews.Author: Tim O.
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience, but I can see where its not for everyone all the time.  Awesome food!

Reviews.Author: Nicole B.
Reviews.Content: i'm torn between 3 and 4 stars.it's good. don't get me wrong. it's delish. however, is it better than fiore? no. is it better than taranta? no. do they take reservations? no.too many no's for me.  it's a small place. however, too small for the amount of customers they get. i had great service and the food was good. but the fact that they don't take reservations bother me, especially because other places that are equally good, with equal service, and simmilar menus take reservations in the north end.

Reviews.Author: Sylvia Y.
Reviews.Content: get there early, wait in line. and be patient.it's really SMALL. so don't even think about bringing shopping bags/baby strollers, etc.  you'll get to know u r neighbors real quick.order the calamari as an appetizer. it's one of the best i've ever had.i got the seafood pasta in red sauce (i want to say frutti di mare) and it was awesome. my cousin had the butter squash ravioli. it was lil sweet, i think he would've preferred my dish.our service was great. if you're polite, they'll be polite. we were just so excited to be there and our server made sure she gave us the run down of what's good and what everyone gets.i did feel a bit weird having all these people outside the restaurant stare into the restaurant expecting us to scarf it down in nano seconds and leave, but the food was quite tasty.get your own plate. their serving is perfect for one and to share a lil, but definitely not "italian family serving" if you know what i mean.

Reviews.Author: Jen R.
Reviews.Content: Food was pretty good but seriously I received the worst service I have EVER had! It was literally a stressful dinner service. The waiter came over and said 'go' to prompt us to order. Interesting. Then I asked if they had fusilli and he told me to look at the menu on the wall. He literally threw the thrown together Caesar salad on the table and it knocked up against my glass. Rude. Uncomfortable. I get it that the food is pretty good but service, and feeling somewhat waited on , does count!Go elsewhere!! You can find comparable Italian anywhere in the north end.

Reviews.Author: Eliza T.
Reviews.Content: Whether is because of age or my job, I've become very very very impatient.  I don't do waiting for more than 30min for my food.  I don't do lines...for anything--not even on Black Friday for a 42in Plasma TV for $150...I just don't do it.   But alas, Yelpers some how convinced my BF and I to try Giacomo's...Even so, I tried to get around the lines by planning on getting there right at opening time...but as all plans born in the midst of a mini vacation, we didn't get there at 5...instead, we got there at 7...on a Saturday night....when the line wrapped around the corner...and people in line in front of us was "snacking" on take out fries and pastries from another place!
