Reviews.Content: This place is awesome!  We walked in here on a Wednesday night looking for a satisfying pasta dinner, and this fit the bill.   I was a little worried that our server was going to be impatient and try to get us in and out as fast as possible, but he was great--very efficient and helpful, and didn't make me feel rushed at all.The place itself is really small and cozy (tables are really jam packed together), but other than that, I can't say enough good things about it.  Food was delicious, and the price was very reasonable.  I'm definitely coming back here!

Reviews.Author: Amy M.
Reviews.Content: We stumbled upon this little gem while searching for dinner on a recent visit to Boston.  As luck would have it we grabbed the last table before a long line of patient customers formed on the sidewalk...and now I know why.  So amazing.  The atmosphere is wonderful, the service is great, and the food is to die for.  We enjoyed the butternut squash ravioli and the fettuccine with prosciutto...and when I say enjoyed, I mean devoured.  I was so sad when our empty plates where taken away, and even sadder when we walked back to our hotel, and I realized that it would be a long, long trip from Austin to come back anytime soon.  Giacomo's I suggest you set up a south location :)  There is nothing like you in Texas.

Reviews.Author: Charleston C.
Reviews.Content: very crowded, quite a wait for a weekday dinner, though quite worth it. We ordered calamari for appetizer, buttersquash ravioli, scallop and shrimp pasta with Giacomo sauce, and prosciutto and peas fettuccine. The calamari is good, but i find most calamari good. However, i find their entree really unique tasting. The price is reasonable, I thought, given the food quality. The only problem is that it is very small and crowded, difficult to even move in and out of our seats. That's the price you pay for good food.

Reviews.Author: Joe M.
Reviews.Content: Very simple. Overall a good place, with a homemade from-scratch taste to all of their dishes.  But it's not good enough to wait in a long line for it. Don't go if you are claustrophic, you'll be cramped and bumped your entire meal if you are in the center aisle.

Reviews.Author: Isabella R.
Reviews.Content: Love this restaurant! Two downfalls: no parking and long line. Aside from those issues, this place has really amazing food. Always fresh, tasty, and keeps my friends and I going back for more. The key to any restaurant's success, and especially this one's, is CONSISTENCY! Every time we eat here, the food is just as delicious as it was the previous visit. Another plus--we've NEVER had to send anything back.

Reviews.Author: Drea Y.
Reviews.Content: The place is tiny, the menu is written on a chalkboard where you pick your sauce & then your pasta or a specific dish...for someone as indecisive as me it was made very simple...and the food was fantastic. I ordered the butternut squash ravioli and it was the best I've had to date. They cook the pasta perfectly al dente, the portions are enormous, and the prices are reasonable for the quality of the food.

Reviews.Author: Scott K.
Reviews.Content: Well I'm writing this review a little late so I 'll keep it short and sweet.  Cheap decent wine, good food, good apps, friendly atmosphere.  It was super crowded though, and the line was ridiculous.  Not the bestest Italian food that I have had, but it is definitely good food and if I'm in town again, I will definitely make my way over here for some good food and good wine.  :)

Reviews.Author: Raymond T.
Reviews.Content: This place is worth the wait and worth the hype.  We ate at another place Friday night and the line for Giacomo's was around the corner. If you can, go on a Monday when we did and the wait was only 25 minutes. Small place with little elbow-room, it is not a place for an intimate dinner. Pasta was fresh as was the sauce... I had the fusilli with lobster in diavolo (spicy red, marinara-type sauce) that was amazing! My wife had the mussels in the same sauce with the same result.  Only beer and wine, and cash only but oh so worth it!

Reviews.Author: Barry D.
Reviews.Content: Have to give another shout out to the best Italian food in Boston. Stopped here again New Year's week and waited in line outside in the cold for a half an hour. But it was ALL worth it. The food is awesome - this time we had the seafood combination dinner with a bottle of wine. Great deal and great food! Whenever we come to Boston - we will always come to Giacomo's.

Reviews.Author: latrice b.
Reviews.Content: We have went here once before and it was fantastic... Too bad I can't say the same this time around. The food wasn't as good, and our waitress was very rude. I don't think I will be going bk again :(. Sad, because I like supporting family owned businesses!

Reviews.Author: Keith W.
Reviews.Content: Get there early or you'll have to stand outside and wait for a table! The restaurant is tiny, you'll be sitting almost shoulder to shoulder with guests from other tables but hey it's a real cozy place and everyone was friendly. We had the mussels and calamari appetizers, both were really delicious and portions were generous. We also had two different bottles of Italian wines with dinner. I had the special of the day seafood pasta with fra diavolo sauce. The plate of pasta was flippin' HUGE! I bet 9 out of 10 people wouldn't be able to finish it but somehow I did, probably because it was so delicious. I'd love to go back but definitely during slower hours. Oh yea it's cash only, my buddies had to leave the restaurant and run to the ATM.

Reviews.Author: Rhea K.
Reviews.Content: Lovely restaurant. Came here on a Friday evening around 8:30pm and only had to wait for about 20 minutes. Service is fast and food is great. Bottles of wine were only $17! I got the special, which was a seafood fusilli, and my friend had the lobster ravioli. Both were excellent, though the ravioli was a little too creamy for me.. probably couldn't have handled an entire plate. Our waitress was funny and so nice. Their calamari is also great.

Reviews.Author: Mary W.
Reviews.Content: "Almost as good as my grandmother's cooking" is what I told our awesome friendly server. I mean, come on, nothing is ever as good as grandma's, but this was came pretty close. I had a gnocchi dish which was delicious, oh, and their mussels! They were so good they made my non mussel eating boyfriend indulge! Overall, very good, but make sure you bring cash!

Reviews.Author: Caleb L.
Reviews.Content: Really good, big portions and great atmosphere. Had to wait an hour to be seated but it was worth it; I actually just come back from Italy over the summer and this was quite up to par (but not quite the absolute best I've had)

Reviews.Author: Michael C.
Reviews.Content: Hands down...This is the best Italian cuisine in Boston. Or maybe in the world...

Reviews.Author: Katie R.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic!  Went for dinner last night, and really enjoyed it.  They move you through quickly, but don't rush you at all.  Hubby had calamari in the Giacomo sauce, I had clams in the fra diavolo.  Mine was amazing, his was overwhelmingly awesome.  Prices are pretty good -- especially on the wine (a bottle for $16?  unheard of!) and the appetizers.  Will be going back and taking friends!

Reviews.Author: Charles S.
Reviews.Content: Excellent place with the right expectations.I gave it four stars.  Really, should be five for food and three for ambiance.The right expectations (North End):  get in, eat fantastic food, get out.  No frills.  No dessert or coffee.  Expect to be separated from the party next to you by about four inches.  Expect to wait in line, on the street, in the elements.  Do not expect all the entrees to be served at once.  Expect to pay in cash.All that notwithstanding, the food is absolutely fantastic.  Others have praised the pumpkin tortellini and butternut squash ravioli -- and rightfully so.  To that, I'd say the grilled swordfish  (as boring as it sounds) is perfect.  The specials also rotate frequently, and always feature fresh ingredients.  Even if price were no object, I don't know where to find food that is much better.  And once price factors in, it's absolutely impossible to beat Giacomo's.In the South End, things are a little bit less spartan.  You can pay with a credit card.  You can order coffee and dessert.  The experience is not as rushed.  There's a bit more room, so you don't have to wait outside as much.   Otherwise, the menus are largely the same.  (Note, however, that the South End location has red pepper and goat cheese stuffed gnocchi on their regular menu, which occasionally is the deciding factor between going to the North and South end locations.)

Reviews.Author: Jacqueline L.
Reviews.Content: I went here on Halloween and there was a line out the door. That seemed to be a good sign that this place is worth the wait. I was a little wary of the fact that they advertised Rachel Ray came here on her "$40 a day" show...anyways, this place is tiny. And service is....not the best part of the experience. Our appetizer orders were screamed to the kitchen as soon as they escaped our mouths.  They have great vegetarian options, the pumpkin tortellini is to die for. I had the gnocci special and I must say, it was like eating heavenly potato marshmallows in tomato sauce. Wine list is short and inexpensive. Portions are large enough to feed three people. Whatever they lack in service, they make up for in grub.

Reviews.Author: Seth D.
Reviews.Content: Wait in line for a table in a quaint North End eatery. You will. Be treated like the tourist, you may or may not be. You will. Experience great food and good wine and not get ripped off. You will.  Mangia Mangia

Reviews.Author: IRENE S.
Reviews.Content: pretty freaking amazing! :Dheard from MANY people about how horrid the line can get..but that can also prove you right if people are willing to wait that long! so we were willing to risk waiting but my friend and i got lucky because we visited on a random tuesday night and there was no wait!try their giacomo sauce+shrimp linguini! A-MAZING stuff i still dream about this lobster based sauce (: it is worth every penny! and oh yes, the service was pretty good too

Reviews.Author: Thi N.
Reviews.Content: If I could give Giacomo's more than 5 stars, I would. If there's one place you need to eat when you're in Boston, this is it. I never had fresh pasta before and now that I have, I don't know how I will go back to the dry stuff.We arrived around 6pm and there was already a line outside waiting to get in. I am one to hate standing in line for anything, but I was curious and on vacation so I had the time. I am so glad I did it. Delicious, affordable and for the crowd they had, excellent service! So nice and helpful.The waiter explained that all Giacomo's red sauces are lobster-based making them very rich. I however opted to get the lobster ravioli that everybody on yelp raved about which comes with a garlic cream sauce. I wanted to lick my plate it was so good!A few tips:1. Giacomo is cash only.2. Every bottle of wine is $16, so get a bottle and share with your friends!3. Dinner only and get there by 5pm if you don't want to stand in line.4. They do not serve dessert, but don't worry, Mike's Pastry is walking distance away and the cannolis there are to die for (but that's a different review...)

Reviews.Author: Dawn S.
Reviews.Content: Drove around North End looking for parking on a Saturday night - failed. Saw a long line outside of Giacomo's when I was circling the area and thought this place must do something right. Intended to dine at Neptune, but when we finally got there around 10pm and stood in line for 5 mins, the server decided to waltz over and inform us that they are fully booked and can no longer accomodate us. Ok, would have been nice if they had told us 5 minutes earlier but that actually gave us an opportunity to check out Giacomo's. We joined the line outside of Giacomo's around 10:10, there were 2 parties ahead of us. However, a table for 2 opened up and we got seated almost immediately (Yay, but I'm sure ppl in line were giving us dirty looks)! The vibe of the place was great - unpretentious and loud in a good way. Our server was friendly and offered great suggestions on the daily menu. We started with the calamari - boring right? NO! In addition to the fresh and tender calamari, they also throw in a handfull of hot peppers in to the fryer and that added just the right amount of kick to the dish. LOVED IT. My friend had the home made fusilli with lobster and shrimp in fra diavolo sauce and I had the linguine with half a lobster, mussels and clams also in fra diavolo sauce. What can I say, being in Boston, we gotta have seafood! The seafood was honestly the freshest  I've had since lobster fest in Maine last summer and the amount of food could easily feed a family of 4. I liked the spicy sauce, the freshly grated cheese and the perfectly cooked lobster. All in all, great experience. Cash only - not a big deal because the dishes were very well-priced. Honestly, you could pay the same price in NY for half the food we had there. We need restaurants like this in NY!

Reviews.Author: J M.
Reviews.Content: The food's good but the place is very very small, almost no room to move. And the line out the door can make it a little daunting on cold or wet nights.

Reviews.Author: Brandon C.
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. It is the best italian food that I have ever had. Everything that you order is good. We started off with broccolini and garlic bread -- delicious! I had the lobster ravioli. It was so good. The line is long to get it but for a good reason --- it's worth it.

Reviews.Author: John L.
Reviews.Content: this place is insane.dinner for two is enough food for 3 r 4.the service is great.  worth the wait.  for seafood the price is fantastic

Reviews.Author: Stan Z.
Reviews.Content: So good!  Pasta here was delicious!  Nice selection of wine too. The restaurant is small but very popular judging by the size of the line!  Be sure to get there early.  Waitresses are nice and move very quickly!  Would recommend to anyone in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Lorena C.
Reviews.Content: Where to start? My boyfriends friend who is originally from the area told us about Giacomo with such happiness in his eyes that we had to go. I'm glad I did. Here you learn how faithful Bostonians are with their favorite restaurants. They wait out in the cold and form a half a block long line in the cold! The restaurant is tiny but it makes up for it in their food. We got there early so we were first in and got the specials of the day, they were amazing! I had the half lobster spaghetti with there house sauce and compared to Miami prices this was soooo cheap! We ate 2appetizers and drank beer and had two main dishes and the meal came out to nearly 60.   This was excellent for the quality and freshness of the pastas and seafood. Remember to arrive early around 4:15 to 4:30 because the line starts forming at about half past four. Also, remember that it's in the north end and the majority of businesses here are Cash Only! I hope the place becomes a historic landmark soon..... Jajaja Enjoy!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Barry W.
Reviews.Content: Wasn't going to write on Giacomo's since there are already 500+ reviews but decided to do so because I don't really get it. Would probably give 2 1/2 stars if that was an option but rounded up for effort versus outcomes.Maybe I need to give it another try but:- calamari starter: fine, a bit too done but that will vary with orders, huge portion, nothing distinctive or special- special housemade fusilli with lobster and shrimp in Giacomo sauce: very little lobster (at $26!), a few shrimps, a bit heavy.  Pasta did seem housemade but was heavy.  Points for making the pasta but, of course, all fresh pastas aren't alike and this one was kind of mediocre.Did like the place (small, oozes North End authenticity) and service was good. And, it sure is popular but I can't imagine this is the top (or close to top) Italian in North End.

Reviews.Author: Zack G.
Reviews.Content: Eating there for the first time, all is going well. The mozzarella with marinara was great. BUT when it came to dinner- we found a giant hair in our food. And to make it worse the hair was cooked in it, because when my girlfriend went to pull the hair out, a piece of chicken was dangling at the end. The image of chicken hanging by human hair ruined the meal for the rest of us. They tried to charge us full price and when we asked to have it taken off, they were rude and resisted. Poor customer service, and hairy food. Not worth the wait in the cold and rain.

Reviews.Author: Tom S.
Reviews.Content: It's like going to your favorite Aunt's house for dinner.  She'll treat you like a king and you'll absolutely love the food.  Giacomo's is one of those life experiences that you will never forget and wish that you could do it again.  Do not pass up the opportunity.  It is worth the effort.

Reviews.Author: TJ N.
Reviews.Content: As a long time Boston resident, I knew about Giacomo's but always avoided it.  We took our visiting SoCal cousins here on a cold January night to give them the North End dining experience.  The food was very good (4 stars) but not enough for me to return for the bad dining experience (1 star):- parking in the North End- long line- rushed service- eating with the back of the person at the next table basically as a guest at your table- splitting any group larger than 4 at separate tables- cash only

Reviews.Author: Kelly C.
Reviews.Content: Great ask for Julie she was wonderful

Reviews.Author: jessie n.
Reviews.Content: We yelp this place and saw it was all 4 1/2 stars with only 2$ sign for pricing.  The verdict........it is so worth the 1hr wait in the cold and windy evening.  The crab ravioli is so sweet and delicious!  The spaghetti is cooked el dente.  We clean our plates with the must have garlic bread.  The portion of each dish are generous enough that we could not order dessert if we want to.  Highly recommended!

Reviews.Author: Jessica P.
Reviews.Content: Wow! We came to Boston for a quick trip and heard this place was supposed to be the best in the area. We got there at 4:45pm on a Sunday afternoon.... there was a line outside already. Lucky us,  we only waited 20 minutes. Its true what they say, you all literally dining with other customers because your tables are close to each other. We ordered a bottle of wine and the calamari... both inexpensive and so delicious. I had the lobster ravioli that was amazing. My boyfriend had the giacomo sauce in spaghetti with lobster and clams... he cleaned up that plate too. If you are looking for a place to sit, relax and take your time to dine... this is not it. You are done before you know it... but oh so good.

Reviews.Author: stacy g.
Reviews.Content: Love how it's a small place with the menu on the wall. I read the reviews and got here early about 5:15pm or so, and didn't have to wait at all. By the time we were eating there was a line of people waiting outside already! The food is so delicious though! The service was really quick- it took from the moment we ordered to when we were out the door only about 20 minutes TOPS. The tables are really close together, but it did seem like they were rushing us a little. I was told by the waiter to not look at my phone (i was actually checking in there at that moment) and to decide what i wanted. The BF and I only ordered one entree as he really wasn't that hungry. I don't remember what i ordered but it was a HUGE plate of food with enough to serve us both and still have leftovers. The prices were really reasonable as well. Really enjoyed the atmosphere as it was pretty authentic. I'll never forget this place!

Reviews.Author: Amy B.
Reviews.Content: As a former North End resident, I was lucky enough to live right near Giacomo's which made it easy to get there early and avoid the long lines.  But let me tell you something - waiting in line for this place is WORTH IT! The pastas are delicious and so fresh - some of the best pasta in the neighborhood for sure. Best of all, it's CHEAP!  You can get a dinner for two with a bottle wine for $50! Do yourself a favor and try this place out if you have time to wait in line - you'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Author: Tommy T.
Reviews.Content: Chicken Marsala is unbelievable. 6 stars! This WOULD be my last supper.

Reviews.Author: MEE Y.
Reviews.Content: I don't live in Boston. I only get to go here when I am visiting my boyfriend. And of course this was our first year anniversary and we had to come here. There is always a wait and yes it might be annoying but once you sit down and take a bite you will be amazed!!!!! The sitting isn't too comfy but you can enjoy your self.One bad thing I noticed this time was there is no AC!!!! So it was really hot in the restaurant.Recommendation.No matter what try the fried calamari. It is delicious!!Lobster Ravioli in garlic cream sauce.And we had the house special, fucili(?) with lobster meat and it was the bomb.!!

Reviews.Author: Audrey M.
Reviews.Content: Worth the wait for straight forward, delicious Italian food.  Friendly service, great value.  Loved it!  The garlic bread is superb if you like crusty rustic bread grilled to perfection and infused with garlic.  These are not soft rolls drizzled with garlic and butter.

Reviews.Author: Blair F.
Reviews.Content: With 2 of us in line, it was about a 15 +/- minute wait on the evening after Thanksgiving. It was cramped, slightly rushed and we loved it.  The service was spot on.  My butternut squash ravioli with garlic cream sauce was sublime.  My wife's lobster ravioli was equally as good.  The bread, butter, and olio was also very good.  This restaurant doesn't require much of an explanation - it was very, very good.  Don't have expectation of a chic chic dinner and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Lance V.
Reviews.Content: Another 5 star review for Giacomo's (pronounced ja-comos I'm told).  Definitely lives up to its high rating on Yelp.  I went on a Monday evening at 6:30 pm, and there were two parties of 5 waiting to get in.  Fortunately, there was a table available immediately for a party of 2, so there was no wait for us.  I ordered the butternut squash ravioli on the advice of the waitress rather than the chicken broccoli ziti which looked good.  I was happy with the butternut squash ravioli.  The dining room is small, and if you're a party of two, you may find yourself seated immediately next to other customers.  Very friendly atmosphere here though, so I thought the close by seating only added to the positive experience.  Great prices, including pinot grigio by the glass.

Reviews.Author: Yaniv K.
Reviews.Content: Pasta swimming in cream and butter. We waited longer than we sat inside the restaurant. Was kinda disappointed due to the overwhelming reviews here on Yelp

Reviews.Author: Josh C.
Reviews.Content: I salute my fellow Yelpers.  Actually visited the location on the South End on Columbus.  Very pleased with the entire experience.  Just two of us so we opted for the bar rather than wait 30 minutes (but gladly would have done so).  Service was attentive but definitely focused (they work hard to keep things moving so others aren't waiting around forever).  Every single dish was fantastic.  Few apps, reasonable glass of wine and two entrees.  We left very happy and highly recommend you pay these guys a visit.

Reviews.Author: Ryan H.
Reviews.Content: I have never waited in line for dinner like this. A one hour wait. I was alone so they matched me with another single. It was worth the wait. I have never tried butter-nut squash raviolis, but decided to try something different, and I was not disappointed. Everything was fresh, and so flavorful. This is a very small efficient place. Do not expect to linger over wine here

Reviews.Author: Koren O.
Reviews.Content: Been here a few times a while back, definitely need to go back. Always a line out the door when I've gone, and well worth the wait! Prices really low for "North End" dining which is awesome. Even a cheap but decent wine selection. The food all over for myself and dates was superb each time. The service feels like an old Italian family trying to get you in and out. It's kind of amusing but can feel a little bit rushed. Also, they are cash only, which can be a little inconvenient and the reason they didn't get 5 stars. One more +, they are pretty close to Mikes Pastries! LOL

Reviews.Author: Beth W.
Reviews.Content: Delicious food and great prices.  Most things under $20 and wines were $17 a bottle.  I had the lobster ravioli which was excellent.  Also ordered garlic bread...very tasty!  Upon arrival, the line wrapped around the corner but moved fairly quickly and took us about an hour to get to the front door. No reservations, no wait list...must wait in line.  Service was fast and extremely efficient.  Cash only. I would wait again for the food!

Reviews.Author: Shawn F.
Reviews.Content: No wonder why this place has lines out the door. We waited over an hour in line outside and well worth it. You must get the fried calamari. The small is enough for 2 people, its the best I've ever had! The food is delicious, fresh and cooked to perfection. The service is quick, not a romantic spot, you'll be close to other tables and hear everyones conversation so don't go here on a first date or a business meeting. Cash only of course. Love it!!

Reviews.Author: matt b.
Reviews.Content: Love this place.  Simple menu, great atmosphere, and fair prices.  Line can be long but worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Amy S.
Reviews.Content: Cute little establishment in the North End. They found a table for us in the very crowded restaurant almost instantly, though I felt like we were sharing the table with the couple next to us. Definitely not a good first date spot. There is little time for conversation in the amount of time the staff wants you in and out of their restaurant (but what else would you expect in the North End, really?) The wine is the best deal in town. $17 for a bottle of descent wine. The food was great and not very expensive. I had swordfish in some lobster sauce, it was delicious. I'll definitely be back, I guess I'll have to try that calamari everyone is raving about.

Reviews.Author: Stephen M.
Reviews.Content: Amazing.  They are known for their shellfish, but do a good job with everything.  Place is tiny, 10 tables max, and the food is amazing, hence there will always be a wait to get in.  At 5:30pm on a Wednesday, there was a line out the door.  For 2 of us there was a 10 minute wait.The Caprese Salad was excellent.  Cheese was fresh, tomatoes tasty, olive oil and vinegar high quality.  Garlic bread was an interesting twist.  Fresh garlic (not powder), a lot of olive oil, a little cheese, and crusty bread.  Very good.Frutti DiMare with Giacomo sauce was out of this world.  Perfect pasta, wonderful seafood, great sauce... Excellent.Chicken, broccoli, penne, in wine butter sauce stole my wife's heart.  She loved it.  Nearly licked the plate.In all, an amazing meal for $62 after tip.  CASH ONLY!  The server was super nice as well.  The hostess was comical in how controlling she was over restaurant traffic, but that's part of the charm of a 10 table packed restaurant with a line out the door.

Reviews.Author: M F.
Reviews.Content: The best house sauce in Boston. Flavored with a lobster base the red sauce is out of this world. Goes great with scallops. Wait in line, grab a bottle of wine next door, grab a plastic cup and your all set. Part of going to giacomos is the wait.

Reviews.Author: AC C.
Reviews.Content: It was a brisk night, but it was definitely worth the wait! For a party of two, we waited about 40 minutes (there were 3 other parties of 2 in front of us, and 2 parties of 4), had the lobster ravioli special, which was amazing. Prices were incredibly reasonable, and the portions were extremely filling. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Suzanne D.
Reviews.Content: best italian food ever. and they keep things real by not taking credit cards.

Reviews.Author: Anna G.
Reviews.Content: LOVE the food here.  Would give it 5 stars except the wait is always excruciatingly long and then once you are in, the wait staff forces you to hurry, I mean hurry, through your meal.Love the calamari.  Love the giacomo sauce on anything.  Butternut squash ravioli, fusilli w/lobster &shrimp, special ravioli w/veal...all amazing.  I hear there is another location in Southy where the wait is not quite so bad.  I'll definitely give that a try.

Reviews.Author: James B.
Reviews.Content: Best calamari I've had, the fried hot peppers took it to a new level.  My ravioli was fresh and cooked to perfection, the Giacomo sauce (lobster-based red + bechamel) was delicious and deadly.  Top all that off with friendly and fast service and low prices -- what more could you want?

Reviews.Author: Andy O.
Reviews.Content: Nearly everything at this restaurant is perfect, the tasty food, the friendly staff, and nice environment.  Instead of listing the endless positives, let me clarify the drawbacks that prevented a five star rating.Wait - I guess this is no different than most other places in the North End which do not accept reservations nor maintain a waitlist.  If you want a table, you must stand in line outside the restaurant, rain or shine (luckily we had a nice summer night).  Even with this policy, we went on Labor Day weekend during St Anthony's festival, and only waited about 45 minutes.Staff sometimes rushes guests out - While this didn't happen to us, don't expect a nice leisurely conversation at your table after dinner.  Anyone lingering too long after business has been complete (aka ate your meal) will be rushed out by the staff in order to crank more guests through tables.  I understand why Giacomos is doing this, it's such a small restaurant and there's a huge line of peeps waiting to get in).Aside from these drawbacks, dinner was great.  The prices are very reasonable and the food was incredible.

Reviews.Author: Cyndee P.
Reviews.Content: WOW... that's all I can say! I have had some great pasta before but this place just beat it by far! We loved it so much we went a few days after before we headed back home! My favorite was there Linguine pasta with the cream of tomato sauce (not to creamy) with chicken, pepper, and onion. I also had them spice it up which was perfect! Yes we did have to wait outside in a line in the freezing cold and is a little small in there but is so worth it! My friend ordered the Lobster raviolis which was super and im not a big lobster fan.  I would highly recommend going here if you're out that way. I hope they put one in SF!

Reviews.Author: Marybeth M.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite place to eat in Boston!  The butternut squash ravioli is, as many others have said, absolutely amazing.  Even though I'd like to branch out on their menu, it's hard to stop myself from ordering this every time I go.  The mozzarella marinara is delicious as well, along with their pasta dishes with seafood.  Don't be too discouraged by the line -- once you're inside the restaurant, you'll get your food within minutes since there are so few tables.

Reviews.Author: Cynthia C.
Reviews.Content: I had the special (beef brisket ravioli in a plum tomato sauce with sauteed spinach) and it was simply delicious!  though i heard there would be a long line (and though there usually is), i got lucky since there were just two in my party and we got seated right away.service is pleasant and fast.  food comes out quickly (to ensure a fast turnover rate) but i didn't feel rushed at all.  ambiance is cozy and comfortable.  i will definitely go back whenever i'm in boston!

Reviews.Author: Maunish S.
Reviews.Content: Butternut squash ravioli's! Get them. I got the lobster ravioli, which was good, but not the best. My buddy got the butternut squash ravioli, and I swear it was amazing. Try it. You will be amazed. The service was good, the older gentlemen who was waiting on us was awesome. He did forget out bottle of wine, but that is okay. The place is extremely small and has the biggest line. If you're with a friend than it is okay. Word of advice, this place does not take credit cards!!! We went there and did not have any cash on us at all. Thank god an ATM machine was right down the street. I got the cash before our meals set on the table. I would recommend this place the next time anyone is in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Luke R.
Reviews.Content: The best restaurant by far in my neighborhood (North End).  A typical night out here includes waiting at least an hour to get in, tasty inexpensive entrees, and a variety of $16 wines.It's worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: Maurice C.
Reviews.Content: We actually waited in line *twice* before eating here.  We had heard that this place was really good, but after waiting for a while with the line not moving *at all*, we decided to check out a few other places to eat.  After not finding anything up to our standards, we decided to head back, and when we got back there, the line was just as long as it had been when we left, but was filled with entirely new people.  Seems as if we shouldn't have left in the first place, as they get in a new shift of people pretty quickly, even if the line doesn't move for several minutes.So after getting back in line, we were probably seated at a table within 15 minutes.  We got a $16 bottle of White Zinfandel which was quite good and a great bargain.  The service is very quick, but not rushed.  I also wasn't too cramped, despite being seated next to another couple at a four person table.For appetizers, I got the caprese salad and my dining companion ordered the small fried calamari.  The caprese was advertised as having buffalo mozzarella, but it definitely didn't taste like buffalo mozzarella to me.  Decent quality fresh mozzarella, yes, but not buffalo.  It wasn't bad, but I was disappointed since they advertised it as being buffalo.The fried calamari pretty much made up for it, though.  There was nothing small about it, and it was without a doubt the best fried calamari I've ever tasted.  It was tender, crispy, just wonderfully cooked and seasoned.  In my mind, if you eat here, you just have to have the calamari.  For the main courses, I had the lobster ravioli, and she had a half lobster with pasta and Giacomo's Sauce.  The lobster ravioli was very well cooked, with a creamy garlic sauce.  The portions were quite large, especially for the half lobster and pasta dish.  Both meals were well cooked and quite good, although it doesn't blow you away like the fried calamari does.  I've heard that the butternut squash ravioli is the best one to order, and I'll have to try that the next time I come here.  I would recommend the lobster ravioli as well, though.Overall, the food is great here, the service is quick and adequate, and the prices are very good.  If you don't mind the wait, and the fast pace, as well as lack of desserts, it'll be a great experience for you.  The only thing stopping me from calling this a 5, is the fact that they failed to deliver the promised buffalo mozzarella with my caprese.  Other than that, it was great.

Reviews.Author: Bryan K.
Reviews.Content: This place was exactly as I expected..... delicious.  There wasn't a dish on the menu I wouldn't have loved.  Next time I am getting the pumpkin tortellini.  It was noisy, packed, long wait, fast service, and everything we wanted on a Friday night.  The food was excellent and service was spot-on.  The wine was inexpensive as were the entrees.  Don't be scared of the line.  Go grab a coffee and enjoy the wait as you build up a hunger you are going to need.  Large portions will fill you up.  Don't worry that they don't have desert, I'm sure you can find something sweet to eat on Hanover St. (Mikes and Modern are right down the street).  We will  be back again.

Reviews.Author: Nic L.
Reviews.Content: Get there earlier or you'll be standing outside for a bit. This place is best for couples- smaller groups get seated faster than larger groups and in the winter... this can make a huge difference! Food was delicious; my pasta was a bit too salty for my liking, but overall tasty!

Reviews.Author: Alex F.
Reviews.Content: I am not one to follow the crowds and wait in line for food especially in the North End, where there are tons of restaurants. However, there is a reason that on any given night, Giacomo's has a line out their door with customers who just want to eat. The food here is amazing, probably the best pasta I have ever had, and I have been to Italy. Any pasta you try here will be amazing, I highly recommend the Pumpkin Tortellini, that will become a favorite who trys this.

Reviews.Author: Nan S.
Reviews.Content: Maybe it depends on what kind of pasta you get. (I really think so) I think I got something that had fettuccine pasta with marinara sauce and chicken. The chicken was good because it was pretty moist and hot/fresh. But there was something off about the marinara sauce, not enough salt, perhaps a little too acidic tasting? Either way, after I had that, I didn't understand why people talk about this place so much.. The space is so tight! I literally got up at least five times, out of my chair, to let the waiter through. And when I wasn't standing up, my upper body was literally on top of the table because I scooted in that much to avoid being hit by so many people. Not a very romantic place to be when it's crowded. I was surprised that they sell cheap wine though!

Reviews.Author: R V.
Reviews.Content: LOVE this place! Be ready to stand in line (30mins to an hour), but it's all worth it... the food never disappoints. Though the place is really tiny, I love the busy, bustling atmosphere that makes you wanna talk and laugh while your elbows are being jostled by the staff in their hurried rush :)Don't miss the Calamari (with the red peppers) and the Giacomo sauce (creamy, tomatoey lobster sauce... yummm). Love love!

Reviews.Author: Brian S.
Reviews.Content: Get there at 4:45pm to avoid the lines later in the night.

Reviews.Author: Slider S.
Reviews.Content: Walked over from the theater dist. & got the half lobster w/ linguini, clams, mussels & fra diavolo sauce. The walk back gave me the opportunity to walk off some calories and thoroughly reminisce one of the best Italian meals I've had in many a year! Service via Julie was awesome but it does get packed and very importantly it's CASH only so get ready before the meal by not eating & have some green in hand it'll be worth it!

Reviews.Author: Katie L.
Reviews.Content: (Cash only) it was alright. I like the set up of the place and it was quick and easy. I had the caeser salad, and the giacomo sauce with shrimp and scallops...only 3 shrimp and 4 small bay scallops for 16 dollars. The sauce was decent but couldve had more flavor...the service was quick but I felt like everyone had a bit of an attitude...if I lived in boston I probably I wouldn't go back for seconds...

Reviews.Author: D H.
Reviews.Content: I understand why people like this place.  The food is good, and it's reasonably priced for what you get. That being said, I have been here a few times, have always had a nice meal but have never felt the desire to rush back. I think this is mostly due to feeling rushed throughout the entire dinner so they can seat the next party from the ridiculously long line that's always outside the door. The service is pleasant enough, I know they're busy but I generally have a problem with restaurants who act like its a privilege for you to be eating at their establishment, which I've always felt at Giacomo's (especially from the woman with the too long ponytail. I get she runs the show but it wouldn't hurt her to chill out a little, and also take a few inches off that hair). Anyway, if you're in the mood for a good seafood pasta, and arent looking for anything special in terms of service, this is a good place. They dont announce it but you can combine the sauces they have, I like the fracimo, a mix of the Giacamo (red with a hint of bachamel and fra diavolo) The antipasto was also very good, fried calamari was just ok.Also,Ive been to the south end location once before, and liked it much more, its friendlier, bigger, and have a larger/more interesting menu. They also supposedly take reservations at the south end.  Both locations are cash only.

Reviews.Author: Molly P.
Reviews.Content: I eat out a lot and travel for my job so I get to eat all over the county. This place is amazing.  The place is small and intimate. We just about sat in the kitchen and saw the action.  The food is worth the wait in line to get a table.

Reviews.Author: Juan C.
Reviews.Content: Ricotta and Spinach Ravioli was amazing. It will get packed and there's not a lot of space if you're looking for a quiet and intimate experience. Bring cash!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Daniel G.
Reviews.Content: I always thought that i didn't like italian food, that was before I tried Giacomo's.  Giacomos was one of the best dining experiences I have ever had, I cannot ever recall having better italian food. Just be sure to show up earlier if you don't want to wait

Reviews.Author: Annie K.
Reviews.Content: This place is a tiny tiny very very  popular restaurant. *sigh* if only they could expand...Even on a Tuesday night they had a line of people outside waiting to get seated! Luckily for my friends and I, we made it in just before the dinner rush. If you're willing to wait in line--the food is worth the wait. WARNING!!! This place is CASH ONLY.So the food is ridiculously amazing!!! Calamari is fried up with jalapenos and red peppers which just makes it even more delicious. Not over chewy or cooked at all. I ordered the homemade fusili with lobster meat and shrimp with a combination of the giacomo and fra diavolo sauce. One friend ordered the mussels and calamari over linguine with giacomo sauce. The other friend ordered the lobster ravioli. My pasta was sooo fresh and delicious mixed in with the chunks of lobster meat was sooooo good! I loved the sauce with the creamy tomato mix and because it was mixed with the fra diavolo sauce it had a little spice to it!! LOVED IT!!The lobster ravioli was AMAZING!! The white cream sauce that they used was delicious and perfectly paired with the ravioli. Just a delicious plate which she cleaned up very well with some bread. =)The mussels and calamari in linguine was okay...my friend liked it alot, though he said the calamari got a little chewy. But he thinks it was because it probably still got cooked via the heat from the pasta. Overall we all LOVED LOVED our meals! And though the service was a little brusque, they did well at the beginning and when they want you to get ready to leave, they will stop refilling your water and try to clear off your table as soon as a plate gets done. But that is to be expected at this restaurant. You want to leisurely eat a meal....don't come here unless you expect it to be absolutely empty with no line of people outside the door staring at you to finish your food. Be considerate of the poor people who have been standing outside in the cold just so they can grab a yummy delicious meal too!

Reviews.Author: Michelle D.
Reviews.Content: Had such good reviews and a line out the door, so I  have to admit  I was intrigued. I had the pumpkin tortellini and my fiancé had the mushroom ravioli. Both were really good!!!  We also had the sautéed broccoli and garlic bread... Also yummy!!!  The service was great as well. Two warnings however... Portions are huge.... you can definitely  share a meal,  and this isn't a place to go if you want to have a long relaxing dinner,  food comes out very quickly... I think we were in and out in less than a hour. But in terms of value... It doesn't get much better.

Reviews.Author: Heather C.
Reviews.Content: Our venture to Giacomo's was based on the promise that the food here would be almost as good as the food we ate in Italy. Well, Giacomo's exceed this expectation as the food here was better than much of the food we ate in Venice and Bellagio.As out-of-towners, it was a fun and delicious experience and if we're ever back I would love to go again.The wait can be a bit frustrating, especially when you have a couple so apprehensive that someone might cut in front of them that they literally plaster themselves against your backs, as we had. Come prepared for the wait with a box of cookies from Modern Pastry or Mike's and you can drown your frustration in sugary goodness (just don't ruin your appetite).

Reviews.Author: Chantal Y.
Reviews.Content: Long wait but it's worth it.  Very good pastas and seafood.  The fried calamari was excellent.  You choose the seafood or meat, the pasta and the sauce.  Fast service and decent price.

Reviews.Author: Laura B.
Reviews.Content: The reviews led me in the right direction! The restaurant was quaint, the service attentive and the food superb! A must visit next time I am back in Boston for the Butternut Squash Ravioli!

Reviews.Author: Kendall C.
Reviews.Content: Everything we ordered at our table was amazing.

Reviews.Author: Peanut K.
Reviews.Content: The most delicious Italian food ever!  We had the fried calamaries with peppers, So delicious.  I had the frutie di mar and my husband had the lobster ravioli. It is so worth the wait in the freezing cold.

Reviews.Author: Davis Y.
Reviews.Content: Cash only!  Found out at the end of the meal.  Frutti di mare was delicious.  Great little restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Ruby O.
Reviews.Content: Great service and the food was excellent! But the place was to cramped and there might be really long line before you can step foot inside the door but my friend said it was worth it and I agree with her.

Reviews.Author: Christina C.
Reviews.Content: One word: D-Lish!! This tiny little restaurant puts out some great Italian dishes for very reasonable prices. Be ready to stand in a short line OUTSIDE (take note of the temperature before heading out...brrrr), but once you're "in", it's like heaven. Loved the grilled salmon over smoked seafood risotto....love, love, love! Everyone else loved their dishes as well. They raved about the butternut squash ravioli. Just go!

Reviews.Author: Belle F.
Reviews.Content: I have wanted to try this restaurant for years, but inevitably, there was always a line.  90 degree heat, subzero temps, pouring rain, doesn't matter, there will be a line! Well last night we were finally able to try Giacomo's since we hit the timing right and had no wait...line started about 20 minutes after we were seated. Having finally eaten there, now I know what the fuss is all about.  You cannot beat the food or the prices! Menu is heavily seafood based, but there are non-seafood options.  We split a fried calamari appetizer, which is some of the best calamari I had anyplace.  For dinner we each had a special: I had the half lobster/clams/mussels special over linguine with the scampi sauce which was pretty good, and my husband had the homemade fusilli, lobster and shrimp in the Giacomo sauce (red sauce with a hint of bechamel cream) which was to die for.Price for two people for an appetizer, two specials, two beers and a glass of wine?  Around $60 before tip!  Nowhere in the North End will you get a meal that good for that cheap!As others have said, either eat early or late, or during the week (we showed up at a quarter to six on a Monday with no wait, but  when we left shortly before eight, there were about 15 people in line  outside).  Otherwise, be prepared for a wait on the weekends!  Also, no credit cards - its cash only.

Reviews.Author: Joanna C.
Reviews.Content: Why another review? Because I want to. AND, I also want to recommend the South End location over this North End establishment if you're looking to get away from the tourists and just want a good meal. The food, of course, is delicious. The wait to get in ranges from horrendously round-the-block to a quick shuffle to the front door. Service is loud, friendly, fast and fun. Apparently there is an older gentlewoman (owner? manager?) that some have described as "spicy" in demeanor - but I find her comfortably blunt, like one of my cantankerous aunts. Try everything - but I would recommend...Calamari: fried to perfection with a jalapeno kickFrutti di Mare: everything that's good about the sea is in here (shrimp, scallops, calamari, clams and mussels) on top of linguine, stick with the Giacomo sauce (lobster broth-based). OR, try the FraComo which is a blend of the house Giacomo sauce with Fra Diavolo (gives it an extra kick)Butternut Squash Ravioli: sweet, creamy pillows of YUM with asparagus. The proscuitto mascarpone sauce is a perfect complement.Lobster Special for 2 aka Zuppa di Pesce : it can feed a family of 4, basically the Frutti di Mare times 2 with lobster on topTry it all with their birra italiana.

Reviews.Author: Kimberly R.
Reviews.Content: Don't let the line fool you, it's definitely worth the wait!! Best butternut squash I've had, and the calamari is amazing!

Reviews.Author: Chris H.
Reviews.Content: First up, cash only. Wait out on sidewalk was about an hour for one of only about a dozen tables. So that + Yelp had us excited. The calamari and garlic bread appetizers were delicious.  My 17 year old son said his tuna and swordfish fettuccine with pesto was the best thing he'd EVER eaten. Unfortunately, my wife and I did not have the same experience. My butternut squash ravioli was too sweet for my taste, and her lobster fusilli special was not good at all. The noodles was too al dente and the lobster chunks were rubbery. So we found it hit and miss. Good luck.

Reviews.Author: Judith S.
Reviews.Content: I love this place, great food, super affordable wine...awesome!

Reviews.Author: Joanna L.
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite restaurants in Boston, and without a doubt the best italian.Heads up:  Cash only!  Biggest downside,The North End location is definitely better than the South End.  Pasta is fresh, and the Giacomo's special sauce is the tastiest red sauce on the eastern seaboard.  Hints of lobster and red wine with bechamel combine to make the most original but memorable dish - I recommend getting it with the fusilli.  Appetizers are also good, but the real stars are on the entree list.  If you're walking by in the North End and there's a line at the door, believe me - it's worth it to get in line.

Reviews.Author: Werner S.
Reviews.Content: We decided to get there early for the 4:30 opening and had to wait about 15 minutes.By the time we were seated, the line was already to the end of the block. I had a special: 1/2 lobster, clams, mussels over linguine in the Giacomo sauce. My wife had another special of homemade fusilli with shrimp & lobster in a Giacomo sauce. Bothe meals were good but not outstanding. The lobster meat in both dishes was pretty tough and not sweet. Almost like it was not fresh. As others have noted this place is small, you are sitting elbows to elbows with others and the waiters are constantly squeezing behind you and jostling you. The place is noisy and you get the feeling that you are being rushed. Our appetizer came out before the wine was served. I don't see what the fuss is about at this restaurant and why people would wait in line for an hour or more to eat there. There is a much better place (Panza's) across the street. No lines, better food and service and quiet.

Reviews.Author: Ji C.
Reviews.Content: I was on a quick trip to Boston. I saw the reviews on help and checked it. Long line, but once you get seated, it's all worth it. Calamari= best that I have had. Ordered a couple of different pastas and all were DELICIOUS. It's worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: Matt S.
Reviews.Content: Good food, mediocre service. Their goal is to get as many people through the door as possible.

Reviews.Author: Lauren H.
Reviews.Content: Skip the line and go around the corner to Maurizio's.

Reviews.Author: Luke T.
Reviews.Content: Really good food at a good price.  Had the sea bass and it was cooked perfectly.  The place is cramped and there is not much room to move around.  The wine is $17 and is pretty much the same as the two buck chuck wine you get at Trader Joes.

Reviews.Author: dan h.
Reviews.Content: now this is what i'm talking about.  seems that this spot richly deserves the strong reviews that it already has.  i don't always like to go to 5-star high end expensive restaurants. sometimes you just gotta go to a spot with 'character'. and this place has loads of character.  cash only. no reservations.  not even a LIST. you literally just have to wait outside to be seated and if there's a table available, they just lean outside and drag someone in. they also don't even serve dessert, which i thought was weird, but it's probably more the rule in this area of boston than the exception. i'm sure the cafe's have some sort of cooperative agreement with the restaurants to share the business. the restaurants don't serve dessert or coffee to drive business to the cafes and the cafe's don't serve hot food to drive people to the restaurants. the restaurants turn their tables over faster so it's not a major loss to them and everyone is happy.  we got the house special which is a ton of seafood draped on top of a bed of linguini. you can choose any one of 5-6 sauces, you get a bottle of wine for an extra 10 bucks (the bottles are all 17 dollars so it saves you 7).  the lobster, mussels, clams, and scallops are awesome. the linguini is stellar. the wine is not bad - matter of fact it's AMAZING for $10.  i say this remembering that darned $60 glass of champagne i had at The Villa in miami, that's right, i said "glass".  anyway, service is awesome. the waiter does not play the role of the rude italian waiter because he's got a line of people waiting outside to take your place if you want to leave. he's cool. food comes fast and well done. even with a million or two other places to try on my next visit to boston, i would be tempted to go here again.  but again, given the gazillion strong reviews for this place, i'm not telling you anything you don't already know.

Reviews.Author: Nelson C.
Reviews.Content: Best bargain in the north end but the line is hard to deal with on a date! The food is great but it is very cramped! Because of these things I give it 4 instead of 5!

Reviews.Author: Tamika H.
Reviews.Content: Best Italian food I ever had in my life.  It is well worth the 1+ hour wait in line.  The calamari is delicious.

Reviews.Author: Beth R.
Reviews.Content: Giacomo's almost always has a long wait...know why?  To put it in simpler terms, their food is bomb!  We waited for well over an hour & 1/2 one night but I don't complain, especially when one of Giacomo's delicious entrees is sitting in front of me on the table.  They really do move the line as quick as they can, the waitresses move at lightning fast speed & in return, sweat their asses off.  They are speedy in getting your water glasses filled & drink order taken right when you sit down.  The restaurant itself is quaint but cozy, not much to it really, it's very "North End".  They have quite an extensive Specials Menu on the wall's chalkboard.  By the time you get inside, you'll probably have to use the bathroom.  Word of caution: it's located downstairs, the bathroom is tiny & you will be hot hot hot!  They say heat rises but they haven't been in Giacomo's basement!  Everything on the menu is delicious, especially the spicy sauce that I love the most...fra diavlo or arrabiata?...I forget, but it rocks my socks.  Remember, cash only.

Reviews.Author: Ryan K.
Reviews.Content: Tasty, lots of seafood options, and not expensive.  It's pretty loud and crowded inside, which is fine with me, but maybe not for everyone.

Reviews.Author: chungo m.
Reviews.Content: some of the best Italian in the North End and  good prices.reason for one star getting nocked off?cash only, small,  and It's busy, so plan ahead.

Reviews.Author: Bo F.
Reviews.Content: Best Italian food I've ever had. Long wait outside if it's a weekend evening but not bad at all on weekdays. Amazing fried calamari and amazing sauces (the best one is the spicy lobster sauce, i forgot what it's called). Very cozy (only 6 or so tables). You MUST go there if you're in the North End.

Reviews.Author: Andrew P.
Reviews.Content: I shouldn't be writing this because I am tired of standing in the ever growing line in front of Giacomo's but this place deserves this review. You simply cannot beat Giacomo's if you are looking for terrific sauces and fresh seafood. The garlic bread is great too! Don't come here if you are on a diet. They give you a ton of food and it is soo good that you will want to eat it all. The only down side is they want you in and out. Don't expect to "dine" here. Eat your food and take a walk down the street for a cannoli!

Reviews.Author: Victor C.
Reviews.Content: One of the best italian restaurants in the city. Be prepared to wait about 45 mins for a table.  Located in the North End, it is nestled right across from the famous Mike's Pastry. My favorite dish is their clam linguine(good portion). The lobster ravioli is also worth ordering(moderate portion). For starters, their fried calamari is a good appetizer. But you cannot really go wrong with any of their dishes since I always see the patrons leaving with smile on their faces.  Dining room is kind of cramped.  They only take cash!

Reviews.Author: Joyce T.
Reviews.Content: Fra Diavol sauce, mmmmmm!  The butternut squash ravioli is to die for.  The fra diablo lobster pasta was amazing.  Wait is usually long but of course, my first time was during a little snowstorm so the staff was really friendly and let us in to look at the menu.  Service is quick, but helpful and down to earth.  Great place for awesome Italian food, not really for ambience (in and out!).  Fresh, home made Italian amazingness. (minus one star only for ambience sake)

Reviews.Author: sammy k.
Reviews.Content: me and a few friends checked this place out. the wait went by relatively quickly with the good company. i order the seafood pasta dish with the giacomo's sauce. the sauce was good and the pasta was cooked al dente. i was disappointed with the mussels and clams.... they were tiny and the scallops were overcooked. we did order the large calimari as an appetizer and was not disappointed at all with that. it was good and if i was to go there again i would definitely reorder that.the service was good. our waitress was really nice and explained the specials and checked in on us. i did go a little while without a refill on my water. there was a waiter there that seemed like he was trying to rush us out though..i would say that i would rather go to artichokes in malden for italian even though it's a little out of the way.

Reviews.Author: T M.
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome!  Was visiting from out of town and a friend from Boston recommended the spot.  Good times.  Service top notch, food excellent, and prices extremely reasonable.Our waitress was great.  It was almost like having a food consultant very helpful and felt like she was trying to optimize what we were ordering almost as if she was ordering for herself.  The sauce here rox!  We had one of the specials which was like a lobster pasta with two different sauces mixed, don't remember which, but really good.Huge fan of this place, just wish it wasn't on the other side of the country.

Reviews.Author: B M.
Reviews.Content: The quality of the restaurant is great. Food is great and service is wonderful. The place is a bit small, but cozy. During winter times, you have to wait outside. But, the food will make up the difference. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Author: Mitzi Y.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite Italian restaurant anywhere!The seafood is fantastic!!  Highlights include the calamari, which is never greasy and always tasty, and anything covered with Giacomo's signature sauce.This place is definitely worth the wait!  (However, if you can't wait or need to make reservations, they do have a second location that takes reservations... but it isn't in the North End so you don't get the COMPLETE Italian experience)

Reviews.Author: Adam K.
Reviews.Content: The food is great, the service is... as to be expected in a place with such small seating and a huge line outside.  It would be a 5, except for the line.  Today I got my veal parmagiana, which was great as usual.  Friend got the coveted Butternut Squash Ravioli and I tried a bit and agreed, it is fantastic.  We also got the fried calamari and it was superb as usual.  This was my 3rd time there, and all have been great, except for the line.  Today's wait was approx 45mins.

Reviews.Author: Kerry G.
Reviews.Content: I love this little place! The last time I was there...two weeks ago,  I had an affordable bottle of Jacobs Creek Shiraz ($16) accompanied by the best antipasto platter I have ever had! The peppers were marinated just right and it was delicious.  As usual I had  the  the butternut  squash raviolis and my server was quick to yell out my order as he had recognized me before. Our neighbors  were very new to the Giacomo experience but I  told them  everything they ordered would be superb. Although  very stuffed, I was able to walk across the street to Mikes Pastry and devour a cannoli. I can't wait to return to Giacomo's... the line may seem scary but  it moves quick. Best for party's of 2...they will find a corner for you.

Reviews.Author: Uland L.
Reviews.Content: Came to Boston on business and saw the reviews for this place on yelp. A small Italian restaurant in North End of Boston, this place has a rustic feel with a variety of pasta dishes. Their special, lobster with their home-made pasta ($26), had one of the best Italian pasta I've ever tasted. Cooked to perfection with a slightly spicy tomato sauce, and plenty of hearty chunks of lobster. the portion was more than enough for single person. Other orders, such as the mussels and cooked vegetable dishes are cheaper (~$10-15) but still make great appetizers. For dinner, this place gets very crowded. I came here twice on two separate business trips, and both times the place is packed up until closing. Be sure to get there at least 15 minutes before closing, when the place is full, the restaurant will turn down customers. Overall, when in the city of Boston, this is a much recommended stop.

Reviews.Author: Caitlin H.
Reviews.Content: I'd say any restaurant where the waitress calls you "sweetie" and the waiters brings you extra bread without you asking receives a preliminary 4-stars in my book. Giacomo's is what everyone says it is- small, cozy, crowded, line-out-the-door, and great food. I took a previous yelper's suggestion and had the summer squash ravioli, which was quite delicious. The sauce was good enough that it simply needed to be mopped up with the extra bread that was brought to the table. My dining buddy had pesto pasta with clams- another simple, yet very tasty dish. All-around- great environment, good service, solid Italian/seafood dishes and just a quick dash away from dessert, waiting at Mike's Pastries!

Reviews.Author: Andy M.
Reviews.Content: Food was awesome. We ordered two bottles of wine from the friendly waitress and they were only 15 dollars each. Not bad for the North End. Waited in line for about 20 minutes, but the whole experience was well worth the wait. (The fried calamari was a little rubbery. Try Carlos Cucina Italiana for good fried calimari.

Reviews.Author: Susan B.
Reviews.Content: After reading rave reviews on this place, four of us picked it for our dinner in Boston.  Here is the real scoop - food was good, not great.  Prices were good. Atmosphere, which for me is a big part of the equation, was awful.  Teeny place, tables crowded together,  and I do mean CROWDED, plates and crockery !banging! noisely in the kitchen which is open to the dining area, music awful and blaring.  Waitstaff helpful and at least had a sense of humor, but I won't go back.  Surely there's better food and a better atmosphere in the North End!

Reviews.Author: Anne K.
Reviews.Content: This place is over rated. We did the wait (why? I hate waiting) and even though we arrived 10 minutes to opening at 5 we missed the first seating and had to wait 30 minutes to get in. Just so you know, this place is tiny and cramped and most likely you will be sitting at the same table as some other people. Also they rush you in and out- there is no coffee/dessert etc. This is a place you come to just hurry up and eat.The people behind us said they come all the time and it was worth the wait. I was inclined to leave and go to Il Paninos down the street...but this place was less expensive so I figured why not. I was expecting heaven...not exactly what we were served.The glasses of house wine were so-so. The caprese salad was not outstanding at all. The calamari was pretty good. I hated my dish with  a passion not rivaled in recent history- the vegetarian pumpkin tortellini in a sage cream sauce. Now from the get go I should have gone with the salmon but usually I love the sage sauce. This was rich, tasteless, and all around poison. I really didn't enjoy it if you didn't already get this. The portions were huge too which I can't stand when you get a moundful of pasta and nothing else with it. It is just the best way to feel like crap the rest of the night. Yes, I should have known better.My companion got the seafood with fra diavolo and linguini. It was good, sauce was spicy, but he really loved the one at Il Panino more! Much better.The waitress we had was not too good either. She was fast but didn't explain the menu or the specials like the other we waiter we overheard (we had waiter -envy!) That being said, I was annoyed we waited in line, even if cheaper than other places not much cheaper, food was so-so. Perhaps I should try it again given the great reviews, but I'm not inclined to wait in line and be shoved into a sardine can. So if you want to try this place, I would come at 4:30, and get anything but those cream sauces. Also maybe split a bottle of wine might be better than the glasses.

Reviews.Author: Lauren S.
Reviews.Content: One of my staple eateries in the North End.Good points:Great food, huge portions and reasonable prices. Really reasonable prices. The specials are always delicious.Whatever the special is ... order it. Other favorites ... my friend has been a number of times and never orders anything but the butternut squash ravioli. Dee-lish.Garlic bread cooked in a broiler is super buttery and crisp.Bad points:Be prepared to wait. For a while. Like an hour.But really, it's usually worth the wait. If you have the time, and don't mind spending an hour in line talking ... give it a shot.Sadly, they are not too fond of long, relaxing dinners with friends.  They are pushy and want to turn over tables fast.  Went here for my birthday and waited in the rain for an hour only to be rushed out while I was still eating my entree...very disappointing!Cash only.Overall:The food is superb.  The service is pushy.  The wait is long.  The prices are the best in the North End.  The restaurant is really too small for the amount of patrons they serve, so be prepared to share a table with a stranger.  The good outweighs the bad, the food really is GREAT.

Reviews.Author: Leo B.
Reviews.Content: Solid. Rock solid. I've been here a handful of times and Giacomo's never disappoints. The food is excellent. The service is good. It's small and kind of cramped. So, don't expect to relax on a chaise lounge while you sip wine and eat crumpets.

Reviews.Author: Miranda B.
Reviews.Content: I came here for the first time in February.  What an experience to get in a line about 20 min before a restaurant even opens in freezing, windy Boston weather.  Even pitiful looks to the waiters didn't get the door to open minutes before 5pm.  But once inside, we were greeted by Giacomo himself and shown to a cozy corner table.  The menu's written on chalk boards around the restaurant, and I went with the butternut squash ravioli.  It was amazing!  Just the right amount of sweetness for a still savory entree, and the asparagus mixed in was cooked perfectly.  Definitely worth the chilly wait!

Reviews.Author: Sarah C.
Reviews.Content: I am actually knocking it down a star for not having lasagna or cannelloni on the menu. Adding a few more dishes to the menu would give some more non-seafood options.However, it is a great Italian seafood place (it has a shell above the doorway--our fault really for not realizing).We stood in line for about a half hour for a table in the teensy restaurant, which was hectic and squished but charming. At Giacomo's they mostly feature linguine and sea food and a set of signature sauces that you choose from. So it's a great mix and match system. They will even blend the sauces for you if you ask. Their fra diavolo with scallops and shrimp was spot on.

Reviews.Author: Tess G.
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this restaurant for sure! The atmosphere is cozy and comfortable yet it was packed at the same time. There were 5 of us and all our dishes were delicious!From Chicago and would definitely go back again!

Reviews.Author: Efrain O.
Reviews.Content: fantastic place, the food is wonderful, always fresh pasta, gotta order the Diavlo sauce, its the best!   Make sure you get there early to avoid the lines.

Reviews.Author: Jon C.
Reviews.Content: You need to get to this place almost before it opens.  There are no reservations, but well known to have awesome food for inexpensive.  We had the Lobster and Butternut squash raviolis which were to die for.  Its not a place to go and be romantic, but it you like a restaurant bustle, with awesome food at a reasonable price, this is it.  its not a 2 hr event either, you have food up in no time.. we were in and out in 45 min and had time for a wine tasting down the street!

Reviews.Author: Lee M.
Reviews.Content: Waited in line for 1 hour or so, no big deal.  Anywhere you have to wait in line that long is a good sign that the food is exceptional.  My suspicions were correct as the food was dynamite.  Caesar salad cold, hearty and super fresh.  Seafood was on point.  My colleagues split the $50 entree with probably 8 different types of seafood.  Took a picture and show it to people telling them I ate it all.  Not true!  Here's the best part.  The wine list.  All bottles are $15, granted you're not drinking Screaming Eagle, but how can you not love eating in a restaurant and being able to order multiple bottles of wine.  Between the six of us we drank 7 bottles.  Partner this all up with a great table by the window and it was an all around awesome evening.

Reviews.Author: Jackie G.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE Giacamos.  I am italian and this place is yummmy.  The seafood, pasta, everything is perfect.  It is such a tiny place and there is always a line, but defintely worth the wait.  If I could choose I'd eat here every night!  The owners and servers are always polite and friendly.

Reviews.Author: Corwin P.
Reviews.Content: My first 5 since joining yelp. This place is absolutely absurd from the $16 bottles of wine to the perfectly fried calamari (with delicious cherry peppers) I went for the special fusilli with lobster and shrimp and got both lobster based sauces- insanity.. so rich and served hot with big chucks of lobster and shrimp.. dinning partners had scallops and shrimp with red sauce and the legendary lobster ravioli- both were worth tasting on an empty stomach... if you are ever lucky enough to go here wait in the line and know what's at the end is truly worth it...

Reviews.Author: Bill B.
Reviews.Content: Giacomo's is an abosolutely amazing culinary experience that makes you feel more like you are in Italy than America.  We started off with an appetizer of broccoli in garlic and oil which was loaded with enough minced garlic and plenty of wonderful olive oil to sponge up with bread.  The broccoli tasted as if it had been steamed in olive oil and was magnificent.  For dinner I had lobster ravioli with cream sauce which was mouth watering good.  We went on a Thursday night around 6 and were seated right away.  The wait staff were quite entertaining, the food came quickly and the ambience was great.  We shared a bottle of wine which of course only made the experience more enjoyable.  The only downside was that it's not a place where you sit afterwards and enjoy some conversation and coffee.  They want you out of their quickly as there was a line when we left.  Our table was reset before we even got to the door.  But I wouldn't worry about that there are plenty of places for dessert!Giacomo's is a truly amazing experience that I personally am glad I didn't miss!

Reviews.Author: N. C.
Reviews.Content: Yes, the line is worth the wait.  This is by far my favorite Italian restaurant of all time.  I've lived near the North End for 6 years and have tried almost every other Italian restaurant and always go back to Giacamo's.  I know some complain about the staff but they are simply trying to move you along to give others the opportunity to dine.  My favorites: calamari, caprese salad,  linguini with lobster and their house sauce (ask for their spicy house sauce if you like spicy food).

Reviews.Author: Morgan P.
Reviews.Content: Loved the food, loved the experience. I highly recommend the Fra Diavolo sauce on anything you order, it was amazing. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the food comes very quick. The secret is to go for dinner on a weekday, we walked straight in and sat down with no wait

Reviews.Author: Jolene B.
Reviews.Content: Amazing and worth the wait in the rain.  Good food, service, and price.  Need bigger space!

Reviews.Author: Cerenity C.
Reviews.Content: You know what? It was fun lining up around the block to squeeze into a table at this place. We witnessed an impromptu street parade and I even got sent on a pastry recon mission to Mike's while my friend's held my spot in line. The food was better than the Italian places I tried when visiting NYC.

Reviews.Author: Dan J.
Reviews.Content: This was great.  Service was unreal. Food was amazing.  Time goes fast in line if your having a conversation.  Great atmosphere in and out.  Just a top notch establishment.  Crushed the parking authorities, no ticket.  Bread, salad, bottle 2 entrees wholly wholly.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth T.
Reviews.Content: Pasta was good (fettucine, ravioli), sauces (giacomo, fra diavolo) were great, and service was excellent.

Reviews.Author: Lesley R.
Reviews.Content: Nice little place.  Read the reviews and got there just before 5:00 and no line.  Prices very reasonable.  Loved the shrimp and scallops linguine scampi.  Want to go back!

Reviews.Author: Rodrigo S.
Reviews.Content: Already reviewed once as excellent... Continues to impress... Wine is amazingly well priced and paired really well with the lobster ravioli!

Reviews.Author: Bill R.
Reviews.Content: Great Food. Great Price. Great service. Great Atmosphere... but don't forget to bring CASH. No CREDIT CARDS!  I guess I'm just slightly annoyed by restaurants that don't take cards. What's up with this?  There is nothing more embarrassing than to invite a group of family and friends out to dinner and then not be able to pay!  I was visiting from Ohio and had to borrow money to pay the bill.  Reviews like this are always difficult because, other than the credit card embarrassment... it was great.  If they won't take cards, maybe they could do a better job of warning customers before it's time to pay the bill.

Reviews.Author: lauren f.
Reviews.Content: I liked this place alot.   Cant' give it 5 stars because it is sooo cramped.  It is certainly a 5 star for value though.  The wine is very good and at a great price, well under $20.00 for a bottle.  The grilled vegetables that accompany the fish dishes were spectacular.  I wasn't that crazy about the red sauce... a little too sweet for my taste.  If you walk by and there isn't a line... eat here, but bring cash.  Service is very efficient, friendly but quick.

Reviews.Author: Jie D.
Reviews.Content: I went there when my friend visited me in town! So good! We ordered the lobster pasta with a bottle of wine! The best place in northe end!

Reviews.Author: Alicia B.
Reviews.Content: The chicken and broccoli pasta in garlic sauce was to die for. I literally told my friend that if I knew I would die tomorrow, I would ask for this dish to be my last meal. It changed my life! :)

Reviews.Author: Joe R.
Reviews.Content: This place wins my award for the most over rated Yelp review I have ever seen.I will say this - the food is good and is very very affordable which I am sure is a big part of why this place has the rating is does.  That said the food is good but not great.  It's very standard fair.  I had the gnochi in bolognese sauce - it was unmemorable.The thing that really really pissed me off was the ridiculous seating situation.  I spent the majority of my time moving my chair out of the way of either other patrons or the waitress so they could squeeze behind me.I will DEFINITELY never spend another dollar in this place.There are too many better options in the North End with better food at only slightly higher prices where I won't have to spend my entire meal moving my chair for the waitress.

Reviews.Author: Mike K.
Reviews.Content: Waited outside for 1-1/2 hours. From the minute we finally got in it was like a whirlwind. I felt like I was in the episode of Seinfeld with the "soup nazi". We had calamari and mussels apps. Fruiti di mare and butternut squash ravioli was the main coarse.Worth the wait. After the 1-1/2 hr wait, we ate and were out of there in 40min. Great Italian food, great prices this is a place to get in and out FAST(I mean once your actually in there). We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Author: Ronald S.
Reviews.Content: This is for the Back Bay Giacomo's on Columbia Ave. (which takes reservations).Awesome food, super service and very reasonable prices (cash only) in a fun environment.Don't even think about dessert -- you'll be stuffed by the ample appetizer and entree portions.

Reviews.Author: Frederick O.
Reviews.Content: Nice small Italian restaurant in the North End.  The butternut ravioli are the best!

Reviews.Author: Lee B.
Reviews.Content: It lives up to the hype.  Great food.  And fat service.  Don't let the wait deter you.  They turn the tables quickly and you will not wait too long.  I had the chicken parm and it was quite tasty.  My wife had the shrimp linguine with the garlic cream sauce.  She ate it all.  We stared with the caprese salad and had a side of garlic bread.  Yum.  It you have the chance you will want to eat here.

Reviews.Author: david r.
Reviews.Content: the only aspects which prevent this from getting a full five stars is the fact there is always a line outside and they don't take cards, only cash.i like the frutti di mare with a mix of fra diavolo sauce and giacomo sauce. sublime. with extra parmesan please.

Reviews.Author: Markus H.
Reviews.Content: Giacomos has been one of my favourites in Boston for Italian food. The pasta is done well, in stark contrast to so many other establishments - al dente as it should be. Any pasta dish with the the famouse Giacomos sauce is revommended and a good value for money.
