The bread is also good, which for people not on a non carb diet is a plus.If you are looking for solid Italian with a down to earth ambiance, then G is a great choice. I have been going there for 10 years and have never been disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Brooke C.
Reviews.Content: Tastes good every time. If you don't mind the wait, and the type of place (small, rushed, etc). I can't get enough of their food.

Reviews.Author: Nina H.
Reviews.Content: Hey- I was one of all of you as well - 4.5 star rating - until a few months ago..... To make is short and sweet.. I ordered my usual favorite pasta... I think chicken and Broccoli in alfredo.. but this time I packed leftovers ......The next day I warmed it up in the microwave. There was like an inch layer of buttern on top....... it literally had like two cups of butter in it.. not even kidding.. it was such a turn off :( .. no wonder all of their food tastes so good.... Just sayin'

Reviews.Author: Ling J.
Reviews.Content: Great food!!!!

Reviews.Author: Patrick T.
Reviews.Content: Can't miss spot. Excellent food. Calamari was very good. The giacomo sauce is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Author: Mike H.
Reviews.Content: Just had a disappointing meal at Giacomo's.  After waiting about 30 min out in the cold, we were quickly wisked to our seats. When our dishes came, we did not like the fact that we were rushed to make room on the table.  Also we were not greeted as the table next to us.     Now the food... The best dish we had was the fried calamari.  In my opinion , it tasted better than the same offering at the Daily Catch down the street.  However, that was it. The remaining 4 dishes were not impressive. We ordered Frutti de Mare in Fra Diavolo sauce, shrimp and clams linguini in fracomo sauce, lobster and shrimp fusilli in Giacomo sauce, and lobster ravioli in garlic sauce.  None of these dishes met my expectations, having done my homework on yelp.  I had way better dishes from The Daily Catch, which had  more flavorful pastas.  The food simply does not deserve the long wait, except for the calamari.        Also my wife adds that dishes were twice removed from her even though they were not finished yet.      I do not think I am coming back again.

Reviews.Author: Kana S.
Reviews.Content: amazing. the end.

Reviews.Author: Brad J.
Reviews.Content: I typically go to Giacomo's on Hanover when I am in Boston.  The seafood and pasta are consistently good, and the meals are worth the wait, which can be close to an hour some nights.The beer and wine selections are limited, and they don't take credit cards.  The prices are very reasonable and the service friendly, if not somewhat harried due to the crowds.I would recommend Giacomo's.

Reviews.Author: Gina P.
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, excellent food...what more can I say!

Reviews.Author: Annie B.
Reviews.Content: Worth the wait! We arrived around 5:30 on a Friday and it took about an hour to be seated. Very small restaurant, but as far as Italian food goes, one of the best I've had. The calamari was delicious. Entrees were hot and made to order. If you're in the North End and looking for good Italian- this is the place!

Reviews.Author: Jeff S.
Reviews.Content: Might have given 5 stars but skeptical that the 45 min wait was worthwhile instead of trying one of the other Italian restaurants in Boston's North End. It is small but has seating fror about 30-40 at 12 tables (not 3 tables as some reviews have commented). The place is crowded; in fact, we were seated at the counter overlooking the small but busy kitchen. Kinda interesting, but a bit too much in the thick of things, if you know what I mean. Service was very fast but really didn't feel rushed. Based in part on prior reviews, we had their garlic bread (very good, unusual with a bit of cheese on top as well), one of their fettuccini dishes with chicken, peppers, in a waitress-recommended blend of 2 of their spicier tomato sauces, and one of their daily specials which was a fusilli dish with shrimp, lobster, and scallops. All was great. Since they don't serve dessert, we took the suggestion of another reviewer and went to Mike's Bakery 1/2 a block away for some great cannolli. Remember: no credit cards!

Reviews.Author: Mac C.
Reviews.Content: Love it!

Reviews.Author: Melissa C.
Reviews.Content: Love this place! Yes you will wait outside...even on a Tuesday ...in the rain. But there's a reason there is a line down the block waiting to get in, great food at great prices. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Author: Elvira C.
Reviews.Content: I came here with a friend, because we were looking up north end italian restaurants and Giacomo's got the best rating. It is nice food, but definitely overrated.The garlic bread was ok, but I wasn't really impressed and it wasn't uniquely good.I had pasta with mussels in the garlic-based sauce and a glass if white wine. When people say you can never mess up mussels with garlic, this is certainly the case. But it is neither a dish to impress others. My friend had the lobster and tomato-based spicy sauce (I believe it was Giacomo sauce), I think it was tastier.The menu is helpful, as it has the description of the sauce in the back. The it was crowded and loud. The service was not good and they try to rush you as the line outside is long.Also, though the restaurant opens at 5, they let people in earlier. So there is already a line right at 5.

Reviews.Author: Rachel S.
Reviews.Content: Price, service, and food considered...5 giant stars.  Even though there was a wait, it was worth it.  The squash tortellini...to die for.

Reviews.Author: Ami C.
Reviews.Content: The Spaghetti for two was amazing!

Reviews.Author: Gary S.
Reviews.Content: Giacomo's Restaurant in Boston's North End is one of the best Italian restaurants I have ever eaten in.  We were visiting from England last June and were staying on Hanover Street in an apartment, we saw all the people lining up outside the restaurant & thought it must have something going for it!  Well we waited in line for almost an hour from 8 - 9pm.  We were wondering if the food would live up to the wait!  Well it did in spades!  Fantastic food, great service and what fantastic prices, even the wine was only $16 a bottle.  I do not believe you can eat better Italian food for that price anywhere else in Boston or even NYC. It was so good we eat there twice before leaving Boston.We are visiting Boston again this October and will be eating again at Giacomo's Restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Karen T.
Reviews.Content: Meh. We had a table of five, with apps and mains. Most of the food's fine, but nothing that knocks my socks off. The service is brisk and brusque, but I know that's their schtick so it's OK. Just pay attention and don't be afraid to ask server to repeat or leave your plate alone if you're not finished. It's not a stand out place to me. I kind of don't get what all the hype is about.

Reviews.Author: Tony L.
Reviews.Content: This place has ruined my appetite for Italian food in Seattle!  I was here over the summer and after seeing the lines, I decided I had to come here.  I wish I had known about the one in the south end, but it was worth the wait.  I can't wait to be back again!

Reviews.Author: Sam J.
Reviews.Content: Overrated.We expected a long wait time & we did wait long.The food was definetely overrated.The waiter was okay( I guess he was the owner,but we felt neglected.)Was not a very good experience.. No bread to start.(cmon....)Did people say this place was cheap???One more thing, I had a bad stomach upset the next day.Im not dissing the restaurant, all these people with great reviews and all but Im not a fan & wont go again..Maybe it had something with us  being of color... i dont know.Guess you dont know till ya go.

Reviews.Author: Brian M.
Reviews.Content: I went to Giacomo's the first night I was ever in Boston.  What a way to start!!  Since it was a Wednesday night, there wasn't too much of a wait.  I would say we waited about 30 minutes when we got there around 8:30.  I was there with someone who had been there many times.  He ordered calamari for the table to start.  I ordered the lobster ravioli, and it was WONDERFUL!  This is hands down one of the best places I have ever been.

Reviews.Author: Ellen R.
Reviews.Content: Linguine fra diavlo was SO GOOD. Spicy and delicious. Not a bad meal on the menu.

Reviews.Author: David R.
Reviews.Content: Giacomo's (in the South End) is delicious. While it's a little crowded, it makes for a great meal experience. Just don't forget cash. They don't take credit cards (not sure about the one in the North End).

Reviews.Author: Sonia K.
Reviews.Content: There is really nothing new to add to the review of this place...and if you are still looking for another positive review then stop looking and just go there and see for yourself :)The food is great...the portions are plentiful and wine is cheap!! Yes, the line around the corner sucks but they don't make any exceptions so you are treated same as everyone else. On our trip to Boston, there were lines outside all restaurants and I am sooo glad and luck that we decided to wait ut sode Giacomo'sThe service was fun because we got to seat at the bar...cramped two seats but you see them cook and the waitstaff have a much more fun attitude when picking up or ordering food. We ordered the mussels linguine with shrimp and lobster...mmmmm.....(I salivate just thinking about it)Wish we lived closer but anytime we go through Boston..you bet we will make time to stand in line and eat here!!!Do your tatse buds a favor and go there.

Reviews.Author: michaela h.
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Giacamo's since I was a kid, and now I am lucky enough to live right down the street from it! It is affordable, straight forward, delicious Italian. I have never had a dissapointing meal there (I would estimate that I have eaten there about 30 times in my life) Try the butternut squash ravioli or any of the seafood dishes!

Reviews.Author: Susana J.
Reviews.Content: One of the best Italian meals I've had in the North End. Good value for your money (especially the wine). Very tasty calamari, and the fettuccine with prosciutto, peas and garlic sauce was amazing. We also tried the lobster, clams and mussels linguine with Giacomo sauce- truly amazing! Only drawbacks: very cramped space, the waiter was a bit pushy and there were no desserts. Only way to avoid the lines: go early in the week. We went on a Monday night and were seated right away.

Reviews.Author: Ravi P.
Reviews.Content: Sure, it's small, cramped, and cash-only, but it is probably the only place in the North End that I would make it a point to come back to.  Part of the allure is actually that it IS small and cramped - the feel is very cozy and the waiters are very very friendly and jovial.  They'll make you laugh and have a good time without making you feel terribly awkward.  I love the butternut squash ravioli.  And their specials seem to always hit the spot.  As for their traditional linguini pastas, they are also excellent, but not really the heavenly taste of some of the more specialty dishes.North End and South End have the same menus, but the North End one definitely has the friendlier staff - don't get me wrong, the South End folks are friendly, but they won't joke around with you, etc.  Keep in mind though - the North End location is notorious for having a long wait (which manifests in a line outside) which can hugely suck when it's cold / snowing / raining.  If you're going to go when it's crap outside, go on a weekday at non-peak times.

Reviews.Author: Bradie F.
Reviews.Content: Best Italian I've ever had. Definitely worth every minute of the wait!

Reviews.Author: John G.
Reviews.Content: Everything you are cooking for from a hole in the wall good Italian cooking. Red Pepper & Goat Cheese Gnocchi is the best. This is a must go if you plan on hitting up the north end. Keep these facts in mind. Expect to wait in line outside. They turn the tables over quickly, but it is a small dining room.  Cash only!

Reviews.Author: Toby B.
Reviews.Content: We waited here for an hour in the cold October weather.  Of course, this place was well worth the bitter cold and the wait.  The food was outstanding and beyond our expectations.  Quality and flavor surrounded this place and its food.  The small minor compliant is that its a cash only establishment, but you can go across the street for an ATM.  This is a place we would like to go back again to enjoy this tasty Italian delight!

Reviews.Author: Marty A.
Reviews.Content: Not much for vegetarians, but the chef will prepare something for you. They wait staff were friendly! great place to eat my 1st night in Boston!

Reviews.Author: Claire P.
Reviews.Content: This is my first ever review, so please be kind to me (and please excuse the length of this post)!  :)   Whenever I return to my homeland, Boston, I indulge in my two favorite kinds of foods, the quality of which, unfortunately, simply cannot be found on the west coast - shellfish and Italian food!  The Italian craving takes me to the North End, where on each visit, I make it a point to try a different restaurant.  After reading the rave reviews about Giacomo's here on Yelp, on my most recent visit to Boston, I decided to give it a try.The don't open til 4:30.  Luckily, I happened by at about 4:00 and found only two people in line and considered myself very lucky after hearing about the very long wait at so many of the North End establishments.O.k., I hate to be hypocritical, as I sometimes get a bit annoyed by negative reviews when the person's complaints have nothing to do with the quality of the food, yet, I now find myself in that very same position!  But, in reviewing a restaurant (which, as I said, I'm new at), I can now see how  things other than the food quality, come into play!Bearing my last statement in mind, while good food is "generally" the primary reason for choosing a restaurant, because I am a "coffeeholic" and therefore enjoy it with all my meals, I have been known to avoid patronizing restaurants based upon my opinion of their coffee, the quality, how they serve it (have an aversion to it being served in "clear glass" mugs), whether or not they offer frequent refills, etc.  Imagine my chagrin when the waiter at Giacomo's, upon asking for my drink order, replied, "We don't have coffee!"  While I understand they probably want to make their money on wine sales, I'm simply not much of a drinker.  I don't think I've ever been in another restaurant in my entire life, other than Chinese,  that didn't have coffee!!  Without thinking, I said, in what I'm sure was a shocked voice, "You're kidding, right?"  No, he said, "No coffee and no dessert!"  (The no dessert was fine for I was already tasting Mike's cannoli's!).  Once I got past the shock of "no coffee" (which wasn't easy) and settled for a coke, sorry to say but that had already eliminated one star from the possible 5-star rating.  :(My only other non-food disappointment was that this place couldn't have been any bigger than my living room (and I don't have a big house!), and the tables were so crowded together, it felt like you were practically sitting on top of your neighbor.  Needless to say, the resulting noise level was extremely loud (my hubby would have never returned here for this very reason).  I suspect from the little I've read here that this is the norm for most of the North End establishments.  I regret to say that this eliminated another star for me.Now - at last - the important stuff:  the food. The Caesar salad was without a doubt one of the best, if not THE best, Caesar salad to ever touch my palate.  The freshest of Romaine and the dressing was absolutely devine (I wondered if they made it the authentic way with the raw egg?).   I hate to say it, but I can't remember the exact name of the entree I chose, but it was the fuscilli with lobster (ahhh, but they put lobster on EVERYTHING in New England, don't they, and it's so to-die-for!!) and some other kind of seafood with the lobster sauce.  The serving was HUGE (so my brother back in Arlington was quite happy with my left-overs!).  The lobster was fresh and wonderful, but the fuscilli, while I liked it, was a bit too pasty and heavy for my liking.  I consider myself to be a pretty good Italian cook, but have never taken it to the extent of making my own pasta, so this may be why I found their pasta to be a little overwhelming in that it seemed to dominate the entire dish, whereas the sauce and seafood, in my opinion, should have been the dominant flavors.All in all, would I return here?  Hmmm, I'd consider it, but since I have sooooo many other restaurants to try in the North End, it'd be a very long time before I got back to this one a second time.

Reviews.Author: Mark O.
Reviews.Content: Ate here a few days ago on a strong recommendation from a friend - had the calamari red, wife had linguine with seafood.  Sauce was good but was strictly 'slightly above average', wife felt the same way.  Both agreed that my at-home recipe was better.Going out for Italian is hard - the food really has to be extraordinary to be worth it.  Giacomo's is good but they don't seem to go the extra mile, particularly when using boxed Barilla pasta.  Boxed pasta in the North End?  That's close to sacrilege.Relatively, there is some value-  the wine is not out of this world pricing and entrees are average.  But would have to agree with others that Giacomo's is not worth a special trip to the North End.

Reviews.Author: Alana T.
Reviews.Content: Food was fantastic, but I disagree that its a good place for a date. It's such an intense environment, and you really do feel like you're being rushed out that it was hard to concentrate on anything but the hostess who kept yelling at the people waiting to keep the door closed to enjoy our time there. So... if you're waiting, for the love of God, keep that inner door closed! If you don't care about a long wait and feeling rushed, then def go because it was really was awesome food.

Reviews.Author: L H.
Reviews.Content: The best Italian meal we have enjoyed in recent years!  We ordered the:- eggplant parmagiana - wonderful flavours, tender eggplant and no deepfried mess-butternut squash ravioli - ravioli filling was smooth and tasty, the sauce was good, but a bit sweet for my taste-frutti di mare - well balanced assortment of seafood, excellent sauce and fresh pastaService was swift, knowledgeable and respectful, and prices are extremely reasonable. Overall, a meal to savour!

Reviews.Author: Keen M.
Reviews.Content: LOVE Giacomos. Butternut squash ravioli- melt in your mouth, same with lobster ravioli. Bolognese is rich and flavorful. Tiny restaurant, delicious food. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Author: Mark R.
Reviews.Content: We had heard that 90 minute waits were common, but we only had a 30 minute wait on Thus.  But even if we waited for 2 hours it would be worth it.  This place is so good is crazy..  Even in Italy I've not had a dinner this good with seafood and the fixings.  If you have a prty over 4 i'd say the place is riskier since you just queue up to eat.  But other than that.  Wait in line, it's worth it.

Reviews.Author: Michelle P.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite restaurant in Boston! As a college student, I can't afford to eat wherever I please without it getting too pricey. However, Giacomo's not only has great prices but AMAZING food. My favorite appetizer is the calamari and favorite entree is the lobster ravioli. You can't go wrong here. They only accept cash and there are no reservations so you may need to wait on a line to be served. Get there early! However, they do accept reservations at their south end location.

Reviews.Author: Jesse T.
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing!! Lobster ravioli with the house sauce. I was in Italy this past summer and this place really reminded me of food and atmosphere there. Great choice for anyone looking four an authentic Italian meal

Reviews.Author: Moya A.
Reviews.Content: Overall a  BAD experience. Will never return. Ended up here because the "good" reviews we read online. The food is just OK. I've had better italian food. The enviroment: unfriendly. We felt they were rushing us to eat quickly because the huge line of people waiting outside. One of our friends met us there and when he seated they told him he would be charged 20 bucks if he did not ask for anything. He already had eaten elsewhere and just joined us for fun. He ended asking an appetizer that the waiter tried to remove when he was still eating!! That was soo rude! When serving the parmaggian they made a mess over the table. They also spilled the water when serving it. There are better places in Boston, where to have a delicious and pleasant dinner.

Reviews.Author: Aly M.
Reviews.Content: 5+ stars for food. 5 stars for prices. but the service...you will wait in like 1 hour or more (usually more). there is no waiting area so you have to stand outside which is fine in the summer but in the winter not so much. found the hostess to be very rude and the servers are impatient and very obviously try to rush you through your meal.my advice would be to go off-season and later at night (don't bother trying to get there early, there will still be a line) because the food really is exceptional.

Reviews.Author: Ron S.
Reviews.Content: Our first time here last night and it was worth the 30 minute wait.  The service was very friendly and the food was quite good.  Service was quick, without feeling rushed.  They do not serve dessert, which was fine with us.  We had the Chicken Marsala and the Eggplant Parma, and a special take on the Caprese Salad as an appetizer.  Definitely worth adding this place to the rotation!!

Reviews.Author: david G.
Reviews.Content: I'm a constant visitor of the north end restaurants but have never spotted this amazing piece of Italy before! A tiny,cosy,trattoria style place with a huge menu selection. We got Zuppa di pesce creation with all kind of sea food in it and a nicely balances giacomo`s tomato sauce and couldn't make a better choice! The only thing that i wish was different is the wine list -it's VERY small. Will definitely go back again!

Reviews.Author: Cailyn K.
Reviews.Content: The line says it all. Everytime I go here, there is always a line. But there is a reason for this, the food is AMAZING! I have never had a bad dish here! Amazing seafood pasta dishes! Even though the space is tight, it is worth it! Definetly a must-go-to restaurant if in the North End!

Reviews.Author: Steven W.
Reviews.Content: I hear there's a lot of wait time to get it... so try coming on a Monday night!! It was amazing!!!! great prices, great food, great staff..... even if you had to wait an hour.. walk around.. it's worth it!

Reviews.Author: Peter G.
Reviews.Content: Been there twice over the summer and once last week. Always a memorable experience. Reasonable prices and great food. Chicken Parmesan is out of this world.

Reviews.Author: yair l.
Reviews.Content: Service was goodFood was cooked to perfectionKids were happy and finished their plateAlso we (adults) were happy with our food I recommend and will come again

Reviews.Author: athena l.
Reviews.Content: The food wasn't bad, but it reminded me of Olive Garden. Without the breadsticks.I was there in August, and either the AC was broken or there was no AC to speak of. Either way, it was easily 95F in the restaurant, and only snocones are enjoyable to eat at that temperature.Considering the quality of the food, the massive wait, and the cramped and heated eating area, I'd suggest going elsewhere.

Reviews.Author: Jack P.
Reviews.Content: Wow, this is the north end at its best. Tons of pasta options, all of which are great. Homemade fusilli with great sauces. I highly recommend the spicy lobster based sauce. Good prices for what you get. Fairly cheap but excellent wine selection. So glad we chose to eat here. Very small location, not a lot of tables, so get here early and make sure you bring cash, its cash only.

Reviews.Author: Jean Anne C.
Reviews.Content: Finally got around to trying Giacomo's, and it definitely lived up to its reputation.  My boyfriend and I bundled up expecting to wait outside in the cold for a while, but we got there right at 4pm when it opened, and there was no wait!  Pretty soon after that, the line started to form.The sauce for the butternut squash and the chicken parm was outstanding, I'm pretty sure all their sauces are great.The service was brusque, as we expected from the reviews.  Expect to sit very close to your neighbors!

Reviews.Author: Lex K.
Reviews.Content: They took great care of us even though we brought around 15 people.  The food was fantastic!!

Reviews.Author: Tom D.
Reviews.Content: Great prices, great food, just don't expect a 2 hour (or even an hour) dinner, they know they have a line out the door and they keep it moving.  The homemade pastas are delicious and good portions.  This restaurant has been around forever, I don't feel like I need to elaborate any more than to say it's good and worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Anthony Z.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoy the food and the service!  5 stars

Reviews.Author: Regina T.
Reviews.Content: Big portions. Good prices. Solidly good food, but what sets Giacomo's apart from other North End restaurants is their sauces. I've had the veggie fusili dish twice, and both times I've been amazed at how tasty they mangage to make this vegetarian sauce. The fusili themselves were a bit undercooked and nothing to write home about. This was the consensus among my party at my last dinner there -- solid food, amazing sauce. My boyfriend had linguine and scallops in a pesto sauce--again, delicious sauce, decent pasta, so-so scallops. Another friend had a chicken dish with their standard red sauce and, again, raved about the sauce.The table bread is delicious, and the $17 bottles of wine are surprisingly good. As others have said, service is brusque. A waitress pulled my plate away from me and asked if I wanted it wrapped up while I was still eating it. One friend ended up with a different fish than he'd ordered. For what it's worth, this was a Friday night around 7:30 pm. I know these folks are all about turning tables, but if you want to keep up the general quality of the restaurant, you have to do so within reason. Then again, this could very well have been a peak hour thing. I've dined here earlier in the night and have had better service. This is one of the few affordable places in the North End worth going to, and that in itself is a lot. Is it worth a wait? I think so, though perhaps not worth a long one.

Reviews.Author: Matt H.
Reviews.Content: Hands down Giacomo's has the best food in the North End.  There is always a line to get in and for very good reason, the food is awesome.   I typically go with the Zuppa di Pesce with the fra diavolo sauce and as an appetizer I would get the Fried Calamari.  They are both good size portions, reasonably priced and always hit the spot!  The last view times I've tried the lobster ravioli which has also been excellent.  I totally understand if people are turned off by the quick service and the almost speed eating like atmosphere but I am totally ok with it because the food outweighs anything negative about Giacomo's.  I've eaten at Giacomo's a number of times and I have never had a problem with the staff and they have always been professional towards me.  That being said, it's totally up to you!  I think this place is great and you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Author: John I.
Reviews.Content: I decided to write a review for that place after reading all the amazing(!!!) reviews about it.NO! The food is not the best I've ever had. I have had amazing meals in much better places for less money and treated better too.The food is OK. Nothing special, but OK.The service is HORRENDOUS. Rude and unprofessional. They even came to take my plate while I was eating and without even asking me if I'm done.Mediocre place for people who know nothing about Italian food. AVOID.

Reviews.Author: S J.
Reviews.Content: Do not bother for Vegetarian food. Its just average, considering the high ratings for the place. The caprese salad, the mozzarella was not fresh enough, the tomatoes were cheap ones with lots of ugly seeds and white pulp, not the delicious ones that were expected, and hardly any basil. The Eggplant Parm was less than average, super soggy and all hidden under the Marinara sauce. The marinara was good. Pumpkin Tortellini was good, the squash Ravioli was again very average.The owners were a bit rude though funny. Not Going Back.

Reviews.Author: Izabella T.
Reviews.Content: HUGE disappointment.After hearing and reading great reviews of Giacomos, my husband and i were very excited to to try it. We went by the restaurant a bunch of times before but the line was always so long that we kept postponing it. Anyway, recently we finally tried it, and  I'm sorry to say, but it was pretty bad. 1) The space is incredibly small. We were practically sharing a table with another family. I couldn't hang my jacket on the chair because the waiter kept knocking it off trying to walk by. 2) Its very loud. If you want a nice romantic outing this is NOT the place to go. 3) calamari was dry, mozzarella sticks were decent. My linguine with scallops in scampi sauce was floating in oil! It was so disgusting... I have never EVER seen that before. My husband's pesto sauce was watery...4) everything was so rushed. (obviously, since there's a huge line outside waiting to be seated). We couldn't relax for a second. We finished dinner in literally 20 minutes. Overall it wasn't a good experience. And i have to come to the conclusion that either Giacomos was good, and recently started going downhill, or Bostonians don't know what Italian food should taste like...2 stars for friendly staff and quick service (at least i didn't have to wait for my oily pasta for 20 minutes)

Reviews.Author: Kim C.
Reviews.Content: Yelp did not disappoint when it recommended this little restaurant.  The food was fabulous.  We arrived at 5:15 and had to wait about 20 minutes for a table. We had the fried calamari and pumpkin tortellini.  Delicious!  We skipped dessert and headed to Mike's Pastry for cannoli.  Best meal in Boston by far!

Reviews.Author: Julie C.
Reviews.Content: Giacomos is as good as it gets!  I've only been to Giacomos a few times, but every time I go I leave wanting more.  The place itself really isn't all that great.  There is ALWAYS a line even before 5, the restaurant is small (you can almost touch elbows with the table next to you), and the place is a little loud and little chaotic with orders and people going in and out, definitely not ideal for a quiet romantic date.  On another note, the food is fantastic!  The fried calamari there is the best calamari I've had in my life, and trust i've had a lot of it.  I've only gotten the chicken parm and fettuccini with salmon and sundried tomatoes and both were terrific.  The portions are big and the pricing is not bad at all.  The dinner chicken parm was only 14 dollars. RECOMMENDATIONS: get there really early! try the fried calamari and to have CASH on you (CASH only restaurant).

Reviews.Author: Adele B.
Reviews.Content: I was absolutely appalled that the soap dispenser at the start of their business day was completely empty. Just after my daughter and I ordered our meals, I went downstairs to the ladies room and discovered this grotesque situation. This restaurant was tightly packed with people who had been walking the north end on a hot and humid day. Ugh, give us some soap before we all get ill. I sure hope the personnell had access to a sanitizer! Our dinners were delicious and our server, Julie, was efficient and personable. She said she would report the problem. But really management...there is no excuse for this befouled condition!

Reviews.Author: Nik F.
Reviews.Content: So good! Got to go with the fresh seafood dishes. Best prices you can get for classic Italian dishes that are terrific. Try the Giacomo's sauce.

Reviews.Author: A L.
Reviews.Content: Food was good. Shocked in this day and age they do NOT accept credit cards. Cash only. That is my only complaint. Fish was very good!

Reviews.Author: Susan C.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had dinner here before a concert at Symphony Hall.  We had for appetizers the Fried Calamari and the brocoli rabe both were very delicious.  My husband ordered eggplant parmesan for his main course and I had the Lemon Fettuccine With Grilled Shrimp And Scallops again both were very good.  Everything was very reasonably priced even the glass of wine.  We did not have time for dessert but look forward to trying some next time we dine here.   Make reservations, the restaurant is tiny but not overly loud.  The service was terrific.

Reviews.Author: Paige A.
Reviews.Content: Loved it.  The lobster ravioli and pumpkin tortellini are amazing!!  We waited over an hour but the delicious food and the reasonable wine prices ($17a bottle) made it worth it.  Can't wait to visit this place again.  The place is tiny and very popular and the wait staff works hard to turn the tables over quickly so do not visit if your looking for a long, quiet dinner.  The wait staff as well as the people standing outside in the long line want you in and out.

Reviews.Author: Lauren D.
Reviews.Content: As always, fantastic experience! Food was excellent, service was great. John did a great job getting us seated on a crazy night. Def stop by Anchovies next door if there is a wait.

Reviews.Author: Hyun B.
Reviews.Content: speechless.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany B.
Reviews.Content: I love Italian food but the thought of standing outside for over an hour for dinner was not my idea of a good time.  It did give me time to look through the window and peruse the chalkboard menu on the wall and try and decide what I wanted to eat... I am notorious for taking forever to order.  Once we did make it inside, it was more then worth the wait!  We ordered a bottle of wine and the mozzerella marinara that came out almost before we got the wine poured.  I love shirmp and scallops so right away I knew that is what I wanted to order, but then I had to decide what type of sauce I wanted.  I chose the pesto, and I wasn't disappointed.  The only complaint I could make is that I am not a big fan of linquine, I prefer angel hair, but that didn't really stop me from devouring the entire entree and then wanting to lick the plate!  I also stole a butternut squash ravioli from my dinner partner while he wasn't looking and that too was delicious!

Reviews.Author: Mia P.
Reviews.Content: waited about 1 hr in the rain in 4 inch heels...but the lobster raviolli was worth it,   fresh flavor, saucey, warm and delicious. cash only, no coffee, good for a fresh from scratch meal, wine was excellent

Reviews.Author: Alyssa N.
Reviews.Content: This place was AMAZING!! After a long day of walking and touring Boston, my friends and I came across this gem through a yelp search. I would not come here on a weekend for fear that it would be packed! And rightfully so because the food and service is amazing. When we arrived there was a line, so half of us waiting and the other half went to Mike's Pastries for "appetizers". When we got back in line, we only waiting about 15 more minutes until we were seated (party of 4). The place is tiny but it feels like home. The waitress was friendly and gave us really good suggestions. They even put our leftover pastries in the fridge for usQWe had the fried calamari and it was cooked just right! For dinner, I had the half lobster and seafood pasta dish. It was AMAZING! Everyone else got something different and thoroughly enjoyed the food. So good that we wanted to come back before our plane flight out of Boston, but they were not open early enough.

Reviews.Author: Cheryl N.
Reviews.Content: Okay, I am not from around here, but I heard good things about this place from a couple locals here.  We wanted to try all the good restaurants that Boston had to offer so we were willing to wait an hour, maybe two for good food.  We just got done from a long day of walking around.  We took our 6 months old baby with us.  Since we were still on Cali time (that's a 3 hours time difference), we thought our baby wouldn't mind waiting for a late dinner.  After 45 minutes of waiting in line, my husband and I, along with our baby, were getting kind of impatient waiting.  We were about to give up and were tempted to go to a restaurant next door that didn't have a line.  However, there was this lady in front of us who could not stop talking about how good this restaurant was.  Her actual words were the food melts in your mouth, the worker would go out of your way for you, and yada yada.  She pretty much convinced us to stay.  After finally getting in the restaurant after 2 hours, our waiter did not give us the time of day, and yes, the food was really good.  However, I could honestly say that it was not good enough for us to wait for two hours again.  What killed us was this restaurant was CASH ONLY!  Seriously, all these people who waited in line knew that this was cash only?!  I did not see that posted anywhere on the window!  My husband had to run across the street to pull money out of an atm.  How annoying was that.  Sorry, I was not that impressed.

Reviews.Author: David S.
Reviews.Content: Waited about half an hour in the cold rain and let me tell you, it was worth it. Had the gnocchi and it was the lightest fluffiest gnocchi that I have ever had in an amazing delicious sauce. Couldn't not have been any better.

Reviews.Author: shana c.
Reviews.Content: two words: PUMPKIN TORTELINI! the wait is worth it!  wise up though and go during the week-- none of this wait in the line on the weekend crap.  do it.  do it now.  oh and it's cash only, so plan ahead!

Reviews.Author: Stephanie H.
Reviews.Content: If it was possible, I would not give this place any stars at all.I went to this place in the North End because it was highly recommended by other yelpers and of course, the fabulous Rachel Ray. I also believed that the line that was starting to wrap around the corner implied that the food would be awesome. Well, prepare to be disappointed. Our group was HERDED into this cramped hole in the wall. Our server, Donna, I believe is her name, with a sneer, began to rapidly read off the list of different sauces, specials, etc. When she asked me what I would like to drink, she barked out that they didn't have ice tea. When our food was brought to the table, the plate was slammed down and another order was barked out to "WATCH OUT FOR THE HOT PLATE." (For a second, I thought I was at Dick's Last Resort where the whole point is to be rude!)  I also happened to hear this server  tell the table next to us that the restaurant had always been busy, even before Rachel Ray came to review it. This was said, of course, with another sneer. The sauce was decent, the pasta overcooked, pricing was good. However, I can promise you a more pleasant dining experience from your local Macaroni Grill. We traveled the entire North End and many other parts of Boston, and found this particular restaurant to be the most unpleasant experience we had in the city. Cheers to you, Donna, for earning a thumbs down and being the worst waitress I have ever met. Shame on you for treating another service industry person the way you did. I guess that was a bad tip for you, huh?

Reviews.Author: Carolann M.
Reviews.Content: I have eaten here a few times and was pleased both times! My boyfriend and I ate here on a Saturday night last month. When we showed up at 430 there was a line of people waiting to get in. Once they opened up at 5, the only way of getting seated was if you had reservations. It's a very small restaurant so plan on making a reservation if you are going on the weekend. The hostess was super nice and got us a seat at the bar. Our waiter took our food order right away and was always very attentive to us. I definitely recommend the butternut squash ravioli its like nothing you have ever tasted! Overall great place.

Reviews.Author: Eric C.
Reviews.Content: Rude. Won't try again.

Reviews.Author: Court N.
Reviews.Content: Went here with family in the south end location. Very noisy but very friendly.  Food was excellent.  Service was great.  Prices can't be beat for the quality of true italian cooking.

Reviews.Author: Joe p.
Reviews.Content: Lets get all the bad things about Giacomo's on the table right away.  First of all they have a long line to get in almost every time I try to go there.   End of bad things.   Now for the good.  I thought for a long time when I started to write this review how many times I have eaten here and if I could think of any restaurant that cooked better meals in the area.  There are a lot of great restaurants in the North End and none are better than Giacomo's.  Some may be as good but Giacomo's has been so consistent over the years.   I ate my first dish of calamari here when they first opened and it has set a standard that I look for whenever I eat calamari any where else.  If your visiting the North End for the first time you can get into the true spirit of the neighborhood visiting Giacomo's because it is in the heart of Hanover Street and there is so much to see while walking around.   (This is for the men only)  A meal at Giacomo's, some window shopping on Hanover Street and a stop at Caffe Paradiso for dessert will get you well around first base and on your way to second base  with the main/new  lady in your life.

Reviews.Author: Shin M.
Reviews.Content: I waited outside for an hour with my sister. My dish was OK... my sister's dish was really delicious though. She got some kind of ravioli special so the portion was really small which was disappointing. Overall OK experience.

Reviews.Author: Traci C.
Reviews.Content: After researching for our trip, we prepared ourselves to wait at this North End gem. Therefore it was no big deal when we arrived around 7:30pm and there was a long line along the storefront. We were thrilled when we got bumped up because we were a party of two, so miracles can happen. The menu is posted on a chalkboard along one wall of this tiny place. There couldn't be more than 15 tables and it is quite cozy (read: if you want a lot of space and not to get to know your neighboring tables this is not the place for you). Tony, our server, was loud, borderline rude, very Bostonian and we loved him. We ordered up two glasses of Chianti and a large calamari-- which as other posters has said is excellent, served with the perfect marinara sauce. I enjoyed the chicken parmesan and my husband the linguine with mussels and clams in red sauce (very garlicky=yum!). Both dishes were delicious and portions were huge! The character of this little place, along with the food will make it a must-stop the next time we find ourselves in Boston. For wine, an appetizer, two large entrees, and tip it was $60. There are many places to dine in the North End, but the bottom line is Giacomo's may be the only one worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Neha G.
Reviews.Content: Loved the good here ... Longggg wait on a weekend evening ... But worth it

Reviews.Author: Ann H.
Reviews.Content: I love this place. Food is always fantastic and the people that work there are very pleasant. You know a place is good when there is a line outside in 30 degree weather. Prices are reasonable also.

Reviews.Author: Tracy L.
Reviews.Content: We went here on a Saturday night around 8pm.  We read the reviews, and were prepared for a wait.  The restaurant only has about 15 tables -- and there is no waiting inside.  The line forms along the street -- which was a little tough for a cold night -- but it went by quickly.  After about an hour of waiting minutes, we were in.  The tables turn very quickly, and our food was out in about 15 minutes. The restaurant was loud and cramped, but the food was excellent and very reasonably priced. Our whole dinner lasted about 45 minutes, I felt a little rushed.  If you're looking for great Italian food -- this is it.  If you're looking for a nice slow evening, enjoying dinner over a bottle of wine -- this isn't it.  The pumpkin tortellini, and the calamari were both delicious.  We had a good time, and will go back (though, we'd probably arrive around 9:30 next time -- there doesn't seem to be a wait around that time).

Reviews.Author: Jack H.
Reviews.Content: Best place in the North End.  Specials are posted daily on the chalk board, servings are fresh and plentiful!

Reviews.Author: Roger W.
Reviews.Content: The worst service ever. Rude waitress and terrible management. Certainly far bellow my expectation from a Boston's top restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Phil B.
Reviews.Content: First trip to north end. Had to wait about 15 mins for a table but it was worth the wait. The salad with house dressing was nice, the fried mozzarella with red sauce was tasty, and the farfalle with lobster and crab meat special was fresh, served piping hot, and truly delicious. Recommend the giacomo red sauce. Make sure you sit with your back to the windows, so you don't see the people waiting in line for your seat, because they look so jealous!

Reviews.Author: Taylor C.
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying that Giacomo's food lacks the finesse that you normally expect at 5-star restaurants. But Giacomo's has the food, the service, and the right price...a combination that is very difficult to find. My friends and I were in line for an hour an a half on a very cold, Saturday night to dine here (I could not move my fingers/toes one at a time towards the end - my body had shut down to conserve heat for the main organs!!!) , and it was very much worth the wait. We had the calamari, the butternut squash ravioli, and garlic bread as appetizers. THE BUTTERNUT SQUASH RAVIOLI WAS AMAZING. The calamari was just adequately delicious, and if I have one small complaint from my night, it would be the bread - the bread, in my opinion, was too oily and lacking in that pungent, garlic flavor that I enjoy and anticipate. Anyway, I split the ZUPPA DI PESCE (House Special) with my friend and it was a feast for all my senses. This + a bottle of white for $65? Why, don't mind if I do! Not quite sure how the other stuff tasted because I got a little carried away with the second bottle of wine, but man - I will be going back every time I'm in town. Much love to Donna for her great hospitality, and for telling my friend not to rush his last glass of wine (I was telling him to hurry, since there were a lot of people waiting still), because we deserved to enjoy that dinner as much as anybody.  She was a sweetheart. Oh, and get the Fra Diavolo sauce if you enjoy a little more heat.

Reviews.Author: Hiro T.
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say that you can believe all the hype about this place.  For once, I can say that it was and is totally worth waiting in line to eat at this restaurant.  The restaurant is small, but still has a really nice restaurant feel to it.  I love the fact that there isn't really a menu, but instead that you order off of a giant chalkboard by telling them what you want in your pasta and what sauce you'd like, or you can order from their specials.  If that's not enough you can look on the other side of the room and order from the daily specials chalkboard!  No menu, but still a lot of good choices.  Now...the FOOD!!!  START WITH THE CALAMARI!!!  Wow, so good.  It kind of feels like it melts in your mouth.  Not too crispy, but not too soggy.  The squid is perfectly cooked to give that melt in your mouth feel.  I went with the lobster ravioli which was incredible.  The sauce was amazing.  Very rich and creamy, with amazing flavor.  My only problem with the dish was that the sauce was a little too rich and took away from the actual lobster that was supposed to be inside the ravioli.  I would have preferred the lobster in the ravioli to contribute more flavor to the dish, but still, the dish was incredible.  My girlfriend had the scallop and shrimp with scampi.  It was also really good (would not recommend this dish to people with a weak stomach, the scampi is very heavy in butter and can have an "obstructive" feeling), but if you can handle large amounts of butter...GO FOR IT!!!  The flavor is really buttery and garlicky, but is delicious.  The pasta is also really good.  The pasta is well made and well cooked.  Even the wine is good.  I think a bottle was $17, so wasn't expecting too much, but was pleasantly surprised considering it was a $17 bottle of wine.  So, would I recommend this place to people?  ABSOLUTELY!!!  Will I be returning?  YOU BET!  Regarding WAIT TIME: I would recommend going on a weekday.  I think I went on a Monday around 7:30pm and only had to wait about 20 minutes, which I think isn't too bad considering I hear you can wait over 1 hour if you go on weekends.

Reviews.Author: Rochelle R.
Reviews.Content: Here's another spot I tried based on the reviews of fellow Yelpers.  I got there around 6:30P and braced myself for the wait.  There was already a line outside, but that is because the place is very small compared to the joints I eat in Los Angeles.  Even if they did get a bigger spot, there still would be a line.  Actually, it was my first time in the North End, so I enjoyed looking at the surroundings, so the wait didn't seem that bad.  For starters, my friend and I had the calamari.  It was one of the best calamari I had.  I don't like a lot of batter on my calamari and Giacomo's prepped perfectly....light, but crispy batter.  There were also fried peppers with the calamari that was a nice touch to the dish.  For the entree, I had the special which was 1/2 lobster, mussells, clams, shirmp, and scallops on pasta with the Giacomo sauce (marinara w/ a hint of cream) and my friend had the butternut squash ravioli.  All were excellent!  The seafood was cooked perfect, tender and full of flavor.  The butternut squash ravoli was interesting...I liked it, but it can get a little sweet.  This place was awesome so much character, it was worth the wait and wished Italian food on the West Coast was just as good.

Reviews.Author: Natasha A.
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best Italian I've had in the United States. There's always a line, but trust me its worth it! The restaurant is intimate, full of life, and feels like sitting in the dining room of an Italian family. Love the Fra Diavolo sauce!  Be sure to remember its cash only!

Reviews.Author: three's company M.
Reviews.Content: this food is amazing!!!!  we got there a little before 5 pm and waited in a long line of people.  this place is popular.  the line moves quick, but it is so great to chat with the fellow foodies about how great this little hole-in-the-wall is.  rachael ray was right.  she came here on $40 a day.  we usually do our homework when it comes to places to eat.  this place did not disappoint!  the only thing that was disappointing was that they were only open after 5 pm!  the bread was delicious.  warm and soft.  great, straight-up, friendly service.  my husband had the butternut squash ravioli and it was seriously the most amazing taste!  there were stages of flavors that we experienced as we chewed and let the flavors sit on our tongues.....it was delicious!!  this was a unique choice - not one you find at most italian restaurants.  too bad!  they are missing out on a great concoction.  this recipe is one of a kind and truly something i will never forget.  i have to say i was very jealous of my  husband as he took each bite of ravioli.  he was nice enough to set aside a few for me!  i went for something more simple.  broccoli, chicken penne in garlic cream sauce.  it was terrific.  excellent flavors....i am glad i got it, but that butternut squash ravioli was out of this world. i was contemplating between my dish and the pumpkin tortellini.  i think next time we'll try that and for sure get the butternut squash.  i would highly recommend this place to anyone visiting the boston area.  it's about a 15 min. walk from boston common.  you can walk the freedom trail on the way :)  this place definitely lived up to the hype on yelp.

Reviews.Author: Ann L.
Reviews.Content: bottom line : it's worth the wait.  i had no idea the place was so tiny, but we got there right when all the tables had just turned, so we literally stood in line for 30 min without moving an inch.  a little disheartening at first, but peering through the windows, looking at all the happy eaters diving into their steaming plates of pasta....i knew we would have to stick it out for a chance to experience this restaurant. lovely fried calamari is the way to start.  I've tried a lot of calamari in my short life (more than I should have at least), but this one tops it  all.  the fried hot peppers were so delicious, i couldn't stop eating them.   willpower be damned. it was so tasty! definitely try the butternut squash ravioli if you are a fan of the sweet / salty food pairing.  the dish comes with about 8-10 ravioli stuffed with sweet and comforting butternut squash puree and bits of salty prosciutto,  bathed in a thick and rich cream sauce, studded with fresh asparagus and completely sinfully divine.  this dish is no joke.  it will make you fat.  our other dish, linguine fruitti di mare, was amazing as well.  the giacomo's sauce, a lobster-based red with a hint of bechamel, was not too heavy and brought out the best in the seafood.  the scallops in particular were probably the most tender scallops I've ever had.  only adding to the experience was the super friendly, quick service (we  got our food and ate in 30 min flat, and believe me, it was ALL fresh).so...next time you're in north end...grab a lobster tail from mike's pastry ...station yourself in line with a good book or an interesting friend....and prepare yourself for a delicious meal!

Reviews.Author: Lauren H.
Reviews.Content: So we went the other day, and it was really disappointing.  My mother ordered a meat ravioli dish.  When it came out, she swore it tasted like seafood.  She asked the waitress if there was seafood in it, and she insisted that their wasn't.  At the end of our meal, the waitress came back and said that she had, in fact, served my mother seafood ravioli.  She laughed it off and goes "well, it's a good thing you're not allergic!"  No apology, no offer to take if off of the bill, nothing.  I was shocked.  Really poor customer service.

Reviews.Author: luna r.
Reviews.Content: Worth it!  we waited in line for an hour to get in, and we were not disappointed.  the prices are completely reasonable for the north end ($16 bottles of wine, $15-$20 pasta entrees, more if you get stuff with things like lobster in it), and the food is super yummy.  we split the calamari which comes to you table the minute it leaves the frying pan, and the caprese.  i had the butternut squash ravioli, which of course is as good as everyone says it is.  it's a small dining space, but cozy and cute, overall a very nice experience.

Reviews.Author: Mimi R.
Reviews.Content: 40 min. wait, & 37 degrees out, but worth it! 3 of us went to dinner, I got the Butternut Squash Ravioli my husband got the Mushroom Ravioli which was on the specials menu, & our friend got a Combo Seafood Pasta with Spicy Red Sauce. I wish I got the special too! It was really good! We got the Garlic Bread, & an appetizer on the specials menu too which were great as well. Most bottles of wine start at $17, & by the glass $5. The Cabernet was good. Short & sweet service. Very good, & worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: Mark H.
Reviews.Content: This is one of my all time favorite italian restaurants.  I remember the first time I went to Giacomo's.  My family went with my brother.  We walked up Hanover street into the heart of the north end of Boston only to find that we had to wait over 30 minutes outside, just to get in!!  It was well worth the wait that night and every night that I have been back since!  Great menu, reasonable prices and super food.  My only wish is that you could comfortably enjoy an after dinner drink without being pressed to leave!

Reviews.Author: Tom R.
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this as a public service. I live in the North End. I've eaten in at least a majority of the restaurants in the area and consider myself a bit of a foodie. I often stop to ask folk in the long line outside Giacomo's why they are there.  I do sometimes get "a return visit" as the reason, but most often the respondent has a travel guide in their hands. The food is fine, just that, not great, not even really good....certainly not as good as the several nearby restaurants which do not have lines.  Zagat's rates it a 25, good but not great.  Hey, I like the pumpkin or butternut squash ravioli or agnolotti, too; but the very same dish, made at least equally welll can be had at Marcos, Monicas Vinotheque, Prezza, Neptune Oyster and Mare, just to name my five favorites.  All of these serve food that's more interesting with friendliness and panache. Four of them have superb winelists to boot.  And if you think you're saving money, you should compare items directly.  If you have a taste-determined association with this restaurant, please don't think I'm trying to move you away; but those of you who are there because someone else or some travel book recommended this restaurant, please know that those of us who walk by shaking our heads feel badly that you're standing outside in the rain, snow or direct sun for no good reason, when you're only steps away from truly wonderful food.

Reviews.Author: Gigi L.
Reviews.Content: I have to start the review by saying that I am very picky when it comes to Italian food. After reading so many great reviews, I could not wait to give Giacomo a try. For two people we shared the house special: Zuppa Di Pesce with clams, mussels, shrimp, scallops, calamari and lobster over linguine with Fra Diavolo sauce (a spicy version of their house sauce giacomo). The portion was huge, definitely a great deal for $55. The clams, muscles, and calamari were perfectly cooked, juicy, tender, and tasted very fresh. The shrimps were big and just a tad overcooked. To my disappointment, the scallops were completely overcooked and rubbery, and honestly I thought I would get sick because the texture tasted like scallops that have gone bad. The lobster was very small, overcooked as well, and didn't have the sweetness of a fresh main lobster. Finally, the linguine was not al dente to my surprise as I expected such a highly rated italian restaurant should at least prepare their pasta right.

Reviews.Author: Robert W.
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere and staff! The food was even better than I remembered from previous visits.

Reviews.Author: Vanessa A.
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite places! My friend and I shared the Zuppa di pesce and a bottle of wine! Prices are so reasonable and the food is to die for! I'd recommend this place to everyone!

Reviews.Author: Amanda K.
Reviews.Content: holy cannoli is this place good. i'm pretty picky with my italian, and this was one of the best pasta experiences i've had. i got a burata mozz app to share, and one of the specials: 1/2 lobster, clams and mussels on linguine w/ giacomo's sauce (the lobster bechamel). the burata was SO GOOD. i could have eaten two more plates of that. and the pasta: wow. that house sauce is amazing. and the seafood was perfectly cooked and piping hot, and the linguini was just al dente and never got squishy (i. hate. overcooked. pasta.). my only complaint was that i wanted more sauce over everything. i could have eaten my hand covered in that house sauce. the bottle wines were so cheap! i've never seen a restaurant of that caliber with such low wine prices before. the wait wasn't that bad on a monday night: i think it was about 25 minutes. we all came out reeking of garlic afterward though, thanks to the little space and open kitchen.

Reviews.Author: Kimsley A.
Reviews.Content: The lines outside are totally worth it. I appreciate the laid back charm of this place. Like others have mentioned, it is in fact super loud and cramped, but this along with the taste of the food reminds me of family restaurants in Italy. Just remember CASH!

Reviews.Author: Florence L.
Reviews.Content: OK, so the only reason we had even heard about this place was because I saw it on Rachel Ray's $40 a day.  I told my hubby to go and try it on one of his business trips with his co-worker.  After their meal I get a phone call with both of them raving how it was one of the best Italian meals they ever had.  On my first visit to Boston I finally get to try Giacomo's and hands down it is the best food ever.  I dream about the next time I visit Boston and eat there.

Reviews.Author: Cassy S.
Reviews.Content: We love Giacomos! It's a must for locals and visitors. Arrive early (before 5 pm) for the first seating. Service is incredible friendly and quick. I'd recommend it for smaller groups (4 or less) and not for a leisurely meal since it's a small place that's in high demand! I always order the pumpkin tortellini in mascarpone sauce - have tried the lobster ravioli, but it just doesn't compare. You won't regret coming here!

Reviews.Author: Jim P.
Reviews.Content: Food was delicious! Had Caesar, garlic bread, calamari, lobster with fusilli special and chicken/shrimp over ziti. Cheap wine- bought one of their 'premium' wines and was only $26 for the bottle! Wait was not long outside for two. Dining room was a little too squished. Bring Cash there are No Credit Cards! Overall was a great place to eat!!

Reviews.Author: Ryan H.
Reviews.Content: Small amount of seating.  Around 35 at max.  Be prepared to share the table w/ strangers.  CASH ONLY!  If you forget, there is an ATM directly across the street.  Line starts to form early so you might want to consider eating early.  Most of the menu is seafood w/ the pasta, but plenty to choose from for the non-seafood types.  It is a hoping place, and at times you might feel as if you are being rushed since there is such a long line at the door.  Definitely a place you must try.

Reviews.Author: Adam I.
Reviews.Content: The review of this place is as simple as it gets.  The food is the best in the North End.  The wait is the worst in the North End.  Is the food THAT much better to warrant waiting outside for over an hour to get it?  Not sure if it does, there is a ton of good food in the area.  But it's definitely worth trying at least once to find out for yourself if it is worth the wait for you. I got there before it opened and had to wait about an hour and fifteen minutes to get a table for two.  Very reasonable prices for the quality of the food.  Check it out if you are patient.  Otherwise, choose one of the other 500 Italian places in a 4 block radius.  3.5 stars overall.  Five stars for the food.

Reviews.Author: Annie D.
Reviews.Content: Worth the wait. Enough said.

Reviews.Author: Kristen L.
Reviews.Content: giacomos is a great little place and i do mean little i was there last week with some friends and to walk around the feast the food is wonderful and theres always a line from the time it opens till the end of the night,,definetly a place to check out

Reviews.Author: Vince C.
Reviews.Content: Linguine with mussels and fragiacomo sauce might be one of the pasta meals I've ever had - period.

Reviews.Author: Janhavee D.
Reviews.Content: Whenever my brother and I go to the North End for dinner, we always go to Giacomo's. The service is excellent, the food is top notch, and the  atmosphere is perfect. I recommend the butternut squash ravioli to anyone, and my brother always seems to love whatever their special is for the day. There are so many options for vegetarians as well, making this the perfect place for the two of us to eat together.

Reviews.Author: Michael S.
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing!! The wait was about 45 minutes, but worth every bit.  Ceasar salad was perfect, calamari was tender, seasoned just right and totally enjoyable.  I had the special veal saltimboca which was very good and my partner had the butternut squash which was excellent!  You feel like you're eating in someone's house, as the place is very intimate.  I think it's a total of 12 or 14 tables.  But, as mentioned earlier, WELL worth the wait!!

Reviews.Author: Regina C.
Reviews.Content: any restaurant with a long line outside on a rainy night has got to be good. luckily i was dining solo so i bypassed the line and got to sit in the only seat bar seat. i ordered the fried calamari and the linguini with giacomo sauce and clams. the sauce is like a tomato based sauce with some bechemel for creaminess. the dish was huge and the clams were plentiful. my only complaint is that the noodles could have been a little more al dente. the calamari was tasty as well but the highlight of that dish was the addition of fried jalapenos and peppers. Mmmm!

Reviews.Author: Kelsey C.
Reviews.Content: Get in line. And stay in line because the pasta is worth freezing for. Get there early in Boston winter because the line forms before the place opens and is always pretty long. Bring your conversationally-competent, low-maintenance, Italianophile date/friend/parent/sibling/relative because there is no loud music to mask the awkward silences. Although I was too busy savoring my lobster ravioli to talk anyway... Leave your high-maintenance, must-eat-all-5-courses-with-the-right-fork friends at home because the dining here is no frills. The décor is simple: wooden tables or high stools at the wooden bar. But the kitchen is bustling, the servers are warm, and the extensive menu is written on a blackboard in a pretty array of colored chalks. Cash only is a downer, but the North End doesn't lack ATMs, and the prices are great at this practical symbol of all that the North End respresents. Split the caprese appetizer for the extra-fresh mozzarella and let the basil whet your appetite. For your entrée, avoid the bland chicken marsala and stick to the pasta. Have the tender lobster-filled, al dente, creamy-but-not-too-creamy ravioli, wash it down with a glass of Chianti, and just smile.

Reviews.Author: Alaina L.
Reviews.Content: THE BEST ITALIAN IN THE NORTH END!!!! Everytime I visit my friends in Boston, dinner here is a must! Yes, I'm considered a 'tourist' to all you local Bostonians, but I visit your town at least twice a year and have traveled the world. I consider myself an international foodie and all I have to say is- Giacomo's is legit. Its small & always packed, so expect to wait in line outside for 30min+, but it is WELL WORTH THE WAIT!!!! We have the same server everytime, I think her name is Rosemary.....like someone mentioned before, she is kinda rude & pushy at first. But I think she's just trying to move things along bc of the line outside. We usually get the butternut squash ravioli as an appetizer. ALWAYS AMAZING! And I don't normally eat shellfish, but the mussels are to die for, perfectly cooked, perfect texture, not overdone, not slimy. Just perfect. And the spicy red sauce they are basking in is also heavenly. The pesto with ziti & chicken is another fave of mine. Everything here is pretty delectable. LOVE THIS PLACE!!!

Reviews.Author: Phil C.
Reviews.Content: Service was terrible, line outside was too long, they don't accept credit cards, and everything was rushed. Sent one dish back and they insisted on charging for it. The food itself was good but not so great that it's worth putting up with the inconveniences of coming here. Maybe it's good for Boston locals if they like it compared to other North End restaurants. But I can't recommend Giacomo's. They went out of their way to create a negative dining experience.

Reviews.Author: Sarah Y.
Reviews.Content: Worth the wait and deserving of the hype! My friend and I expected a long wait but kept our hunger at bay with free samples from other businesses outside. I personally didn't mind the smallness of the restaurant because it felt like Boston to me. We got the calamari appetizer (delicious) and I ordered the fusilli siciliana - DELICIOUS! It came out nice n' hot, and the leftovers gave me two additional meals. The bill wasn't bad either! Our waiter was a helpful, no frills kinda guy and gave us extra bread. Obviously this isn't a restaurant you would frequent, but I encourage everyone to try it at least once.

Reviews.Author: Andrew K.
Reviews.Content: It was a rainy night and yet there was still a line outside waiting to be seated in here.  Typically there is a 30-40 minute wait but we got lucky and we only waited 20 minutes.  The place is a small and cozy hole in the wall place and has a family atmosphere.  We got the calamari for an appetizer and it was delicious.  It had peppers in it which gave it a nice spicy kick.  I got the special which was 1/2 lobster, scallops, clams with linguine and giacomo sauce which was a lobster based pasta sauce.  I also tried the clams and mussels with giacomo and fra diavolo sauce which was a little spicier.  The sauce is not very heavy and the linguine tastes home made.  The portions were just right for me and the wine per glass is good and cheap and costs only $4.25.  I though the prices of the food was reasonable but I don't know if it was good enough that  I would come here if there was longer than a 30 minute wait.

Reviews.Author: Jason L.
Reviews.Content: I don't think Giacomo's needs any additional support from Yelp readers, but for what it's worth, this restaurant provided me with absolutely the best food I've ever eaten in Boston.  So good.  So so good.  Like everyone else on Yelp, me and my bf started with the calamari and it was great -- not just squid, but also fried jalapenos and other peppers.  I then got the swordfish and tuna fettucini (AMAZING) and my bf got the lobster ravioli (again, AMAZING).  Even better: we got there at around 7:00 pm on a Friday evening and only ended up waiting about 30 minutes for our table.  Totally worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Joshua S.
Reviews.Content: By far the best bang for your buck in the north end.  I almost always go with about 3 other people so we can share 4 dishes.  The Butternut Squash Ravioli MUST be on your list, but the specials on the chalkboard are also a great place to start (and finish, for that matter).  Their homemade pasta is fantastic and is always cooked perfectly.  Also, I love their calamari.  Calamari has become increasingly popular with the masses of late, but Giacomo's really makes it happen with those slimy guys.  It's tangy, spicy, savory and salty, and the best fried squid you'll have anywhere.  The big seafood stews (is that what they're called??) are also great, but they're pretty huge, so don't go at them alone.  Also, there is reasonable, yet sturdy wine to be had at this place as well.  Not as much mark-up as other places around.  Don't try to stick around too much after you're done with dinner, though, because the huge line of people waiting for your seat might very well turn into an angry mob.

Reviews.Author: Lauren S.
Reviews.Content: Giacomo's is my favorite for Italian food.  It feels like being at a family member's house for a crazy family dinner.  If you want a fancy place where you can have a leisurely dinner and conversation over drinks, this is not the place.  You will be sitting *rightnextto* the other people.  Just embrace it.  The wait staff is great, very friendly and they know the menu well.  It's always the same few waiters every time I go.  I haven't even talked about the food yet!  I'm a big fan of the butternut squash ravioli (like everyone else on yelp), but everything else is so great too.  All of the homemade pasta is so fresh and cooked to absolute perfection, and the sauces are just damn delicious.  All of the appetizers are great, even the olive oil on the tables is some of the best I've had.  Portions are filling, and the prices are totally reasonable.  Get there early to get in the first seating...the line goes around the corner but it's totally worth it.  Waiting in the cold makes the food taste even better.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany C.
Reviews.Content: delicioso! friendly staff, line out the door. great food for reasonable prices.  i got the tuna steak with grilled veggies. the tuna steak was perfectly seared! the veggies...not awesome. not awful.

Reviews.Author: Rina A.
Reviews.Content: I love the seafood pasta selections in this place! Worth the long line outside but the line moves quickly. Cash only! And don't forget to try the fried calamari appetizer!

Reviews.Author: J. N.
Reviews.Content: This was our first favorite restaurant when we moved to Boston and became even bigger fans upon learning that there was a SE location that took reservations.  BEST calamari in town, everyone seems to love the seafood loaded pastas with Giacomo sauce. My favorite is the vegetarian fusili (homemade - YUM) after the delish caesar salad.   The bread rocks too.  Service is just so-so, reservations are respected with the half-hour (annoying), and cash only (what is this, the dark ages?).  But the food is some of the best outside of the North End.

Reviews.Author: Ryan W.
Reviews.Content: Top notch place in the North End - beware of cash only and long lines (so get there early)! The lobster ravioli is incredible and they rush you out to get more people in the door - but some of the best food in the city!

Reviews.Author: Mike C.
Reviews.Content: so there's a wait outside even before it opens, they don't take reservations, it's cramped and packed in like sardines...BUT man, this place is SOOOOO good. they specialize in Italian seafood cuisine, and honestly, you really can't go wrong with anything off the menu. it's one of the best Italian restaurants i've ever been to. and considering how crowded it gets, the service is great, quick and personable. make it an evening and get dessert at Mike's Pastry afterwards, and go to sleep with a happy stomach.

Reviews.Author: Aga S.
Reviews.Content: I have been wanting to try this place for the longest time. I've been passing by this restaurant daily and rarely have I seen it slow; usually there is a line out the door which for me is enough to kill my appetite. Two of my friends and I were actually walking toward another restaurant but we noticed that Giacomo's had few open tables and we decided to give it a try. The place is tiny, tables a so close to one another that I could use the neighboring tabletop as my arm rest. The staff was friendly, and fast. Water and bread arrived at our table few minutes after we sat down. The food came out very quickly which made us think that the mussels appetizer was pre-cooked, reheated and served. For entrees we had 3 different pasta dishes: calamari scampi over linguine, shrimp fra diavolo over linguine and fettuccini with swordfish and tuna pieces in a pesto cream sauce. The calamari scampi was the best out of all, it was the most flavorful. The fra diavolo was pretty bland and could have been more spicy; and the pesto sauce was watery. Unfortunately I was not impressed.

Reviews.Author: Tofoi Y.
Reviews.Content: Great food, great service . What else is there? Food comes quickly and though I suspect there is always a wait , you are not rushed. It's small inside as are most of the places around here but OH what good food. Burrata filled fresh mozz appy, handmade fusili entree, chicken marsala and clams with red sauce. SO good.

Reviews.Author: Juho W.
Reviews.Content: I went in thinking... how much better can this place be?  My GHAT!  I was getting impatient in line, but as soon as I tasted the food... well worth it!  The Frutti di mare was the best ive ever tasted.  lobster ravioli is a bit small for a dish but SO good.  all the appetizers are BOMB.  Yes i had all the appetizers...

Reviews.Author: Anthony L.
Reviews.Content: went here saturday night, it opens at 4:30 (not 5)...i got here at 5:05 and i didn't get seated until 6:30. food quality is good, portion is good, service is good, price is average, place is tiny, cash only. personally if i ever go again i'm getting there no later than 4:30...i would not wait more than 15minutes for it

Reviews.Author: Armin F.
Reviews.Content: Always when I wander through the North End, the longest line is always in front of this place and I have been wondering why. Tonight, so I thought, was time to shape my own opinion. It was luckily a short wait of 20 minutes (due to the cold and sunday-evening-ness)...Once seated everything went down as efficient as it gets; we had our food within 15-20 minutes, and it was fresh and absolutely delicious. We had Pasta (Homemade fusili with Shrimps and Lobster and Butternut Squash Tortellini with cream sauce and vegetables). The service was really friendly, very quick and efficient...Now that all sounds like solid 4-stars but whereas every other North End restaurant capitalizes on their location with outrageously high prices, this place was authentic, efficient, friendly and delicious. A dinner for 2 with a glass of wine, 1 solid appetizer, 2 great entrees for 50 Dollars...that deserves 5-stars.

Reviews.Author: Christina O.
Reviews.Content: I have not eaten at Giacomo's in several years, but I will say that this place is worth the hype, just not worth the long line outside that usually wraps around the building.  I say this because there are a plethora of other delicious Italian restaurants all over the North End with absolutely no lines.  I think Giacomo's is only so famous because Rachel Ray came here for one of her TV shows and gave it rave reviews.  I've eaten here several times and I always find myself starting off with a bottle of house pinot grigio.  Honestly, it's got to be the cheapest in the North End and surprisingly pretty good!  I highly suggest it.  The bread that they serve you with each meal is absolutely delicious.  I could eat it all day.  The meal I have ordered the most amount of times is the pumpkin tortellini...it's always absurdly good and has never, ever disappointed me.  I've come here with others that have ordered various seafood dishes and they have had nothing but great things to say about their food as well.  The prices here are def some of the most reasonable in the North End and the portions are huge and filling.  However, the space itself is really small...you may even find yourself (uncomfortably) sitting at a table that is literally 6 inches away from a table full of stangers (hence the long lines outside...which, I will say, tend to move fairly quickly though).  Service is always rushed here, too.  This is not a place to spend hours or even one hour...it's chew & screw or your server will make you feel like you're an asshole for not leaving right after you finish paying.  All-in-all...excellent food, massive portions, great prices, but really tight quarters with rushed service and likely long lines.  You be the judge.

Reviews.Author: Cheryl P.
Reviews.Content: I don't have a great preference for Italian food if given a choice (preferring northern, though, over southern), but Giacomo's is an entirely different experience. Got there at 4pm, knowing that a long line would result if any later, which paid off since our party of four was among the first to be escorted in by the warmest, loveliest man.
