I don't know if he was the owner or manager, but he seated us, took our orders for drinks, appetizers and main entrees, kidded with our teenage daughter over her cell phone use at the table (which was great, since she actually ended up putting it away), and delivered it all himself, all quickly and yet never failing to make us feel as if we were guests in his house. The food was delicious. I had mussels in Giacomo sauce (a lobster-based tomato sauce), and believe me -- someone who is not a fan of red sauces of any kind -- this sauce was practically a revelation. I couldn't get enough of it. After finishing my mussels, I ate what I could with the spoon, then sopped up the rest with their delicious bread as well as the garlic bread also ordered as an appetizer, and if I'd had a straw, I would have used that to get every last drop out of those mussel shells. For my entree I had shrimp and scallops with broccoli in a garlic cream sauce. It was sublime. My daughter had the pumpkin tortellini. I took a taste, and it was incredible. (No dessert, but Mike's Bakery is diagonally across the street and has a great assortment of Italian pastries as well as other baked goods, so we went there.) But all I can think about now is that incredible Giacomo sauce...

Reviews.Author: Dominick D.
Reviews.Content: I fly in from Florida every year around the middle of December.  This is my favorite restaurant in the world. Enough said.

Reviews.Author: Jackie R.
Reviews.Content: Awesome little place!  We waited outside for a while, but to me that was part of the experience and part of the charm.  They do a good job of getting people in and served quickly though, to keep the line moving.  All in all a great place with delicious food!

Reviews.Author: Adrian F.
Reviews.Content: After waiting an hour and a half, I was not that impressed. My pasta was very, very underdone, and the rest of my family's food was not that great. Based on its reputation and the other reviews, I expected the most amazing Italian food I've ever had. But having eaten at other restaurants in the neighborhood, I felt this food was mediocre. The waitress was also not very welcoming, and we felt very rushed, and almost like an inconvenience to her. I would not go back.

Reviews.Author: J S.
Reviews.Content: Loved it.  Extremely cozy seating- everyone was right next to each other but this felt like part of the experience... after waiting in line for almost an hour and a half, we felt like we knew everyone in the line who were then seated around us in this small restaurant.  So, the wait would have been unbearable if we were hungry.  But, for the price and the taste, it was worth it.  The food was fairly conventional, but each dish seemed to have a unique twist to it like the giacomo red sauce, or garlic or lobster cream sauce.  In the end, even the conventional things tasted somehow extraordinary here- loved the garlic bread appetizers.  Only reason not 5 star is because of the wait.

Reviews.Author: Rebecca G.
Reviews.Content: Very loud! Not a romantic place to go. Servers were a little rough around the edges and we had to share a table with another couple. If not for that, Giacomo's would be 5 stars. The food was great! I had fried calamari and pumpkin tortellini, amazing. Be sure to get there a little earlier, the line was far out the door.

Reviews.Author: Paul K.
Reviews.Content: I ordered one of the specials for my entree: gnocchi with sausage and broccoli rabe. It was amazing; tender gnocchi, earthy tomato sauce from the broccoli rabe and the black pepper, and slices of sausage. I left stuffed and satisfied. My meal was worth the wait outside. The price was also very reasonable, I think my dish was about $15-20.

Reviews.Author: Jesse B.
Reviews.Content: Food was good, right out of the oven hot and prices are low, it was by no means  spectacular, I have had better in East Boston/Winthrop/Needham to name a few and I didn't have to pay 20$ to park or stand on a sidewalk waiting in in line for an hour at any of those restaurants. A member of our party asked for options on what pasta they could get with the chicken parmigiana and was told Linguine or Linguine (nothing else), That line might work with the tourist but not someone that eats out 5 times a week, foodies want option on homemade pasta, you gave us none.  Service was rushed, waitress was more concerned with getting us in/out than she was with our dining experience. Not a relaxing dinner in any way shape or form. Don't even think about bringing a girl here on a first date (unless you want the date to end fast).  Luckily the food was was good and affordable or they would get 2 stars from me.  I won't go back.

Reviews.Author: K S.
Reviews.Content: My mom came to visit me in Boston last week and she wanted some good Italian food. I've always seen Giacomo's when walking through the North End but never had the patience to wait in the line. Hearing how great the food was, my mom and I decided to stick out the wait that night. Surprisingly, though the line looked long, the wait was only about 25 minutes. Giacomo's is a small restaurant with quick and efficient service (they have to get people in and out quickly if they want to get the people outside seated quicky). We ordered the Zuppa di Pesce which is the dinner for 2 - basically all seafoods you can imagine served over linguine with sauce of choice (we got the red giacomo) - man was this meal just divine! Mind you, it was more like dinner for 4, we stuffed our faces and still had about half the dish left over, but wow! Definitely the most enjoyable Italian meal I've had in a while. Will be returning!

Reviews.Author: Janet H.
Reviews.Content: my favorite restaurant in boston!  very tiny and cozy place with good food!

Reviews.Author: Hungry J.
Reviews.Content: My grandma's from Italy, so I know good Italian food when I taste it. And let me say, this place was amazing!! The time we spent waiting outside only increased the anticipation from what I could see of the menu board inside. Among friends we ordered chicken marsala, which was very good, shrimp & scallops with pasta, which tasted really fresh (and pasta seemed homemade), and the pumpkin tortellini, which was SO much more than I expected - absolutely divine. Definitely my favorite. And the service was extremely friendly and informative, even with a line of hungry customers waiting outside. With so many Italian restaurants in the North End, it may seem hard to pick just one... but if you have to, make it Giacomo's. You won't regret a single bite!

Reviews.Author: Simon V.
Reviews.Content: As an out of towner, we heard great things about Giacomo's on Yelp and decided to give it a try.  We went on a Tuesday and arrived at 6ish and there already was a line and waited about 30 mins before being seated..at the bar.  Not quite where we would like (and it was really cold due to the AC blowing down) and as luck would have it another table opened up.  Our waiter readily moved us to another table.  I had the special of lobster, mussels and clams which was good.  Good value at $20.  The atmosphere was noisy and hard to have a conversation.  Overall, I that it was meh.  I'll probably try it again, but only if there isn't much of a line.

Reviews.Author: K Z.
Reviews.Content: I miss the pumpkin tortellini. I need to find an excuse to go visit Boston and eat at all my favorite restaurants. After living in Boston for four years, every time my parents came to visit we would go here. Tip: the place opens at 5, so if you get there at 4 and are one of the first in line, yeah you'll be waiting for an hour, but if you get there later you will definitely be waiting and like for an hour plus. Yes, as prior reviews have stated, the place is small. You are crammed in. And the staff is in a hurry because they want high turnover because there is always a line. However, the food is totally worth it. My faves are the pumpkin tortellini and the butternut squash ravioli. Although I never tried the aforementioned goat cheese ravioli and that sounds amazing. The prices are VERY reasonable for what you get, but remember to bring CASH as they don't accept anything else.

Reviews.Author: W R.
Reviews.Content: Giacomos is good for small numbers of adults and/or very well behaved older kids.  You are tucked into a small seat, and the staff begins a blur of activity to serve you up the most flavorful Italian seafood you can imagine.  The service is SO fast!  The only downsides of Giacomos are: 1. long lines and 2. small seating area.  But they combat it with the fastest chefs and staff I have ever seen!  The food is perfect!!!  I would not go there with young children.  It's such a small restaurant that any squirminess or crankiness in small children would upset the entire room.  It will be an unforgettable experience for anyone who loves Italian seafood!

Reviews.Author: Alex C.
Reviews.Content: I can say with complete confidence, and you will agree, that Giacomo's is the overall best Italian food in America. The line is almost comically long, and for good reason. This place is truly about the food, not the profit, which means no reservations, no call-ahead, no big-tops, and tables are turned very quickly (but friendly, polite service is maintained). Besides the wait (which you haaave to expect), there is nothing negative I can say. I had a special, gnocchi in a plum tomato sauce, and my fellow diners shared the calamari, which they said was perfect, followed by pumpkin tortellini and the fettuccine with swordfish and tuna, respectively, to which they gave glowing praise. Infinity minus one stars. For serious.

Reviews.Author: Jungmin L.
Reviews.Content: Sturdy, reliable Italian. It's overhyped, but traditional Italian-American fare that is only slightly americanized. Large portions.

Reviews.Author: Amy P.
Reviews.Content: The food 5 stars...the service 2...nothing annoys me more than to have a delicious dining experience SHATTERED by a rude server and unfortunately that's what I got at Giacomo's!  I wanted to bring an out-of-town colleague to the North End for a "real" Italian meal and  Giacomos came to mind  for their delicious Lobster Ravioli. We went on a Thursday night and (since I've been there before) expected things to be a bit frenzied BUT seriously, was it necessary to basically yank our plates away from us and to be told by our server (after pressuring us to by the stupid bottle of wine in the first place)..."I hate to ask you this but do you think you could drink up, there's a lot of people waiting to be seated". SERIOUSLY?!?! Our plates were basically just stolen away (barely chewed our food) and with over half a bottle left we're asked to leave?! Normally I would have said something but didn't want to make a scene at a business dinner and didn't want my colleague to think any less of me than she already did (after watching me chug a giant glass of vino). We certainly weren't looking to stick around (not the most comfortable atmosphere with the tight tables and over zealous waitstaff) We were in and out of there in under a half hour-hardly loitering. Basically my feelings are sure go there if you don't mind waiting in a line longer than you'll be sitting IN the restaurant. There are SO many places around Boston that offer Italian Food that is just as good or better. I WON'T be going back.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth J.
Reviews.Content: Just for being rude.

Reviews.Author: Mark M.
Reviews.Content: Had a short wait of only about 10-15 minutes on the sidewalk on a busy Friday evening in June in North End.  Small restaurant was a little crowded and a little loud, but tables seemed to turn over quickly. Service brisk and efficient, but still personable and friendly. Menu is mainly patron selected seafood (mussels, clams, shrimp, scallops) over linguine with choice of several sauces plus a few specialty dishes. Dishes very well prepared with generous servings at very reasonable prices. The fried calamari with dipping sauce appetizer was fantastic, and I am not usually a calamari fan. I had chunks of salmon with sun dried tomato and lobster tomato sauce over pasta. Wife had seafood combination with house sauce and daughter had butternut squash ravioli with asparagus.  Very satisfied.  One idiosyncrasy to note, though, Giacomo's accepts cash only, so be prepared - didn't realize this until time to pay bill.

Reviews.Author: Miss B.
Reviews.Content: Finally braved the line on our recent trip to move our daughter into her freshman dorm. It was worth the wait. The people on either side of us in line were a pleasure to spend and hour with, and our family of 5 all enjoyed our meals. The dressing on the house salad was a bit bland, but the vegetables were fresh. While it was a bit cramped, we didn't mind a bit. Our server was efficient, friendly and fun to talk to. We look forward to coming back many times over the next 4 years. Probably more like a 4.5.

Reviews.Author: Chris M.
Reviews.Content: I'm still  unsure why this place constantly has a line out front. It's good, but it's not worth the hour plus wait you'll go through, or the 30-minute rushed dining experience that's inevitable.I've lived in Boston for six years and have only gone to Giacomo's North End when visiting friends have strongly requested it, and I've hated the experience both times. My idea of a quality dining experience is not waiting out in the cold for an undetermined amount of time and then being squeezed into an unbelievably tight space and literally rubbing elbows with your neighbor diners. For a place that serves $15-26 dishes, I shouldn't have to read the menu off the *wall* or on stained and/or sloppy hand-written menu. For a bottle of wine priced at $20-something, I shouldn't see a fourth of a cup of wine splashed on the table after the waitress dumps the wine into my glass (although at least she had my friend try the wine before she poured the other glasses... although I doubt if "Try this", spoken in a surly tone, is the traditional way of presenting a wine to a patron). When expecting to have a bill of about $100, I shouldn't have a waitstaff that can hardly, well, wait for you to make up your mind about the menu. And after all that... the long wait, the hurried meal, the humorless waitress... my friend got food poisoning from what we figure must have been the scallops. But really... in hindsight I guess that's not so surprising.The only reason I'm giving 2 stars instead of 1 is because I don't want to completely sully the Giacomo name-- I love the South End location (the experience is the opposite of what exists in the North End).Don't waste your time going to Giacomo's North End. Don't feed into the patron psychology of seeing a line outside of an establishment. Take your money and your empty belly to any of the dozens of restaurants in the North End (the better places are off Hanover Street). You won't regret it.

Reviews.Author: Morgan L.
Reviews.Content: Took my mom here on her first visit to Boston, and I'm glad we went! Delicious Italian food at an affordable price, we got in with no line (on a Tuesday night) but saw a small line as we were leaving. The service was quick and authentically Boston, and the food was amazing. The calamari is breaded to perfection, butternut squash ravioli is delicious, almost too sweet to finish the plate. I also had shrimp and scallop linguine in Giacomo sauce. Yum!

Reviews.Author: Joanna M.
Reviews.Content: Have always wanted to try this place, but line was always tooo long! Went after a Sox game arriving around 5:40pm on a Sunday..20 minute wait outside..Once inside a little confusion about where our party of 2 was to sit due to many tables being available at once. Our middle aged  waitress was rather abrupt, we felt she was almost yelling at us to hurry and order. We actually found it to be somewhat comical and a little stereotypical. The house salad was overdressed and nothing to rave about. However, the pasta..OMG!! I had the special of red roasted pepper goat cheese gnocchi with spinach, chicken, mushrooms and tomatoes. My friend had the butternut squash ravioli. Both with such fresh ingredients and delish! Prices were reasonable including $5 glass of wine. No loitering after dinner..they want to turn the tables! At least 20 or more people waiting outside when we left.

Reviews.Author: Mike R.
Reviews.Content: Giacomo's is the best Italian restaurant on Hanover St., and that's saying a lot because it's hard to have a bad meal on Hanover St.  The restaurant is pretty small and very cramped, and they don't take reservations, so there's usually a line (especially on a Friday or Saturday night, and even more so when the weather's good).  It's not uncommon to wait an hour for a table.  Once you're in there, the service can seem rushed (although the staff is helpful and entertaining), and they don't  encourage lingering, so it might not be the best place for a romantic date, but it's definitely lively and most importantly, the food is out of this world.  Their pasta is homemade, their sauces are excellent (also homemade) and they have fresh seafood and meats as well (although their menu is more seafood-oriented and I would recommend going that route if you like seafood).  They have a good wine list as well and huge portions so the value is very good, especially considering the quality.  I would definitely recommend the fried calamari appetizer and lobster ravioli. Things to keep in mind: -As I mentioned - no reservations and there can be a wait.-Cash only.  They don't take credit cards, but there are ATMs very close by.  -No dessert - BUT it's practically across the street from Mike's Pastry which is fine with me anyway.  So overall I would say it's an EXCELLENT Italian restaurant and worth the wait.  The focus is on the food, and they do a good job with it!

Reviews.Author: C S.
Reviews.Content: I should preface this by saying, "I am not a big seafood eater."  I hear Giacomo's seafood dishes are wonderful, and I am certainly not going to dispute that because I have only eaten non-seafood fare at this restaurant.  If you're not a fan of all things that come from the sea, then ditch the massive line that winds around the block and go across the street to Cibo for pasta (Giacomo's and Cibo are owned by the same family).

Reviews.Author: Lucie A.
Reviews.Content: the food was delicious and reasonably priced.the only thing that rubbed me the wrong way was that they get you in, sit you with random people if they have to and it all just happens so fast. don't go there expecting to take your time to be romantic or catch up with friends. i'd say go for the food.

Reviews.Author: Josie F.
Reviews.Content: Amazing! My hubby and I waited in line for 30 minutes to get a taste of this place.  Though our stomachs growled during the entire wait, it was worth the stomach pangs!!  For our main course, we ordered the butternut squash raviollis (amazing!) and frutti de mari pasta with house sauce.  Cute place.  Great vibe.  Oh, reminder: This place only takes cash!

Reviews.Author: Vina L.
Reviews.Content: best calamari EVER! it was worth the hour wait in the snow. it's a bit too cozy for my taste. Otherwise, it would've been perfect.

Reviews.Author: Ice cube X.
Reviews.Content: the best pasta I've ever had, plus the mild seafood flavor, it's delicious!

Reviews.Author: Cody S.
Reviews.Content: Got the tip to go here from a bartender in town who said it was his favorite.  Not at all disappointed.  I had the lobster pasta special for $20.  I would have paid more, it was excellent.  The wine is also reasonably priced.  Definitely would go back next time I am in town.

Reviews.Author: Kevin A.
Reviews.Content: My new favorite place in the North End and it's worth the wait. The woman running the door was extremely rude but the food makes up for it.  The prices are great.

Reviews.Author: Ms L.
Reviews.Content: there is something i must admit before writing my review...i asked the waiter to marry me.no, i have no idea who he is...no, i've never seen him before...no, i do not know anything about him. irregardless, i wanted access to this incredible food as often as i want :) the place is a bit tiny, but very homey. you can smell this place from a block away (in the good way) and that smell is beautiful, beautiful garlic! the line was longer than the front of the store...but they were still able to get people satisfied pretty quickly. everything on the menu looked amazing, so i simply told my waiter what i like and told him to bring me back whatever he thought was best. boy did he know right...i loved my food! wait...i loved everyone's food (well, everyone at my table). i took a bite of everyone's food. the sauces were all incredible; the pastas were all fresh and delightful; and the wine was perfecto :)i travel the world for food. but i would fly back to boston in a heartbeat (i'd go to boston, more specifically giacomo's, even before italy) just to eat here again. the waiter said if i bring a cooler next time that i can get some of the sauces to go...i hope he wasn't lying :)

Reviews.Author: Brett k.
Reviews.Content: I am a native New Yorker - came to Boston for the weekend - we were looking for something good, and not too expensive....we read tons of reviews on yelp and everything in the north end seemed touristy and expensive, but Giacomo's sounded like something we were looking for....we gave it a shot and it was AMAZING...im still thinking about the chicken parm I ordered.  It's very small, but cute and intimate, the waitress is straight to the point - takes your order and the food came out pretty fast.  I would definitely go back and skip all the other touristy, expensive places on the same block - highly reccomend!

Reviews.Author: Tony L.
Reviews.Content: home made italian cooking, love it.

Reviews.Author: johndy j.
Reviews.Content: The wait was worth it! I was drawn by the line outside and I'm glad I stuck around. The place is small but they make it up with their staff and their delicious food. I don't even remember what I got because I just told the waiter I wanted something meaty and bam... I got what I asked for. The only thing missing to make this a perfect experience was my wife :-(    bravo!

Reviews.Author: Claudio D.
Reviews.Content: Outstanding food. Great prices. Excellent cheap wines. Friendly service. What else can you ask for?  Vito Corleone playing the cello???  And to top it all, I've got to have dinner with the most beatiful girls in the world. Yes, lines are long but the wait is worth it! Hope they have a similar restaurant in dc or Miami.

Reviews.Author: Maria D.
Reviews.Content: Frutti di mare is very good, price was reasonable.  The rest of our party enjoyed their meals as well.  Wait was long, this is the only downfall.  Will go again.

Reviews.Author: Daniel G.
Reviews.Content: I went her for my first year anniversary with my lady, she got some pasta and i got some pasta, it was good but i will say that they definitely try to 'overcram" people together which limits the privacy. Also, i was a little upset, when i was told i could NOT try their famous Giacaomo sauce ahead of time. Needlesstosay-- the food, waitress, and new friends from the table next to us were a success. Thank you Rose- Marie for the good laughs! :)

Reviews.Author: Jason M.
Reviews.Content: The food is out of this world.  I have eaten at some really good Italian Restaurants and this is the best pasta I have had.  I had their special half lobster linguine with clams and oysters.  I had my choice of sauce and chose the lobster based spicy tomato sauce.  This dish was amazing.  The service was ok.  The only reason I rated a 4 rather than a 5 is because we were really cramped at our table.  The dinning area is very small and they try to use the entire space.  This results in some very close quarters.

Reviews.Author: Kathleen J.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely one of the best Italian restaurants I have been too!!  Could eat there every week.  The seafood is fresh and kudos to the chef for making the dishes so special

Reviews.Author: Steve K.
Reviews.Content: Italian food the way my grandmother made it!  I love this place.  The food is authentic and awesome as is the staff.  If you show up for an early dinner you can minimize the wait time.  It's definitely crowded inside (bumping elbows with the next table) and everything seems a bit hectic and loud but this just brings back memories of big italian family dinners at home.  Can't wait to go back for more.

Reviews.Author: Alexandra K.
Reviews.Content: If you want a crave a home like atmosphere with you meal, this is the place. You might be seated to close to the next table, but that is the charm of this place. The food is delicious, and service is right on point. Definitely worth a try!

Reviews.Author: Lee Ann D.
Reviews.Content: We actually went to the location on Columbus Ave. Intimate bistro recommended to us by a Boston native. Enjoyed the eggplant parmigiana. The cheese was thick and tasty, and the red sauce was sweet and obviously fresh. My husband had shrimp with linguine, which he liked. However, he said that the red sauce in his dish had a much different taste than the red sauce on my dish. Ended the meal with a delicious almond amaretto cake. Felt like a neighborhood restaurant. It was totally packed on a Monday night. You get off the T at Prudential Center and walk through a charming neighborhood of brownstones to get to the restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Chris M.
Reviews.Content: my favorite italian restaurant for the last 10 years.  intimate little venue.  great service staff.  Giacomo sauce is to die for.  $16 bottles of wine can't be beat.  very reasonably priced.No reservations, so you have to wait in line but I have never had to wait for longer than 45 minutes.  they turn tables over very quickly.  definitely worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Alex And Valerie L.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I get to Boston only about once every 10 years, but we always go to Giacomo's !  We stood in line in a light rain (they don't take reservations) for about an hour and fifteen minutes (it was a Friday night).  After waiting for ten years, another hour and fifteen minutes was nothing - even in the rain.  And it actually wasn't bad at all, as we were treated to the annual "St. Joseph Society Feast Celebration" parade, which was kinda cool.  Once seated, we received fast and attentive service.  Our food was prepared perfectly (as it always has been).  We've only ever gotten whatever their pasta special is for the day, making sure it's topped with their homemade "Giacomo's sauce" (a lobster sauce with Bechamel) - we highly recommend their Giacomo's sauce !  Since it had been so long since we'd last been there we'd forgotten it is cash only, not a problem, there is an ATM right across the street.  The next time we're in the Boston area we're definitely heading back !

Reviews.Author: Pol W.
Reviews.Content: I ordered the house special. I agree with the other reviews which say that the house sauce is incredibly boring. The dish definitely wasn't worth the 60$ or the wait. The waiter we had was also incredibly rude and they didn't even give us bread before our meal. Go somewhere else.

Reviews.Author: John C.
Reviews.Content: There I was tickets to see a Celtics game with my Father and Grandfather. We went back and forth on where to have dinner. Our norm is Rino's, however we wanted to stay walking distance from the garden. I'm glad we did, Giacomo's is fabulous. They have THE BEST seafood dishes. We were fist in line as I waited there for about 30 minutes before opening. We had the seafood dinner for two special and the three of us split it. It as plenty of food as a giant bowl of broth, clams, shrimp and other seafood goodness filled us all with a few clams to spare. I've eaten at pretty much 80% of the restaurants on Hanover and Prince, this place is a MUST! We had a great waiter who was a riot! He made our dinner experience! Amazing service, amazing meal, amazing game. Perfect Wednesday night.

Reviews.Author: Claudette N.
Reviews.Content: We'll be back. We've avaided this place because of the long line but last night we hit it just right--no line. Food is well worth it. Great calamari, chicken marsala, pasta, and wine. I even ate all the pasta which I never do. One of the best meals we've had in the North End. Yes, it is noisy and small but the food is wonderful.

Reviews.Author: Samantha M.
Reviews.Content: After waiting on line in the near 0 degree weather for 30 minutes, I was thrilled to finally be seated inside. Little did I know that I was about to begin the most stressful dining experience of my life. Before our coats were even off, we were asked what we wanted to drink and what appetizers we were interested in. The waiter listed off the night's specials so fast that I only processed a couple of words. Our calamari was served in about 5 minutes and we tried our best to slow down the dining experience and relax. This wasn't too easy as the eager diners waiting in line outside had their noses pressed to the window examining our every move. Our main courses came before the calamari was even finished, our wine glasses were refilled every time we took a sip, and you could feel the eyes of the wait staff pressuring you to eat/drink faster. As each person finished their plate, it was immediately cleared, again pressuring the others to eat faster. Although I must admit that the food was delicious, I was forced to eat so fast that I barely even remember what anything tasted like. After paying the check, we still had 1/2 a bottle of Chianti left. I think if it was legal, the waiters would have told us to take it to go. The second I stood up to put on my coat, the table was being cleared, new plates and silverware were being thrown on the table, and I was essentially being pushed out the door. As we exited, an angry customer scolded us, "Clearly this is your first time dining here." How dare we stay in the restaurant more than one hour! Well don't worry, with all of the other delicious restaurants in the North End, I will NEVER return to Giacomo's.

Reviews.Author: Nicole J.
Reviews.Content: Whatever you do, go early.  Perpetual lines may be a turnoff for many, but the food is definitely worth the wait.  Mouthwatering food-  fresh pasta, homemade sauce..sooo good!  5+++ stars for the food, but the service (inattentive abrasive server) and the long lines bring it down a notch for me.

Reviews.Author: Mr. F.
Reviews.Content: I went there recently for the first time in several years.  I already knew how much I loved the reasonably priced food. However, what surprised me is how cheap their wine is.  We paid $16 for a nice bottle of Malbec.  That price for a bottle of wine is unheard of in restaurants.

Reviews.Author: Sean M.
Reviews.Content: This is the best italian/seafood joint I've ever been to.  There's two locations, one in the heart of the north end, and a new second location in the south end.  Both have almost identical menus and I cant tell the difference.  Prices are a little expensive, but portions are great.  The half lobster, mussels, and clams with giacamos house sauce (lobster based) is the best meal I've ever had.  I highly recommend the south boston location because it is a hell of a lot less crowded.

Reviews.Author: christina m.
Reviews.Content: Best Chicken Parm in town.  It is satisfying and reasonable.  The service is quick friendly and to the point.  Don't forget you can order to-go from the South End location.

Reviews.Author: Austin S.
Reviews.Content: My favorite Italian place in Boston.  You either need to get there on the early or late side, the wait can easily be an hour otherwise.  The dining area is small, but they turn over the tables pretty quickly.  Waitstaff is as nice as someone can be while they are trying to rush you through dinner.

Reviews.Author: Mark D.
Reviews.Content: Awesome. Been 4 times...always worth the wait

Reviews.Author: Lauren C.
Reviews.Content: Waited in line for about 30 minutes on a Sunday evening but it was worth the wait!  The price was reasonable and food was overall good!  Hubby ordered their special pasta with 1/2 lobster, mussels and it was a pretty big size of a plate!  I ordered their Butternut Squash ravioli, the portion was just right, creamy sauce brought the smooth taste of the squash.  Kids ordered the chicken fetuccini alfredo and split the plate with some leftovers.  All in all, I would go back again if it wasn't freezing cold out waiting in line.

Reviews.Author: Josh D.
Reviews.Content: First timer here....The line was about 45 minutes but the atmosphere in line was very fun....Once inside the waiter was very nice...the place is small and very loud with people having a great time....The food was very very delicious.....The price was awesome......cash only so keep that in mind ( ATM right across st ) I would go back in a second......

Reviews.Author: Daryl S.
Reviews.Content: Amazing food.  Its an experience. Waiting in line can be annoying, but part of the experience that makes it so great.

Reviews.Author: Emily S.
Reviews.Content: The wait was worth it!  The lobster ravioli and butternut squash ravioli were to die for. Because the staff is in such a hurry to get through the line outside, the service is nice and fast (for better or for worse... Would not recommend Giacomo's if you want to take your time over dinner)

Reviews.Author: Ro M.
Reviews.Content: Not worth all the hype.  The long line and "cash only" is a scam.  Just because Rachel Ray was there years ago it seems EVERYONE wants to go there too.  Yes, we got sucked in by all the great reviews.  Overall the seating is cramped to say the least.  My 7 yr old was squished between the tables so I can only imagine how an adult would feel.  The food was okay, nothing memorable, and was also reasonably priced.

Reviews.Author: Katie m.
Reviews.Content: glorious, glorious, GLORIOUS!!!!!i live around the corner, and i find myself getting take-out from giac's way too often. the food is absolutely amazing!!! try the homemade giacomo sauce (pink lobster based sauce. i would swim in it if i could); best calamari i've eaten in boston; caesar dressing is awesome (but they do tend to put a little too much dressing on). definitely the best bang for your buck in the north end- BEST food, average of $17 for the everyday giac's dishes (which is pick your seafood, pick your homemade sauce- one of 7ish- over a MASSIVE serving of linguine). the half portions of the appetizers are totally enough for 2 people, and they'll tell you that too. before you go you should know:- 99% chance there will be a line out the door, but it moves really fast bc of the busy atmosphere of the restaurant - they don't take reservations and cash only; there is an atm right across the street- it is extremely hustle bustle, but that's just how giac's is. if you're after a long, intimate night, i'd go somewhere else- be prepared to be sitting literally right next to the other diners, it's a tiny place- the wait staff are generally old-time north enders who have been working there forever. just know that their gruffness is just how they are- they're genuinely friendly and love having your business, but if you're not prepared, they can seem a little rough around the edgesone very good thing about giac's is they are very local, but treat everyone equally. you won't find any line-cutting or special service for locals or people who "know the owner." expect a busy, cramped atmosphere, with great character and TO-DIE-FOR food!

Reviews.Author: Rachel C.
Reviews.Content: I recently had the experience of waiting in line in the frigid weather on 1/15 but unfortunately the price, service and food was not worth it.  It was loud with dishes be stack noisely during our meal, our waitress "BOSS" was rude and rushed us thru our meal so the other victims outside could experience this unpleasant dining experience.  The food was OK based on the price, my veal was tough.  The wine was cheap which you needed to get thru this ordeal.  I would never recommend this restaurant too many others worth going to maybe more expensive but worth your time.

Reviews.Author: Byron K.
Reviews.Content: The food is sublime.  Order anything with seafood in it; my favorite are the scallops with fra-como sauce.  Fried calamari is an awesome appetizer.  The only problem is that the restaurant makes you feel sub-human.  Yes, forcing customers to wait in a single file line outside the restaurant during the winter is messed up (really can't just take names?).  Everything is rushed.  You will enjoy your food, but you will do so quickly.  Food great, service meh, waiting time maybe worth it.

Reviews.Author: Rocco R.
Reviews.Content: Hands down one of the best restaurants I have ever been too in my life. Just walk down Hanover Street and look for the restaurant with the longest line outside. It is almost always Giacomo's. My freshmen year RA highly recommended it to everyone on my floor. Calamari is a MUST for appetizer. Usually for dinner I order the chicken parm or something off the specials. I know its a sin to order chicken parm at a nice italian restaurant but it is just so good here. Seafood is always fresh, due too Bostons proximity to the water. The fra diablo with lobster, clams, and calamari is excellent. Expect a 45 minute wait around dinner time and you actually have to stand in line! This is due too a limited amount of tables that can fit inside the restaurant. It does give the restaurant a nice atmosphere as you are almost spending dinner with the table you are seated next too. As for the prices, they are awesome! Very reasonable for the quality of food that is served. I cant wait too come back for more! 5 stars!

Reviews.Author: P.j. A.
Reviews.Content: Never a bad meal!

Reviews.Author: MS J.
Reviews.Content: This place is cool!  It is a really really tiny place, with maybe only 7-8 tables.  And they jam pack everybody in it.  My bf and I got in at about 7:30 on Friday night, and were seated right away at the bar, which was extremely hot since it was right next to the kitchen, and right under these bright lights that gave off extreme heat.  But that aside, the food was great.  The portion was very generous.  I ordered the special of the day which was half a lobster tail and a bunch of mussles on pasta.  And it was only $18!  It was a great deal and very very yummy.  The waitress was very helpful.  My bf helped me crack the lobster tail and she wetted the napkins with water and gave him to clean his hands.  Very thoughtful!   However, at the end of the meal we found out that they only take cash.   Wait.... what??  The plus side, there is an ATM right across the street.  But that just sucks.  I for one will never carry that much cash with me.

Reviews.Author: Scott B.
Reviews.Content: i would say that this is one of the better italian restaurants around.  not too expensive and i always have a good meal there - i cant complain and believe me i am good at it.  they always live up to their expectations there A+

Reviews.Author: Rita S.
Reviews.Content: this place rocks!

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth B.
Reviews.Content: Went here last night with my boyfriend, we are both huge foodies...it was amazing! I am very picky about atmosphere, service, and obviously quality of the food, and I have to say that this was one of the best meals I have ever had. We started off with the mussels in pesto sauce with garlic bread (a must for wiping up the delicious sauce) and then split the lobster ravioli (unreal). The prices were very reasonable for a North End Boston meal and our server was very friendly. The food came out very quickly. It is a small place and there is always a line down the street to get in (we arrived at 4:20ish so as not to wait in line and were outside by 5). The only downside is the rushed feeling of in and out you get from waiting, sitting down, eating, and then leaving. They really need to keep things moving in order to accomodate the customers outside who really want a bite! But, if you are in the mood for an incredible meal and do not mind the wait followed by a fast paced dining experience Giacomo's has to offer, then you should definitely check it out. It is well worth the experience for your taste buds alone. Thank you Giacomo's!

Reviews.Author: Deb L.
Reviews.Content: really good fresh Italian food.  agree with some other posters that you need to get there early and get in line.   portions are generous, prices are good.   shrimp scampi was awesome

Reviews.Author: Jason Y.
Reviews.Content: i am not a big fan of waiting outside to eat at a restaurant, but i must say, giacomo's was more than worth the 1hr wait. ann and i went on sunday evening around 8:30pm, and we proceeded to wait a little over 1hr (we were aided by some mike's pastries/cannolis). when we finally got inside, we were seated at the bar, with a perfect view of the kitchen/chefs/cooks busily preparing the damn tasty and well-priced italian fare. we started with a small order of the fried calamari, which i must say, was probably the best fried calamari i have had in awhile. the calamari was accompanied by some fried peppers, and the fried coating was done just right. for our main dishes, ann ordered the butternut squash ravioli and i had the frutti di mare w/giacomo sauce (red lobster sauce with a hint of bechamel). both dishes were amazing. butternut squash ravioli was a perfect combination of sweet butternut squash with savory cream sauce + priciutto filling while the frutti di mare was loaded with fresh scallops, mussels, shrimps and clams. linguini was cooked just right. i am a lover of pasta, and i am a lover of giacomo's.

Reviews.Author: Nicole P.
Reviews.Content: if this was the only place that i had gone to when i was visiting boston, the 9 hour flight still would have been worth it. a friend in seattle told me that this was one place not to miss when i was visiting his home turf, and was he ever right. we showed up at 4:50 and there was a line... always a good sign. we were the lucky last group to get in when the doors opened, and the line quickly was reaching down the street to the corner. awesome. the space was tiny, the air filled with the promising smell of wonderful food pouring out of the open kitchen and the sound of about 30 people ready to eat it. i brought 2 of my friends that i was visiting in boston (niether of which had been in before) to celebrate their engagement, and they were both amazed at the food. winelist was small but affordable, service was open, honest, and in your face. basicly, everything i love about eating out was showen here in this little boston restaurant: great food, great friends, great atmosphere, and people serving food that you can tell they believe in. i will be returning here everytime i am in the boston area. thank you.

Reviews.Author: D N.
Reviews.Content: traveling to boston would recommend hoofing on over to north end and walk the line of italian rests. a lot of places to choose from, but this one had a small line and worked for me. not the best ever, but good non meat options on menu and cheap vino. thumbs up for me.

Reviews.Author: Nicole S.
Reviews.Content: I don't quite get it.  With the glowing reviews, I really expected to be blown away by this food.  People were okay with waiting over an hour and still LOVED it!?  We didn't have to wait at all, and I still wouldn't go back.  I expected the crowded tables and the noise and actually found it charming.  But the food was unimpressive.  The calamari had good flavor, but it wasn't all that tender.  I also expected that ALL the pasta would be homemade.  Only the fusilli in one of the specials was homemade and all the other pastas were fricking Barilla!  I know, because there were boxes of it in the basement on the way to the ladies room.  This would be somewhat acceptable if the sauces were amazing, but the garlic in each of our dishes was completely overpowering. I had the veal marsala... good enough piece of meat, but the sauce was cloyingly sweet and garlicky.  Another in our party had the fettucini with peas and prusciutto... it was a basic alfredo with too much garlic.  The two guys got the fusilli with shrimp and lobster (a special).  They both said it was "pretty good".  I really wanted to go and see for myself what this place was all about, and I'm sure many others feel the same way.  Go and try to enjoy yourself, but head down on a weeknight at around 8:30pm if you don't want to be stuck in line waiting for Italian American food that hardly lives up to mediocre..

Reviews.Author: Marcus A.
Reviews.Content: Okay, so what am I missing? Generally uniform rave reviews here on yelp, the restaurant guide book, Zagat, gives it high marks and there's ALWAYS a line out front. So why did I leave tonight thinking this was just an average place? I arrived just after it opened (5:00 pm) so I was seated right away. If you want to avoid the nightly line, go early. The menu serves your basic Italian staples. Parmigianas, Marsalas, ravioli, etc. For the shellfish and linguine dishes, you have a choice of 5 sauces to choose from. Nothing to fancy. Portions are generous. My server, Rose, was polite and efficient. I've noticed many reviews comment on being rushed through their meal. I did not get that feeling but perhaps that was because it was just after the restaurant opened and there wasn't a line of people out front waiting to be seated. After placing my order, I was served some unimpressive bread. No butter, no accompaniments. There looked like what appeared to be a bottle of EVOO on my table for dipping the bread but since I had no dish to pour the liquid onto, I can't say for sure. Based on recommendations here on yelp, I started out with the fried calamari. It was good but personally, I think that Nico, just a few doors down the street does it much better. I then had the Frutti De Mare (scallops, shrimp, calamari, mussels and clams) served over linguine and I chose the scampi sauce. Again, it was good but no better or worse than what you can get at any number of other restaurants in the North End and certainly not worth waiting in line for. A couple of things to note: there are only 13 tables (guess they're not superstitious) and they're set very close to one another so private conversations are out of the question. It's also "cash only" however prices are reasonable (and there's an ATM across the street for those unaware). As I left the restaurant, I saw that the inevitable line had formed. Hope they thought it was worth the wait....but I doubt it. Moderately recommended as long as there's no line. If there's a line, keep walking.

Reviews.Author: Julia K.
Reviews.Content: great pasta, friendly service. had to wait around 40 minutes on a sunday night.

Reviews.Author: Purvi M.
Reviews.Content: The lobster ravioli is absolutely heavenly. We waited for an hour for dinner tonight (Sunday night) and it was completely worth it. The line was around the corner but luckily the people around us were funny and friendly so time passed by a bit faster. It is quite a small place and alot of the tables were so close that you were sharing tables with other groups but we lucked out and had the best seats in the house (right at the bar but it's only built for two). Since we were a party of two, we were seated ahead of at least four other groups (of 3 and larger). We were able to watch the cooks making all of the wonderful dishes. Also try the Italian beer, Peroni. Never had or even heard about it before today and I have never had a beer like it so it's hard to describe. So back to the food...the lobster ravioli was yummmmmy. It was not fishy tasting at all and the sauce it was in was creamy and delicious. It tasted completely fresh and for 14.95, I call it a bargain. The fusilli was perfectly al dente but my veggies were so finely chopped I could barely find them. Pretty much all of the entrees were pretty reasonably priced. It is a small place so unless you have lots of patience (especially on the weekends) and time wait it out; it is definitely a gem in the North End. One of the best Italian meals we have ever had.

Reviews.Author: Matt W.
Reviews.Content: marvelous place, well worth waiting outside. came at about 6 in a group of 4 on a thursday and waited maybe ~20 min. very reasonable prices(especially wine) for the exceptional quality of food, service, and ambiance. very cozy yet energetic vibe. best spot in north end, hands down. don't miss the calimari, second only to some i had in croatia.

Reviews.Author: Leah T.
Reviews.Content: a little bit cramped inside with a long wait but well worth it!!! one of the best pastas i've ever had. this is probably due to the fact that authentic italians are the cooks and servers. try the lobster ravioli, it's awesome!!

Reviews.Author: J B.
Reviews.Content: excellent

Reviews.Author: gator N.
Reviews.Content: love it!!!

Reviews.Author: Daniel H.
Reviews.Content: the calamari, lobster ravioli and their pastas are all amazing. one of the best restaurants in boston for sure

Reviews.Author: S K.
Reviews.Content: really great italian food and seafood! a great place to take out of town visitors. the portions are large. fruti de mare, calamari, butternut squash ravioli, lobster ravioli - ALL DELICIOUS! the north end place is small and if you don't get there right at 5:00 (or before) you have to wait. the south end location takes reservations, so if you have guests, plan early.
